excerpts: I got the three colored peanut dumplings  which was WAY TOO SWEET .
The B-kid Jellygrass was not sweet enough .
three colored peanut dumplings.author: Eileen L.
three colored peanut dumplings.review: Like I said in my review of 100% Healthy Dessert , since I've been working at a dessert place I've been paying more attention to desserts . I came here again twice a few weeks ago with my friend to try some new things . I got a pear juice which taste a little odd . I got the three colored peanut dumplings  which was WAY TOO SWEET . The B-kid Jellygrass was not sweet enough . The milk tea pudding tastes kind of bitter and odd . I also didn't like its texture .. it's mushy just like the mango pudding I ordered . The preserved pickle & sliced pork chow mein was WAY TOO SALTY . I decided to try the milk pudding because I've never had it before . It tasted very odd . Idk , maybe that's the way it's supposed to taste . The egg puffs were good though . Still like the ones at Eggette's more but the ones here are good too . This place has dropped two stars in my book . But since the owner or whoever was nice enough to read my review and tell me that he would improve things , I will give it an extra star . Also because I like the slogan for this place . Don't know what it is ? Next time you visit , read the back of the servers' shirts .

excerpts: #Hong Kong Style Egg Puff:

B.
Not crispy, and not hot enough.
hong kong style egg puff.author: Simon C.
hong kong style egg puff.review:
After finishing dim sum on a Saturday afternoon, was craving for some desserts. Saw this cafe with quite high rating and decided to give it a try.

It was around 3pm and the place was almost empty. Sat down and was quickly provided menus.

#Mixed Fruits Mango Pudding: B-.
The mango pudding was not very good. Usually a good one would have soft, smooth and silky texture but the one I had was a bit hard - I don't think it was because of over frozen but it's more related to the making process I suppose. The fruit was not fresh at all. Papaya and kiwi are the ones among the most disappointed ones.

#Hong Kong Style Egg Puff: B.
Not crispy, and not hot enough. More like eating soft bread.

#Silken Milk with Ginger: B-.
For some reasons, the top layer of this dish was very nice (my roommate was even saying the dish was a 5-star), but after digging down deeper it became worse and worse. Clearly it was also a making process type of thing.

I don't think I will go back again. Question: How come I still can't find a good Hong Kong style dessert joint in SF?

excerpts: I ordered soy sauce chicken wings, Hong Kong style egg puff and fried sweet bread.
They are so........
good!!!
I usually don't like fancy flavor in my food and drinks and these items are simple but very delicious.
I definitely will be back for more.
hong kong style egg puff.author: W C.
hong kong style egg puff.review:
This place is kinda out of the way of everything. I decide to try this place because the pictures people posted on Yelp look very good to me. 
I ordered soy sauce chicken wings, Hong Kong style egg puff and fried sweet bread. They are so........ good!!!  I usually don't like fancy flavor in my food and drinks and these items are simple but very delicious.  I definitely will be back for more.

excerpts: We ordered the Mango Madness, Strawberry Madness, and the Hong Kong style egg puff.
The strawberry madness really was a delicious conglomerate of strawberry madness.
The mango madness was pretty similar, except it had a lot more mango pieces in it.
The egg puff was pretty unique, but tasted really good for something so simple.
Overall, this place was great and was very cheap as well!
hong kong style egg puff.author: Dmitriy S.
hong kong style egg puff.review:
After battling the Pho Challenge across the street and failing miserably, we were looking for a good dessert place to just relax and eat some yummy Chinese desserts. This place turned out to be exactly what we were looking for!

At first, the waitress was a bit slow taking our orders and messed up, but it happens with a large group of people. At 11pm on a Monday night, this place still had quite a good amount of customers. 

We ordered the Mango Madness, Strawberry Madness, and the Hong Kong style egg puff. The strawberry madness really was a delicious conglomerate of strawberry madness. It consisted of strawberry jello, (but not the kind you get out of a box from Safeway) covered with strawberry ice cream, pieces of strawberry and whipped cream. The mango madness was pretty similar, except it had a lot more mango pieces in it. The egg puff was pretty unique, but tasted really good for something so simple. Overall, this place was great and was very cheap as well!

excerpts: I went there with my friends and we got battered onion rings, red bean shaved ice, and sesame egg puff.
There was not much onion rings.
The red bean shaved ice tastes like how every other place makes it.
The sesame egg puff was okay
, sesame seeds on it, I though it was going to be the sesame paste.
I think it would've tasted better with the paste.
The owner totaled up our bill wrong, but I it was just a mistake.
He is kind of old anyways.
Pretty good experience, but
I wished their tea would come in a mug instead of a plastic cup.
sesame egg puff.author: Janet Z.
sesame egg puff.review: Service was so so.  Not much people were there when I was there, which was around 3something near 4. I thought it was closed when I was two blocks away because it looked like it was closed..There is a Happy Hour type of menu. The things are a little cheaper.  I went there with my friends and we got battered onion rings, red bean shaved ice, and sesame egg puff. There was not much onion rings. The red bean shaved ice tastes like how every other place makes it. The sesame egg puff was okay, sesame seeds on it, I though it was going to be the sesame paste. I think it would've tasted better with the paste. The owner totaled up our bill wrong, but I it was just a mistake. He is kind of old anyways.  Pretty good experience, but I wished their tea would come in a mug instead of a plastic cup.

excerpts: I like the waffle and add green tea ice cream!
waffle.author: Celi R.
waffle.review:
Love this place for its:

I like the waffle and add green tea ice cream! Checkout my full review here:

waffle.review: This Cafe is amazing definitely get the fruite and ice cream waffle. Especially if you have the munchies q

excerpts: Texture was soft and not cone or waffle-like.
waffle.author: Daniel L.
waffle.review:
I came by to get an order of sesame egg puffs to go and it was another 3.5 star experience. A huge dinner earlier had prevented me from going after their Friday and Saturday sweet tofu specials, but my egg puffs was good enough of a dessert to do the job. My egg puffs ($2.50), came with a slightly noticeable sesame flavor to compliment with a heavy eggy taste. There were some air holes but it was not as bad as the ones from Eggettes or Genki Crepes. Texture was soft and not cone or waffle-like. 

Service was decent as I was offered tea once the server realized it was taking a little long for my egg puffs to arrive. However, I wasn't quite sure why I was charged a sales tax even when my order was made to go. Still a step behind 100% Sweet Cafe but better than the other two competitors aforementioned, 3.5 stars for above average egg puffs.

excerpts: Waffle w/ ice cream looked like Richard Simmons had vomited into a bowl.
waffle.author: Roy C.
waffle.review:
Definitely not my favorite cafe, not even close. It's so bad that they had to shamelessly name themselves "My Favorite Cafe" just so someone would actually call it that, because otherwise, those words would never come out of anyone's mouth talking about this place.

Green bean sweet soup had strange, burnt chunks in it.
Condensed milk & butter toast had too much toast, too little flavor.
Hong kong style eggs were flavorless.
Waffle w/ ice cream looked like Richard Simmons had vomited into a bowl.

If you want Chinese desserts, this is definitely not the place to go.

excerpts: Black sesame paste, milk custard, egg custard, sesame dumplings, black sticky rice, grass jelly, HK-style waffle
I also got a HK-STYLE WAFFLE with peanut butter and condensed milk (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VxT3LXwPdHEz1qpXeI5hig?select=9sWRf79iCpmsohQtvGwFfw).
This wasn't great, but at least it was edible.
The waffle itself didn't seem fresh, though they are made to order.
It was hard and served at room temperature - not like the waffles I had in HK at all.
waffle.author: Steph L.
waffle.review:
I can never make up my mind when it comes to Chinese desserts. Black sesame paste, milk custard, egg custard, sesame dumplings, black sticky rice, grass jelly, HK-style waffle - I want them all!

This is why during my last visit to MFC I got the steamed EGG CUSTARD WITH SESAME PASTE combo. BIG MISTAKE. They serve the sesame paste at the bottom and the egg custard on top (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VxT3LXwPdHEz1qpXeI5hig?select=8mfWLulw-OuRdamwIFYbFw). (I assume that they pour the egg custard mixture on top of the sesame paste and then steam the whole thing.) The sesame paste itself was actually decent but the egg custard was absolutely disgusting. Why, you ask? It was undercook and still runny in the center (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VxT3LXwPdHEz1qpXeI5hig?select=LEihGlrvrQeSofUQHxKl0w). This would've so much better had they cooked the egg custard at the bottom first... 

I also got a HK-STYLE WAFFLE with peanut butter and condensed milk (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VxT3LXwPdHEz1qpXeI5hig?select=9sWRf79iCpmsohQtvGwFfw). This wasn't great, but at least it was edible. The waffle itself didn't seem fresh, though they are made to order. It was hard and served at room temperature - not like the waffles I had in HK at all. There wasn't enough peanut butter but they were very generous with the condensed milk.

This was a 2-star visit, but previous visits bump my rating up to 3 stars. I know they can do better!

excerpts: Egg Waffle - a unique texture
In a nutshell it was all very delicious AND brought me back to Taiwan.
waffle.author: Andrew K.
waffle.review:
Very good. We had.
LOTS OF TEA REFILLS FOR FREE.
Mango Yum Yum - fresh/refreshing
Peanut Butter Condensed Milk Sandwich - very yummy - better than PB&J
Black Rice with Warm Coconut Milk - tasted healthy in a good way
Steamed Milk Custard - reminiscent of Cream of Wheat or a hot milk to help you go to bed
and Egg Waffle - a unique texture
In a nutshell it was all very delicious AND brought me back to Taiwan.

excerpts: I always get my usual tofu  fa with mixed fruit, somebody always gets the french fries, the chicken sandwich, eggettes, ice cream waffle, ice lemon tea, etc etc.
This place does get pretty busy later at night so come earlier to get a seat or be prepared to wait
but its never that long.
waffle.author: Sarah L.
waffle.review:
Met some friends here last night for dessert. Its our usual dessert place. Wouldn't say its our favorite (in terms of taste) but they never rush us, we can sit/hang out/catch up with friends for as long as we like, and they'll always refill the hot tea. Which is what dessert is all about for us, especially since we don't get to see much of each other during the week anymore (post college days).

We've come here a lot over the years so we've tried our share of the menu. Nothings ever amazing but its not bad either. I always get my usual tofu  fa with mixed fruit, somebody always gets the french fries, the chicken sandwich, eggettes, ice cream waffle, ice lemon tea, etc etc. This place does get pretty busy later at night so come earlier to get a seat or be prepared to wait but its never that long.

excerpts: The golden sesame dumplings were so crispy on the outside, the fried chicken leg was huge, the "fun fun mango" was creative, the beer battered onion rings didn't fall apart at all, and the sweet waffle sandwich was to die for.
Keep this up and it'll really be my favorite cafe.
My favorite was the sweet waffle sandwich.
JONASAPPROVED!
They finally extended their busines hours to close past midnight instead of 11pm
so I decided to give it another try.
A lot of the desserts/sauces seemed watered down, but the food still tasted alright.
It's very loud in a Chinesey way, if that makes any sense at all.
Just picture a crowded room of Chinese folks yelling at each other in Chinese.
waffle.author: Jonas T.
waffle.review:
UPDATE 7/29 - Changed from 3 stars to 4 stars

This place has improved a lot since I last came here a month ago. I didn't order the same things as last time, but nothing disappointed me at all this time. The portions were fair for its price and the food looked and tasted delicious. The golden sesame dumplings were so crispy on the outside, the fried chicken leg was huge, the "fun fun mango" was creative, the beer battered onion rings didn't fall apart at all, and the sweet waffle sandwich was to die for. Keep this up and it'll really be my favorite cafe.

My favorite was the sweet waffle sandwich. JONASAPPROVED!

-------------------

They finally extended their busines hours to close past midnight instead of 11pm so I decided to give it another try. A lot of the desserts/sauces seemed watered down, but the food still tasted alright. It's very loud in a Chinesey way, if that makes any sense at all. Just picture a crowded room of Chinese folks yelling at each other in Chinese. 

Soy sauce chicken wings are delicious, and you can never go wrong with steamed rice noodle rolls no matter how watered down the peanut sauce is. JONASAPPROVED!

excerpts: It was pretty tasty, though the waffle was not quite what I was expecting.

I prefer the liege-style waffles at Syrup in Los Angeles to this place, but this place does have a quite a bit of variety on their menu so I would definitely be open to coming back here to try something else.
The service was a bit slow, but considering how busy it was when we came here I guess it was to be expected.
waffle.author: Chris C.
waffle.review:
Before I came here, I didn't know this place was actually called "My Favorite Cafe." My friend who we were staying with in the city kept saying "I want to take you guys to my favorite cafe!", so when we all got here and saw the sign we got a good laugh.

I tried one of their HK-style waffles with fresh fruit and strawberry & vanilla ice cream. It was pretty tasty, though the waffle was not quite what I was expecting. I prefer the liege-style waffles at Syrup in Los Angeles to this place, but this place does have a quite a bit of variety on their menu so I would definitely be open to coming back here to try something else. The service was a bit slow, but considering how busy it was when we came here I guess it was to be expected.

excerpts: Some are really suck such as the HK Style Waffle.
Firstly, the waffle itself is so chewy like plastic.
The original HK style waffle should be fluffy and light.
Secondly, the waffle is round in shape while the original is square.
Thirdly, the filling is not the same.
waffle.author: Roserrele W.
waffle.review:
I like to bring my kids to this place because it is easy to grab a table. This place used to be always full especially after dinner time. I remember that I have always need to go somewhere else because the waiting line was just unbeliveably long some years ago. Now, this place is on the downslope because of the challenge of 100% Sweet which is only a few blocks away.

Honestly, not every item in My Favorite Cafe is good. Some are really suck such as the HK Style Waffle. Firstly, the waffle itself is so chewy like plastic. The original HK style waffle should be fluffy and light. Secondly, the waffle is round in shape while the original is square. Thirdly, the filling is not the same. It should be some condensed sweeten milk, peanut butter, shredded coconut and sugar.

The sweet soups are mostly okay, not great. I have tried red bean soup, tofu soup, sesame soup and they are just okay. I would expect more and am able to find better ones elsewhere.

The ones that we love to order are egg buffs (vanilla and chocolate are good) and ice cream (2 scopes that can feed 2 kids at $2.50). Chicken wings are fine and noodles are okay, not big in portion.

We come here because of convenience and the fact that no waiting is required. Parking is a bit difficult in the neighborhood. We always need to park a few blocks away. But, it is a good gathering place for friends and we would come back again.

excerpts: Tried the waffle with ice cream and fruit which was not bad.
The dish is served with various fruits and ice cream (Strawberry and mango) on top of a asian waffle with whipped cream.
Prices here are very cheap.
The dish is served with various fruits and ice cream (Strawberry and mango) on top of a asian waffle with whipped cream.
Prices here are very cheap.
Cost only $5.50 for the waffle!
Wouldn't mind returning in the future to try some other things.
Overall not bad
waffle.author: Miss H K.
waffle.review:
My friends suggested we go here for a late Saturday night dessert.
This place was definitely busy considering it was after midnight but we were seated promptly and served quickly.
Tried the waffle with ice cream and fruit which was not bad. The dish is served with various fruits and ice cream (Strawberry and mango) on top of a asian waffle with whipped cream. 
Prices here are very cheap. Cost only $5.50 for the waffle!
Wouldn't mind returning in the future to try some other things.
Overall not bad

excerpts: Last time we also ordered steam rice noodles and waffle.
the waffle is nothing but the prepacked ones from grocery shop and filled with lots of cream and fruits.
waffle.author: Janita s.
waffle.review:
good coffee pudding and steam eggs but very bad drinks.  the drinks are pretty watery and overly sweet after 3 times of visit.  It's a typical chinese dessert place where don't expect any good service but they open late so it's a good hangout spot late at night.  

I'll go back for the pudding but probably that's all.  Last time we also ordered steam rice noodles and waffle.  the waffle is nothing but the prepacked ones from grocery shop and filled with lots of cream and fruits.

excerpts: The girl showed me a photo of a "Hong Kong waffle".
It had little puffs, with different fillings in it.
I reminded her that I was the guy here, late last night, ordering a chocolate waffle - but she gave me the standard item, instead.
Her response: you ordered the standard.
waffle.author: Ken M.
waffle.review:
Great, I thought: a good place that's open late, for desserts, within walking distance of my home.  I'll come here, often. Was I wrong!

The girl showed me a photo of a "Hong Kong waffle". It had little puffs, with different fillings in it. I told her I had lived in HK for 3.5 years, and never heard of this dish; but I'd be willing to try it, if only they had chocolate filling. She said of course they have chocolate, so I said, "good, give me a chocolate".

Very disappointing to discover, at home, that it was NOT chocolate, but some gooey, tasteless yellowish paste filling. I saved it, to take it back.

Next day, I was walking by, and went in to see the same girl. I reminded her that I was the guy here, late last night, ordering a chocolate waffle - but she gave me the standard item, instead. Her response: you ordered the standard. I reminded her of the conversation, but she was adamant. 

I figured I could handle that, in the future, so I said, give me a chocolate, now. I figured they would at least discount it. But she charged me full price. As she came back from the kitchen, I saw a sign, flat on the counter: "To-go" orders, $0.15 extra charge. I thought,  they have to be kidding; to-go is cheaper for them. How can they charge extra for it? So I asked her if she was charging me extra. She said, "of course".

At which point I told her to keep the food I had already paid for, that she was a thief, and that I won't ever be back, and that I'll tell a lot of people, on Yelp, about that place.

It's not MY favorite anything!

excerpts: and I like the way they cut the waffle really small,
but it is kind of oily.
waffle.author: Isabelle L.
waffle.review:
The reason I want to try MY FAVORITE CAFE because I was reading the review from Yelp and a lot of ppl gave good review. I decide to go there to try it on Sunday afternoon. 
We order the Hong Kong waffles and I like the way they cut the waffle really small, but it is kind of oily.  the price is really good and it is only 3.75. :-)

Also, we order the mango chow fun that make with coconut . it is really interesting , but the coconut chow fun look alike taste really refreshing.   I love it...

excerpts: tonight, we waited for our waffle sundae to come out for an ungodly amount of time, but I think part of that was to blame on the waitstaff - they have some majorly ditzy girls working there right now, but they were eager to help, and came around and refilled the hot tea that is always served.
waffle.author: Jessica S.
waffle.review:
I really, really fretted about writing my 100th review, but this happened in the perfect place at the perfect time. 

I've been coming to My Favorite Cafe (or MFC, for short) for several years now; they have always been open late enough that if we got off work at the movie theater, we could get here and indulge in dessert or 'fourth meal', as we were still amped up from working all night. We started coming here so often for a spell that the owner would always say 'hi' when we walked in, immediately seat us, regardless of the hour, and would take our orders in a timely fashion. We've watched them turn people away who walked in right after us - now THAT'S service to loyal patrons! Another bonus about MFC is that they don't have a minimum (as far as I can tell) per person for ordering - which means you don't HAVE to get something even if your friends have the munchies; many places do have this kind of rule, and I find it to be stupid. Nicely done MFC.

They have a pretty basic setup; when you walk in, there are a row of tables to your right for smaller parties - say, less than 4, and some rounds pushed together for parties of 5 or more. There's a stack of magazines in the back in Chinese, and they always have some kind of entertainment channel running on the TV in the back, and I think they offer wireless now too. There are also 2 front seats with four comfy chairs, but be warned it's ALWAYS cold in those window nooks! It can feel more private sitting over there, but it can make it more of a challenge to flag down a server to get stuff taken care of. 

MFC has an extensive menu, and there is always something that you want on it, from egg puffs to sundaes to hot desserts to numerous cold desserts to savories like fish balls and fries. We usually order at least one of everything I have named, and we have still not tried everything on the menu - there are close to 130+ items. While the fruit is not as fresh as Creations, they make up for it in the level of extensive menu, and having things on the menu clearly labeled, which is a plus when you are allergic to peanuts (this has been a problem for me in other Chinese dessert cafes). They are usually pretty quick about turning the orders out, but things can come out unevenly from time to time - tonight, we waited for our waffle sundae to come out for an ungodly amount of time, but I think part of that was to blame on the waitstaff - they have some majorly ditzy girls working there right now, but they were eager to help, and came around and refilled the hot tea that is always served. 

I have been so many times, and cannot remember a single time I walked away disappointed. I am always blessed with good friends who go with me, and we always have had a good time.

Parking can be a nightmare here, and it's cash only, but for now, it will always be "My Favorite Cafe"

excerpts: There's was the black sticky rice with coconut milk which was not too sweet at all and the best waffle and ice cream I've ever laid eyes on.
Overall I thought the desserts were good.
waffle.author: Jeanne L.
waffle.review: Its just like any other Asian dessert spot.  I came with a huge group after a wedding banquet so I got to try a few other items. There's was the black sticky rice with coconut milk which was not too sweet at all and the best waffle and ice cream I've ever laid eyes on.  Overall I thought the desserts were good. I had the coconut milk with white fungus and tapioca. It was really good and don't let the name fool you.They also have chocolate chip egg puffs! How weird is that?! Gotta try it yourself.

excerpts: The waffle was like chewing on cardboard, the fruit wasn't fresh at all, and they gave us the wrong ice cream flavors =(.
I guess you pay for what you get.
waffle.author: Clifford C.
waffle.review: Had the waffles with ice cream and fruit and a mango pudding.  Although it is not super expensive, I would say it wasn't all too great.  The waffle was like chewing on cardboard, the fruit wasn't fresh at all, and they gave us the wrong ice cream flavors =(.  I guess you pay for what you get.

excerpts: I always order the waffle sandwich with condensed milk and peanut butter, curry fish balls, ramen, and steamed chang fen.
Every time I eat there I think about all those times I spent at the little Central snack at the CUHK campus.
waffle.author: Rennie C.
waffle.review: This past weekend I was in San Francisco and I drove past My Favorite Cafe. Aside from the fact that this place only takes cash, I really have to say that this is one of my favorite dessert/snack place to go to in San Francisco. It's not that their food is super duper yummy fabulous, but it's the fact they remind me a lot of Hong Kong. I always order the waffle sandwich with condensed milk and peanut butter, curry fish balls, ramen, and steamed chang fen. Every time I eat there I think about all those times I spent at the little Central snack at the CUHK campus.

excerpts: - the waffle with ice cream and fruit: the waffle was crispy.
and the fruit was decent.
the ice cream was.. meh.
more icy than creamy.
waffle.author: geneive j.
waffle.review:
i'm always down for a place that you can roll hella late, sit there forever playing your cards, and nosh on a gigantic menu of treats.. yay.

i went here cuz it was past twelve and my bf and i had a serious case of the munchies.. so we ordered: 
- the eggettes: pretty good. but not as crispy as i would have wanted it.
- the waffle with ice cream and fruit: the waffle was crispy. and the fruit was decent. the ice cream was.. meh. more icy than creamy.
- the taro with tapioca: i thought it was a drink. it wasn't. it was a bowl with warm taro and tapioca. i was pleasantly surprised.
- the peanut butter thick toast: f-ing awesome. nuff said.
- and this "speacial tofu dish with red bean and sesame paste" that didn't have any tofu in it: wtf? minus one star. boooo. i wanted tofu.

other than that.. it was chill. i'd go back and try some more stuff.. maybe this time i'll bring board games and sit in the comfy chairs by the window..

excerpts: Ya got to try the waffle ice cream sandwich!!
lovin it.....the sandwich.
They got tons of great desserts.
and i know people that love their curry balls...
fish.
So go there now.
and tell Philip I need more watermelon or ill hold the RiceRolls for ransome.
waffle.author: Mark F.
waffle.review: Great place to hang out. friendly customer service. They GOT EGG PUFF!! always crispy. and i love those Peek A Pooh machines!!!  Ya got to try the waffle ice cream sandwich!! lovin it.....the sandwich. They got tons of great desserts. and i know people that love their curry balls...fish. So go there now. and tell Philip I need more watermelon or ill hold the RiceRolls for ransome.

excerpts: My favorites are sago w/ coconut milk, waffle with fresh fruit and ice cream and the coffee tea.
waffle.author: Jennie N.
waffle.review: My Favorite Cafe is absloutely my favorite cafe for Chinese desserts. They have  a large selection of both savory and sweet foods. My favorites are sago w/ coconut milk, waffle with fresh fruit and ice cream and the coffee tea.

excerpts: They probably had only one waffle maker or something.
Everyone was almost already finished eating, but about three of us hadn't even got our orders yet.
The service was extremely slow, but the food was pretty good.
waffle.author: Jade V.
waffle.review: We came here last night for a friend's birthday. She wanted dessert, so one of our friends recommended this cafe. We got here around 7:30PM, but everyone lagged and we didn't start ordering until about 9:00PM. The majority of us ordered the waffles with mixed fruit and ice cream. We didn't know it takes FOREVER just to make one order. They probably had only one waffle maker or something. Everyone was almost already finished eating, but about three of us hadn't even got our orders yet. The service was extremely slow, but the food was pretty good.

excerpts: ordered the waffle with fresh fruit and ice cream.
i ended up with a partly burnt waffle with bitter ice cream and some can fruits.
my friend ordered black sticky rice with fresh fruits to give it a try, since the worker said it was good and sweet.
the black sticky rice was bitter and it didn't even taste cooked.
the rice was still hard and the only good thing about the it was the "fresh" fruits.
i ended up with a partly burnt waffle with bitter ice cream and some can fruits.
my friend ordered black sticky rice with fresh fruits to give it a try, since the worker said it was good and sweet.
the black sticky rice was bitter and it didn't even taste cooked.
the rice was still hard and the only good thing about the it was the "fresh" fruits.

waffle.review: ordered the waffle with fresh fruit and ice cream. i ended up with a partly burnt waffle with bitter ice cream and some can fruits. my friend ordered black sticky rice with fresh fruits to give it a try, since the worker said it was good and sweet. the black sticky rice was bitter and it didn't even taste cooked. the rice was still hard and the only good thing about the it was the "fresh" fruits.

excerpts: I ordered their fried banana ice cream with a side of fruit.
They have tons of items to choose from and traditional Chinese desserts.
There weren't many people inside at the time,(probably due to the windy weather), so it didn't take too long to get our food.
They have a TV planted on the wall
so we watched some wrestling in Spanish.
The fried banana and ice cream comes with 2 scoops of ice
The fried banana and ice cream comes with 2 scoops of ice
fried banana.author: Grace Anne D.
fried banana.review:
After getting some sushi, I immediately started craving for some fruit so I yelped on what was nearby and I found this place. 

This area in San Francisco is filled with little mom and pop shops, hidden hole-in-the-wall's, just overall great foodie places that I've seen so far. This place wasn't amazing looking inside but the dessert we received made up for it.

I ordered their fried banana ice cream with a side of fruit. They have tons of items to choose from and traditional Chinese desserts. There weren't many people inside at the time,(probably due to the windy weather), so it didn't take too long to get our food. They have a TV planted on the wall so we watched some wrestling in Spanish. The fried banana and ice cream comes with 2 scoops of ice cream(you can choose vanilla, chocolate, green tea(?) and strawberry(?)) and it came with a mix of cantaloupe, honey dew and watermelon fruit balls. The fried bananas were delicious and not doused in heavy batter which other places tend to do. 

The service was good too. The guy who helped us out was very friendly and welcoming. :) definitely coming back for more desserts !

excerpts:
Eventually, I ordered the fried banana which came with two scoops of ice cream, I chose green tea and mango. 
- The fried banana inside tasted delicious but the outside batter tasted more like just oil than batter. 
I couldn't stand eating more than half of what was given.
fried banana.author: Cassy Y.
fried banana.review:
Came here on a Saturday night after dinner looking for some desserts. The waitress was kind of slow to answer questions especially when I asked in english. My Chinese wasn't good enough to ask in Chinese hence why I stuck with English (their menu had English, too). I asked what flavors of ice cream did they have, she answered (with a little bit of difficulty), I asked is that all?, and she was kind of confused after that. 

Eventually, I ordered the fried banana which came with two scoops of ice cream, I chose green tea and mango. 
- The fried banana inside tasted delicious but the outside batter tasted more like just oil than batter. I couldn't stand eating more than half of what was given. 
- The green tea ice cream was TASTELESS and ODD. There was no green tea flavor almost, random pieces of (what I can guess) dried fruit, and tasted like freezer burn or ice cream that was melted and re-frozen multiple times. 
- Finally, the mango ice cream tasted the best out of the whole dish and I'm not even a big fan of mango! It tasted fresh, perfect level of sweetness, and refreshing. 

I'm not sure if they buy or make their own ice cream, but I'm extremely disappointed with the green tea ice cream as it is my favorite flavor. I think if I were to go back to try this place again I'd give their food and their egg puffs a try. I'll be avoiding their green tea ice cream, unfortunately. 

Note: Free hot tea on a cold winter day was very welcomed! CASH ONLY PLACE.

excerpts: I've tried the mango delight, the waffles with ice cream, and the fried banana which were all good.
But I cant figure out their ice cream...
their strawberry taste too strawberry almost fake and their coconut is a bit to coconutty for me, but it tastes fine eaten with whatever its served.
fried banana.author: Maritess N.
fried banana.review: This is the place I go to when I get a weird Asian dessert craving. Its the first Asian dessert place I have been to & I don't mind it (I'm still trying out other places). The best part is that their open super late! Easy to get to with lots of parking. I've tried the mango delight, the waffles with ice cream, and the fried banana which were all good. But I cant figure out their ice cream... their strawberry taste too strawberry almost fake and their coconut is a bit to coconutty for me, but it tastes fine eaten with whatever its served.

excerpts: The steamed rice noodles are the best here too.
steamed rice noodles.author: Renee L.
steamed rice noodles.review:
I can't say this is my favorite cafe, but it is in my top three for HK dessert in the Richmond/Sunset area.  I have been coming here for ages and I like that not much has changed.  Still don't like parking in the area though.  They still show random talk shows on the TV, are still a popular hangout for large young groups, still have so many off-menu items taped all over, have old men playing Chinese checkers loudly at night...  And they still use real ingredients for their desserts.  This place is the best if you're looking for traditional Chinese desserts. 

Lately, my favorite has been the sweet potato soup (番薯糖水) which has a heavenly amount of ginger in it.  It's got an amazing spicy punch and it's hard to find anywhere else but home that will add so much ginger into the soup.  They also use different types of sweet potatoes so you've got shades of purples, oranges, and yellows while you eat.  Recently, they've also had steamed milk custard with durian (榴蓮燉奶) and it is a bowl of steamed milk chock full of durian pieces.  Of course, if you want something more normal, the mango delight (mango pomelo sago soup, 楊枝甘露) is a great safe choice. The steamed rice noodles are the best here too.  Overall good value across the menu. 

I believe it is cash only.

excerpts: but I resorted to the Steamed Rice Noodles, Snow Frog w/
Steamed rice noodles always taste delicious
, I love that it's served with sriracha.
And the Snow Frog
w/Half Papaya was pretty good...
steamed rice noodles.author: Eleanor E.
steamed rice noodles.review:
My best friend and I decided to go to a dessert cafe after our shift at work.  Our first choice was so packed and busy that we decided to find a different spot and stumbled upon this cafe.

The place looked a little bigger than our primary choice and it wasn't as busy.  The menus were laid down nicely on the tables and the women working seemed nice.

A lot of the food on the menu sounded REALLY GOOD.  I wanted to order just about everything but I resorted to the Steamed Rice Noodles, Snow Frog w/ Half a Papaya, and Fresh Strawberry Juice.

The juice was fantastic, I love strawberries and I loved that they even carry such a thing on their menu.  Steamed rice noodles always taste delicious, I love that it's served with sriracha.  And the Snow Frog w/Half Papaya was pretty good... The ice cream melts pretty fast but it's super fulfilling.

It's definitely a place we both would come back to to try out more food :D

excerpts: I love the steamed rice noodles with hoisin & sesame peanut butter and the French fries.
steamed rice noodles.author: Kathy L.
steamed rice noodles.review:
This is one of my default dessert places even though I rarely eat dessert whenever I go. I love the steamed rice noodles with hoisin & sesame peanut butter and the French fries. Their club sandwich and chicken sandwich are also pretty good too.

The service can be either spot-on or spotty. They are usually friendly and good with refilling tea. 

It's one of those places where you can go if you want to just chill somewhere late at night.

excerpts: I ordered soy sauce chicken wings, Hong Kong style egg puff and fried sweet bread.
They are so........
good!!!
I usually don't like fancy flavor in my food and drinks and these items are simple but very delicious.
I definitely will be back for more.
soy sauce chicken wings.author: W C.
soy sauce chicken wings.review:
This place is kinda out of the way of everything. I decide to try this place because the pictures people posted on Yelp look very good to me. 
I ordered soy sauce chicken wings, Hong Kong style egg puff and fried sweet bread. They are so........ good!!!  I usually don't like fancy flavor in my food and drinks and these items are simple but very delicious.  I definitely will be back for more.

excerpts: - Soy Sauce Chicken Wings:
Oh man those chicken wangs are tasty!!
soy sauce chicken wings.author: Anonymous P.
soy sauce chicken wings.review:
This cafe has become to be a favorite for my sister, myself and even my kiddies. 

I love that this place stays open late, that their affordable (cheap, delicious eats in SF) and they even have HH tea time menu (everyday from 230pm-530pm). A bit of a drive if you're coming from the other side of town *we're from the Bayview District* but gas and money well spent when you're done. 

So far we're tried.. 

- Beef Stew Noodle Soup: Rice noodles, flavorful beef stew, cabbage in a plain broth. *Definitely needs a little see yao (soy sauce) than you're ready to dive in. 

- Soy Sauce Chicken Wings: Oh man those chicken wangs are tasty!! If you're a chicken wang person like myself and kiddies than be sure to grab an order or two!!

- French Fries: Bc they're simple to snack on and keeps my kiddies quiet for the time being while I'm trying to yelp!!

- Egg Puffs: Seems everyone has come here for their egg puffs and they don't disappoint either. They're fresh and piping hot.

- Warm Cola with Lemon: If you're a super Asian person, you know what I'm talking about. Yes folks, warm cola with a hint of lemon. 

- Milk Tea w/boba: Bc being a boba lover, you can't see boba on a menu and not have a try. *I still prefer Belly Good Cafe and Crepes' milk tea located in Japantown bc it's sweeter and creamier.* 

- Steamed Rice Rolls: Bc I LOVE my noodle dishes. Plain, tiny rice rolls, steamed of course accompanied with hoisin dipping sauce. Simple and yet satisfying. 

A absolute great place for late night cravings, whether you're craving a snack or dessert!

excerpts: Soy sauce chicken wings use way more soy sauce than they need and are kinda overcooked.
You can see on the plate that the soy sauce itself is really dried up.
I did really enjoy the cheung fun here though.
My favorite part of that dish is the peanut butter sauce, and here they just completely dump the cheung fun into a bowl of it with the other sauces on the side.
soy sauce chicken wings.author: Allen C.
soy sauce chicken wings.review:
I always get thrown off by the name of this place whenever people mention it.

The food is decent, but you can find better HK dessert/cafe places in the Richmond district. I guess one advantage of this place is that it's a bit more spacious. Places like Kowloon Tong and Golden Island are super cramped, while Creations just doesn't have that many tables.

Macaroni soup noodles here are average. They throw in a bunch of random flaky things into the soup which I wasn't fond of. Soy sauce chicken wings use way more soy sauce than they need and are kinda overcooked. You can see on the plate that the soy sauce itself is really dried up. I did really enjoy the cheung fun here though. My favorite part of that dish is the peanut butter sauce, and here they just completely dump the cheung fun into a bowl of it with the other sauces on the side.

excerpts: I had the ramen dish with spam, egg, soy sauce chicken wings and little pieces of beef that normally come in beef noodle soup.
Yummy!
Probably super easy to make but who cares? ..
soy sauce chicken wings.author: Jenny T.
soy sauce chicken wings.review:
Love this place!

What an awesome discovery. Came here late at night when I was craving boba because apparently, according to yelp, this is the only place open in the whole of SF that sells boba past midnight (is that possible??.. this is SF folks, not Boise). I had the ramen dish with spam, egg, soy sauce chicken wings and little pieces of beef that normally come in beef noodle soup. Yummy! Probably super easy to make but who cares? ..and of course, I got my boba fix =)

Also, this place is really Asian'd out. Like everyone is super hipster asian (high school/college/post college crowd). I was telling a friend that at least one of us had to know someone there and 2 seconds later, I realize that the girl sitting in the table next to me was a college buddy. Small world.

excerpts: Soy sauce chicken wings are delicious, and you can never go wrong with steamed rice noodle rolls no matter how watered down the peanut sauce is.
JONASAPPROVED!
soy sauce chicken wings.author: Jonas T.
soy sauce chicken wings.review:
UPDATE 7/29 - Changed from 3 stars to 4 stars

This place has improved a lot since I last came here a month ago. I didn't order the same things as last time, but nothing disappointed me at all this time. The portions were fair for its price and the food looked and tasted delicious. The golden sesame dumplings were so crispy on the outside, the fried chicken leg was huge, the "fun fun mango" was creative, the beer battered onion rings didn't fall apart at all, and the sweet waffle sandwich was to die for. Keep this up and it'll really be my favorite cafe.

My favorite was the sweet waffle sandwich. JONASAPPROVED!

-------------------

They finally extended their busines hours to close past midnight instead of 11pm so I decided to give it another try. A lot of the desserts/sauces seemed watered down, but the food still tasted alright. It's very loud in a Chinesey way, if that makes any sense at all. Just picture a crowded room of Chinese folks yelling at each other in Chinese. 

Soy sauce chicken wings are delicious, and you can never go wrong with steamed rice noodle rolls no matter how watered down the peanut sauce is. JONASAPPROVED!

excerpts:
My favorite selections are posted in the picture section, but my recommendations are as follows:

- Peanut Butter French Toast
- Mixed Fruit in honey dew juice with sago
- Mango Madness
- Strawberry Madness
- Instant noodles with fried egg and spam
- Soy sauce chicken wings
soy sauce chicken wings.author: Michael J.
soy sauce chicken wings.review:
My Favorite Cafe is my favorite cafe!

When I'm hungry and when it's late at night, this is my top choice of places of going to get some snacks and desserts. Probably the only time I come here is when I am hanging out with my Asian friends, but other than that I'm rarely here. This place offers affordable snacks and desserts and a place to just talk and play card games or what not. 

Yes, why do I think this is the best in the city, it's because the variety of things you can get here is probably greater here than other places. I mean yes other places have good variety, but this is the only place that has good variety and tastes good as well. The only thing that sucks about this place is it's location. It's located all the way out in the Richmond District where there is no parking whatsoever. Yes you can drive around and get lucky, but if not, try walking 3-5 blocks. What sucks even more is that once you get to the front door of the cafe, some car leaves right in front of the place. 

Anyhow, my definite top choice in late night cafes is My Favorite Cafe hands down.  My favorite selections are posted in the picture section, but my recommendations are as follows:

- Peanut Butter French Toast
- Mixed Fruit in honey dew juice with sago
- Mango Madness
- Strawberry Madness
- Instant noodles with fried egg and spam
- Soy sauce chicken wings

excerpts:
Favorites include:

excerpts: I'm not a big fan of the soy sauce chicken wings though.
soy sauce chicken wings.author: Stevezee C.
soy sauce chicken wings.review: pretty nice place with good dun lai.  The cherng fun is good too with the dipping sauces.  I'm not a big fan of the soy sauce chicken wings though.

excerpts: - Instant noodle w/ curry fish balls: I thought the only thing that was curry were the fish balls not the entire bowl of soup!
This dish was far too spicy for me to stomach...and I couldn't eat it.

The fish balls on the other hand was not spicy nor were they curried 
- Steamed egg custard with coconut milk: mMm
...this was so good and warmed my tummy.
curry fish balls.author: Serena F.
curry fish balls.review:
This place was dead when my bestie and I walked in at 11pm on a Wednesday night. We got to sit anywhere we wanted because there was no one to say anything if we sat in a table for 10. ;) Menus were placed on the table already and they were sticky. 

- Instant noodle w/ curry fish balls: I thought the only thing that was curry were the fish balls not the entire bowl of soup! This dish was far too spicy for me to stomach...and I couldn't eat it. The fish balls on the other hand was not spicy nor were they curried 
- Steamed egg custard with coconut milk: mMm...this was so good and warmed my tummy. It was just the right portion too.
- Creamed soda w/ milk: My best ordered this and the girl didn't give her the milk portion of the drink. I think she only heard cream soda and tuned out the rest because we were only charged for the cream soda.

Overall the food was not bad but you would think service would be better since we were the only ones in there...it wasn't. The girl was in her own little world. We had to holler in order to get her attention.

excerpts: They had the usually HK style desserts and snacks like Egg puffs, waffles with ice cream, curry fish balls, sandwiches, macaroni noodles, chicken wings, steamed egg custard/pudding, fruit juices, mixed fruit with fruit juices, etc.
it had strawberry jello on the bottom, whipped cream, BIG scoop of yummy strawberry ice cream, slice fresh strawberries all around and a wafer cookie on top.
-Steamed egg pudding with sesame ($3.95) had sesame paste on the bottom steamed with HEALTHY egg custard on top.
The custard was so smooth and soft and not too sweet at all.

Such a healthy dessert!
-Fried Bread with sweetened condensed milk (around $4) came with 4 big pieces of mon tou, fried bread, drizzled with sweetened condensed milk with a extra side of sweetened condensed milk.
I remember eating this when I was young and always loved it
so I knew I had to order it when I came here.
It was good
but I only finished one since I ordered so much food!
I wish they would not skimp and be stingy with my sweetened condensed milk though.
curry fish balls.author: Juliane N.
curry fish balls.review:
I remember coming here when it first opened and disliked it. We were looking for a HK style dessert place and wanted to go to Golden Island Cafe but My Favorite Cafes' ratings were higher and plus it's closer to my place so I picked to come here. 

Got V.I.P parking right out front! They must know a Ms. Can't parallel park is coming and saved it for me! =) This place was packed at 11 at night on a Sunday! They table was actually ready but I had to change the amount of people in our party so it took a little longer. We got seated first while waiting and I feel like the waiters were getting pissed off cuz we were taking long. Then they probably got even more mad when we had to add another 6 to our 10 and with all the arranging and moving, people still had to sit away from the big table. But they were nice about it.

The menu was humongous! They had the usually HK style desserts and snacks like Egg puffs, waffles with ice cream, curry fish balls, sandwiches, macaroni noodles, chicken wings, steamed egg custard/pudding, fruit juices, mixed fruit with fruit juices, etc.


I ordered the:
-Strawberry Madness (around $4-5) it had strawberry jello on the bottom, whipped cream, BIG scoop of yummy strawberry ice cream, slice fresh strawberries all around and a wafer cookie on top. 
-Steamed egg pudding with sesame ($3.95) had sesame paste on the bottom steamed with HEALTHY egg custard on top. The custard was so smooth and soft and not too sweet at all. Such a healthy dessert!
-Fried Bread with sweetened condensed milk (around $4) came with 4 big pieces of mon tou, fried bread, drizzled with sweetened condensed milk with a extra side of sweetened condensed milk. I remember eating this when I was young and always loved it so I knew I had to order it when I came here. It was good but I only finished one since I ordered so much food! I wish they would not skimp and be stingy with my sweetened condensed milk though. Way better when you drench it with the milk!

Service was slow but we had 12 people in our table so it's understandable!

excerpts: I ordered the curry fish ball with rice noodle for my meal; The curry fish balls were tender and had a kick of spice to them.

I wasn't too happy to see the noodles and fish balls swimming in greasy/fatty broth, but I had to comment to my friend Mellie P. about how MFC seemed to be a "good place to eat at to treat a hangover".
curry fish balls.author: Helene K.
curry fish balls.review:
I bet others have already thought of a joke for My Favorite Cafe, but I could not help but imagine the following conversation after I went to My Favorite Cafe last night:

Person 1: Hey, do you want to go to My Favorite Cafe?
Person 2: Sure, what's the name of the place?
Person 1: My Favorite Cafe.
Person 2: I know it's your favorite cafe, but what's the name?
Person 1: My Favorite Cafe.
Person 2: Uh?

Okay, maybe bad joke, sorry. But maybe the owners/servers get a similar joke at times?

Well, last night was my first time going to My Favorite Cafe, and I must say I rather liked it. It was actually my first time to be in the Outer Richmond part of Clement Street, and I thought it was a lot calmer/local-centric than the Inner Richmond part of Clement. The inside of the cafe/restaurant is lit with hard fluorescent bulbs, so that gives off a different feel from most "usual" cafes. Don't come here if you expect to find a "cozy, calm" place to sit and read.

I find that as I frequent more Chinese/Asian cafes, the ambience definitely differs a lot from the American POV of cafes. Inside a Chinese cafe, it's the usual hustle-bustle of a restaurant, but people can sit and chat for ages on end. The noise level can vary inside; nobody really thinks to be quiet at an Asian cafe. The atmosphere is more lively, casual, and less intimate. In some strange way, I find this all relaxing to me; it makes me really get a feeling of home.

Anyway, onto the actual review of My Favorite Cafe.

The menu at MFC is impressive; there are cafe specialties, sandwiches, noodles, hot AND cold desserts, and specialty drinks. All items are priced under $10, so one can definitely get a bargain bite at MFC. However, most of the foods are unhealthy, but...hey, sometimes it's okay to indulge.

I ordered the curry fish ball with rice noodle for my meal; The curry fish balls were tender and had a kick of spice to them. I wasn't too happy to see the noodles and fish balls swimming in greasy/fatty broth, but I had to comment to my friend Mellie P. about how MFC seemed to be a "good place to eat at to treat a hangover". Granted, I rarely ever drink until I get a hangover, but I've heard from many other peers about how greasy food is good for "sopping up" the alcohol from one's system.

Aside from the greasy brother, the meal itself was tasty and filling. Afterwards, I had dessert: sesame-filled dumplings. 5 cute mochi/rice ball dumplings in clear brother; the mochi had a good texture to it and had a hint of sweet saltiness. The servers were very generous in re-filling our cups with tea and letting Mellie P. and I sit at the cafe for 3 hours chatting.....

The clientele consisted of a mix of Asian/Asian-Americans. MFC looks like a good place for families, party-goers, and young people alike. I'd love to live near a place like this, just knowing that I could pop in at midnight and order some food/dessert from them.

I'm curious to try the "stewed snow frog" listed under both the hot and cold desserts sections. I will probably order that the next time I am back at My Favorite Cafe.

Oh, and I hate to say it, but I think "My Favorite Cafe" could very well become MY favorite cafe in the City. =P

excerpts:
My group got some curry fish balls, nutella french toast, and the mango delight.  

My friend thought the curry fish balls were a little too spicy for her and ordered some ice cream, and it came ON THE HOUSE! =]  

My friend thought the curry fish balls were a little too spicy for her and ordered some ice cream, and it came ON THE HOUSE! =]
curry fish balls.author: Rachelle T.
curry fish balls.review:
Maybe it was cravings for a good midnight snack or the company but I was satisfied with my whole experience here.  My friend has come here before and said that the service wasn't great, but it must have been a lucky Saturday night because the service was pretty good, especially since we ordered things three different times.  

My group got some curry fish balls, nutella french toast, and the mango delight.  

My friend thought the curry fish balls were a little too spicy for her and ordered some ice cream, and it came ON THE HOUSE! =]  

The guy wearing glasses was actually the person who was helping us the most: taking our orders, getting us ice cream, and coming over every time we needed something.  Much more helpful than the other guy who we tried to waive down for the bill, but never came over.  

I like this place because the food's pretty good and we were in desperate need of a snack place open late.

excerpts: I think that's what they put in their curry fish balls - human meat.
LOL jk.
But, no really, someone was stabbed but not in the kitchen.
curry fish balls.author: Chris Y.
curry fish balls.review:
My Favorite Cafe (Hahaha not really) is FOB-central as if it were a Chinese grocery market.  I don't have anything against FOBs (no, I lied, yes I do) but it'd be a good idea if they knew something about public etiquette and how you shouldn't smoke at the entrance of a restaurant so that the wind can blow all their second-hand smoke up into my nostrils, into my lungs and shorten my life span by half.  

It's cash only.  Who the hell carries cash anymore?  How archaic!

Customer service, as with all Asian establishments, is moot.  The waitress who brought us our complimentary tea yelled out "Watch out!"  Instead of, oh, I don't know...."excuse me?"

Last time we came here some dude was stabbed in the kitchen and ran out.  I think that's what they put in their curry fish balls - human meat.  LOL jk.  But, no really, someone was stabbed but not in the kitchen.  The smell of delinquent blood and my french fries usually don't go good together.

==========

-1 Star for lolservice
-1 Star for lolblood
-1 Star for fake UNO

*2 Stars out of 5*

excerpts: I had the curry fish balls, which weren't very curry-like (I prefer Kowloon's).
The steamed custard with ginger was very yummy (and good for you).
They messed up on the preserved vegetable & pork rice noodle and gave us macaroni instead, but my company had no complaints about the taste.
curry fish balls.author: Elaine H.
curry fish balls.review:
Your average cafe place, but a little more "fun and colorful" looking. I like how they have some nicer chairs (more modern look) near the windows. Bright lighting, very cute. But the dessert... just as anywhere else right?

edit: came back again today 5/22/08 when my company wanted to go to Kowloon. I recall this place being neater and less crowded (an so I was right about the less crowded part (but probably because its a Thursday night at 11:30pm vs. Saturday night at 1am). The place is bigger than crowded and the tables are definitely arranged so that they aren't all cramped together. 

I had the curry fish balls, which weren't very curry-like (I prefer Kowloon's). The steamed custard with ginger was very yummy (and good for you). They messed up on the preserved vegetable & pork rice noodle and gave us macaroni instead, but my company had no complaints about the taste. We also had some sort of hot tapioca w/ coconut (sauce and actual slices of perhaps baby coconut), and it was very good. 

4 items and the total came out to be a little over $17 before tips.

edit 5/31/08 their coconut/mango drink doesn't compare to the one at Creations, but I still love this place. It was one of my friend's first time here, and even she said she likes this place more than Kowloon. It was Friday night yesterday around 1:45am when we came here, and it was not at all crowded. Their mango madness LOOKED and TASTED so good..

excerpts: We decided to try a handful of items: deep fried sweet breads, beef stew with lettuce, curry fish balls, and green tea shake.
The curry fish balls had a ton of cumin and packed a small punch.
The curry fish balls had a ton of cumin and packed a small punch.
As for the beef stew with lettuce, my first impression was why would you order this?
It smelled like an Asian Big Mac.
I kid you not.
The wilted lettuce and random beef bits in the sauce seemed like a scaled back stew and smelled just like secret sauce.
Strange...
curry fish balls.author: Brent A.
curry fish balls.review:
My friend and I were driving around the area looking for a HK bistro of some sort and somehow discovered this place.  It looked really clean and bright from the outside as we drove by Sunday night at 11.

We parked and headed inside.  The menu is large, yet seemingly lacking in the tofu department.  We decided to try a handful of items: deep fried sweet breads, beef stew with lettuce, curry fish balls, and green tea shake.  The service was fairly spot on with tea brought by with regularity and tables being cleared immediately after patrons left the cafe.

The green tea shake was a little strange.  The wafer cookie inside was good, yet the taste of the drink overall had a strange green tea and matcha flavor with cardboard-esque aftertaste.  It wasn't what we expected, but it was fine by any means.

The sweet breads are delectable.  If you love condensed milk, then this little piece of dough will not let you down as it comes with a condensed milk as a dipping sauce.  

The curry fish balls had a ton of cumin and packed a small punch.  

As for the beef stew with lettuce, my first impression was why would you order this?  It smelled like an Asian Big Mac.  I kid you not.  The wilted lettuce and random beef bits in the sauce seemed like a scaled back stew and smelled just like secret sauce.  Strange...  It was fairly tasty though.

If you come here after 8, make sure you plan on ordering something at least $2.50 in value.  Also, make sure you bring cash as that is all they accept.

I would certainly hit this place up if I lived in the area.  It's cheap and has great desserts--the waffles covered with ice cream and fruits looked delectable and certainly mouth-watering.  Be sure to check it out if you're in the area.

excerpts: And really dont order the curry fish balls with rice noodles it is SOOOOO PLAIN!
curry fish balls.author: Alice C.
curry fish balls.review:
So my boy friend brought me here, which a friend showed him this place. I like the restaurant how its very decorative and cute.. but the food.. wasn't the best. So i ordered rice noodles with curry balls which was a big mistake because first of all they gave me like 3-5 curry balls in a big bowl of rice noodles with water O.O. It was soo hard for me to finish and i was really upset because this was the very first CAFE my boy friend took ME!! he also ordered a milk tea which it totally didnt even taste like milk tea, for one thing it jus tasted like raw tea and they put food coloring into the milk tea to look like milk tea i don't know..
    Well soo because i wasnt full at all, i thought maybe the deserts would taste better. My boyfriend ordered a sundae... that stuff was sooo sweet!!
  Maybe i just didn't pick the right food from this restaurant and there and hopefully next time if i DO come back to this place, i just hope it would be better. And really dont order the curry fish balls with rice noodles it is SOOOOO PLAIN!

excerpts: I always order the waffle sandwich with condensed milk and peanut butter, curry fish balls, ramen, and steamed chang fen.
Every time I eat there I think about all those times I spent at the little Central snack at the CUHK campus.
curry fish balls.author: Rennie C.
curry fish balls.review: This past weekend I was in San Francisco and I drove past My Favorite Cafe. Aside from the fact that this place only takes cash, I really have to say that this is one of my favorite dessert/snack place to go to in San Francisco. It's not that their food is super duper yummy fabulous, but it's the fact they remind me a lot of Hong Kong. I always order the waffle sandwich with condensed milk and peanut butter, curry fish balls, ramen, and steamed chang fen. Every time I eat there I think about all those times I spent at the little Central snack at the CUHK campus.

excerpts: The prices are quite cheap, and if in a group, you could get a few plates of mozzarella sticks, curry fish balls, and dessert drinks
and you're good.
curry fish balls.author: Cooper S.
curry fish balls.review: Such a unique, late-night place!  Hong Kong-influenced desserts and snacks, with overly friendly girls serving you and Chinese soap-operas serenading you.  Some of the things on the menu have odd names (I've not had the courage to try the "snow frogs", etc.), but the dessert concoctions are amazing!  The prices are quite cheap, and if in a group, you could get a few plates of mozzarella sticks, curry fish balls, and dessert drinks and you're good.

excerpts: The golden sesame dumplings were so crispy on the outside, the fried chicken leg was huge, the "fun fun mango" was creative, the beer battered onion rings didn't fall apart at all, and the sweet waffle sandwich was to die for.
Keep this up and it'll really be my favorite cafe.
My favorite was the sweet waffle sandwich.
JONASAPPROVED!
They finally extended their busines hours to close past midnight instead of 11pm
so I decided to give it another try.
A lot of the desserts/sauces seemed watered down, but the food still tasted alright.
It's very loud in a Chinesey way, if that makes any sense at all.
Just picture a crowded room of Chinese folks yelling at each other in Chinese.
beer battered onion rings.author: Jonas T.
beer battered onion rings.review:
UPDATE 7/29 - Changed from 3 stars to 4 stars

This place has improved a lot since I last came here a month ago. I didn't order the same things as last time, but nothing disappointed me at all this time. The portions were fair for its price and the food looked and tasted delicious. The golden sesame dumplings were so crispy on the outside, the fried chicken leg was huge, the "fun fun mango" was creative, the beer battered onion rings didn't fall apart at all, and the sweet waffle sandwich was to die for. Keep this up and it'll really be my favorite cafe.

My favorite was the sweet waffle sandwich. JONASAPPROVED!

-------------------

They finally extended their busines hours to close past midnight instead of 11pm so I decided to give it another try. A lot of the desserts/sauces seemed watered down, but the food still tasted alright. It's very loud in a Chinesey way, if that makes any sense at all. Just picture a crowded room of Chinese folks yelling at each other in Chinese. 

Soy sauce chicken wings are delicious, and you can never go wrong with steamed rice noodle rolls no matter how watered down the peanut sauce is. JONASAPPROVED!

excerpts: - French Fries:
french fries.author: Anonymous P.
french fries.review:
This cafe has become to be a favorite for my sister, myself and even my kiddies. 

I love that this place stays open late, that their affordable (cheap, delicious eats in SF) and they even have HH tea time menu (everyday from 230pm-530pm). A bit of a drive if you're coming from the other side of town *we're from the Bayview District* but gas and money well spent when you're done. 

So far we're tried.. 

- Beef Stew Noodle Soup: Rice noodles, flavorful beef stew, cabbage in a plain broth. *Definitely needs a little see yao (soy sauce) than you're ready to dive in. 

- Soy Sauce Chicken Wings: Oh man those chicken wangs are tasty!! If you're a chicken wang person like myself and kiddies than be sure to grab an order or two!!

- French Fries: Bc they're simple to snack on and keeps my kiddies quiet for the time being while I'm trying to yelp!!

- Egg Puffs: Seems everyone has come here for their egg puffs and they don't disappoint either. They're fresh and piping hot.

- Warm Cola with Lemon: If you're a super Asian person, you know what I'm talking about. Yes folks, warm cola with a hint of lemon. 

- Milk Tea w/boba: Bc being a boba lover, you can't see boba on a menu and not have a try. *I still prefer Belly Good Cafe and Crepes' milk tea located in Japantown bc it's sweeter and creamier.* 

- Steamed Rice Rolls: Bc I LOVE my noodle dishes. Plain, tiny rice rolls, steamed of course accompanied with hoisin dipping sauce. Simple and yet satisfying. 

A absolute great place for late night cravings, whether you're craving a snack or dessert!

excerpts: I love the steamed rice noodles with hoisin & sesame peanut butter and the French fries.
french fries.author: Kathy L.
french fries.review:
This is one of my default dessert places even though I rarely eat dessert whenever I go. I love the steamed rice noodles with hoisin & sesame peanut butter and the French fries. Their club sandwich and chicken sandwich are also pretty good too.

The service can be either spot-on or spotty. They are usually friendly and good with refilling tea. 

It's one of those places where you can go if you want to just chill somewhere late at night.

excerpts: I always get my usual tofu  fa with mixed fruit, somebody always gets the french fries, the chicken sandwich, eggettes, ice cream waffle, ice lemon tea, etc etc.
This place does get pretty busy later at night so come earlier to get a seat or be prepared to wait
but its never that long.
french fries.author: Sarah L.
french fries.review:
Met some friends here last night for dessert. Its our usual dessert place. Wouldn't say its our favorite (in terms of taste) but they never rush us, we can sit/hang out/catch up with friends for as long as we like, and they'll always refill the hot tea. Which is what dessert is all about for us, especially since we don't get to see much of each other during the week anymore (post college days).

We've come here a lot over the years so we've tried our share of the menu. Nothings ever amazing but its not bad either. I always get my usual tofu  fa with mixed fruit, somebody always gets the french fries, the chicken sandwich, eggettes, ice cream waffle, ice lemon tea, etc etc. This place does get pretty busy later at night so come earlier to get a seat or be prepared to wait but its never that long.

excerpts: The french fries/fried chicken item is value - as getting each separately would cost more.
french fries.author: Peter L.
french fries.review:
Really three stars, but their menu is extensive and has pretty much something for everyone (though sorry if you're vegetarian, as there isn't much to holla about). The "egg and luncheon meat"=spam sandwich is decent - in taste and portion size. The french fries/fried chicken item is value - as getting each separately would cost more.

The crowd is mixed age groups, but the atmosphere is geared towards the young. Not really difficult to find, but street parking leaves much to be desired.

Milestones: the first "Useful" and "Cool" votes' review! :D

excerpts: The smell of delinquent blood and my french fries usually don't go good together.
french fries.author: Chris Y.
french fries.review:
My Favorite Cafe (Hahaha not really) is FOB-central as if it were a Chinese grocery market.  I don't have anything against FOBs (no, I lied, yes I do) but it'd be a good idea if they knew something about public etiquette and how you shouldn't smoke at the entrance of a restaurant so that the wind can blow all their second-hand smoke up into my nostrils, into my lungs and shorten my life span by half.  

It's cash only.  Who the hell carries cash anymore?  How archaic!

Customer service, as with all Asian establishments, is moot.  The waitress who brought us our complimentary tea yelled out "Watch out!"  Instead of, oh, I don't know...."excuse me?"

Last time we came here some dude was stabbed in the kitchen and ran out.  I think that's what they put in their curry fish balls - human meat.  LOL jk.  But, no really, someone was stabbed but not in the kitchen.  The smell of delinquent blood and my french fries usually don't go good together.

==========

-1 Star for lolservice
-1 Star for lolblood
-1 Star for fake UNO

*2 Stars out of 5*

excerpts: Check out their specials, I tried the beef stew rice noodle (actually crepe) clay pot
and it was pretty good.
beef stew.author: Iris H.
beef stew.review:
One of the few spots that open late night Hong Kong styles food, snacks, drinks, and dessert.
Decor is a bit weird with bright lime green and yellow paint, but the space is open so you won't feel cramped.

$4.95 for instant ramen with fried egg and luncheon meat, or you can order different topping and noodle combos. Check out their specials, I tried the beef stew rice noodle (actually crepe) clay pot and it was pretty good.

excerpts: This is Grandma's favorite beef stew noodle place!
The owners are always friendly...at least in the late afternoon when I usually go pick up the noodles for my mother.
beef stew.author: Gale H.
beef stew.review:
This is Grandma's favorite beef stew noodle place!  The owners are always friendly...at least in the late afternoon when I usually go pick up the noodles for my mother. The beef tendon is usually tender, and flavored with anise as she prefers.

Also recommend the chicken wings and milk shakes!

excerpts: My friend had the beef stew with udon(he said the beef stew tasted like wonton house on Noriega st)
, I had the deli meat(spam) with egg, and just to mess with them back, I said I would like to order a fish sandwich when your clock hits 245pm.
beef stew.author: jason g.
beef stew.review:
If they had a bit more personality and if they didn't cheat you, this would be a solid 3 star establishment.  So, my friend and I got here at 230 and wanted to check this place out.  We work a block and half away so why not?!?  

We didn't realize that they had a happy hour special from 230 to 530.  As we were ordering, we wanted to order some stuff from the HH special menu.  She goes.............No, you can't order that yet because it's not 230.  We looked at our phones and it showed 2:33.  She goes, "No, It has to be our clock."  Their clock is 15 minutes slower.  WTH?!?  Is she serious?  She was serious.  

We felt like Greg Focker, in Meet the Fockers, when he was the only one standing in line at the airport trying to board the plane.  Good lord..........I don't believe there are still people out their trying to swindle you for a couple of dollars.  I take that back..........I do know of one other owner that would.

The food, on the other hand, wasn't too bad.  It was actually pretty good.  My friend had the beef stew with udon(he said the beef stew tasted like wonton house on Noriega st), I had the deli meat(spam) with egg, and just to mess with them back, I said I would like to order a fish sandwich when your clock hits 245pm.

excerpts: Their sa cha beef stew noodles are actually really tasty.
beef stew.author: Loren L.
beef stew.review:
I've only ever come here to grab take-out food.  Their sa cha beef stew noodles are actually really tasty.  I've never gotten anything else here, but those noodles just keep me coming back for more.  

I know that back when I was working really late on the weekends, I'd come in and pick up dinner at like 9 or 10 pm and the place would be packed with younger Asian people hanging about drinking boba or eating dessert.  Reminds me of the good ol' days when I used to do that when I was in high school.

Oh, and the people who work here are pretty nice.  Every time I come to order and sit at a table to wait for them to make my food, they'll pour me a glass of hot tea so I can drink while I wait.  They don't have to do this; after all, I'm just ordering to-go.  But, it's a nice gesture.

excerpts: I opted for the beef stew over egg noodle (nixed the pork chop that accompanied the meal cause that's too much food).
The beef stew was tasty, but nothing too special.

The stew didn't lend too much sauce onto the noodles, but there was this small amount of paste that was off to the side of the bowl that added a great semi-salty taste onto the already yummy egg noodles.
beef stew.author: Marie B.
beef stew.review:
Went to My Favorite Cafe the other night with Katie K. and Adam L.  Only Katie K. had been to the cafe, but only for dessert, so testing out the savory food was new for all of us.  As far as I can tell, it's a pretty typical Chinese/HK style cafe.  You get hot tea in plastic drinking cups, lots of savory and dessert options and low prices.  I opted for the beef stew over egg noodle (nixed the pork chop that accompanied the meal cause that's too much food).  The beef stew was tasty, but nothing too special.  The stew didn't lend too much sauce onto the noodles, but there was this small amount of paste that was off to the side of the bowl that added a great semi-salty taste onto the already yummy egg noodles.  The fried egg over medium (how I like my eggs) was a nice addition as well.  

We also ordered onion rings and besides catching up with old schoolmates, is the reason I wanted to go to My Favorite Cafe.  I love onion rings and though I try not to eat the greasy goodness too often, I'm always looking for a good ones.  These were pretty good...not too much batter, good size and crispy without being too saturated in oil.  I know where to go when I'm craving onion rings...great that it's in my neighborhood.

I think I'll have to go back to My Favorite Cafe and try the desserts next!  Mmmm...egg puffs, sago and milk teas.

The curry fish balls had a ton of cumin and packed a small punch.
The curry fish balls had a ton of cumin and packed a small punch.

It smelled like an Asian Big Mac.
I kid you not.
The wilted lettuce and random beef bits in the sauce seemed like a scaled back stew and smelled just like secret sauce.
Strange...
