excerpts: Fish balls + pig skin (appetizer?)
: I didn't try it but my boyfriend said it was really good.
Some sort of jelly drink with ice: I thought it was just okay
fish balls.author: Laverne N.
fish balls.review:
My Favorite Cafe is not my favorite cafe.

My visit could be described in one word: Okay 

I had a difficult time navigating the menu since some of the menu items have names that don't really depict anything about what it actually is. I couldn't tell the difference between a Mango Delight vs. a Mango Madness even by looking at the picture but maybe that's just my own problem. :|

We ordered:
1. Egg puff - It was good!
2. Mango Madness - I was really disappointed by this. :( Maybe I'm too used to Creations' mango pudding but I felt this one was way too sweet and it didn't have a 'refreshing' aspect to it.
3. Fish balls + pig skin (appetizer?): I didn't try it but my boyfriend said it was really good.
4. Some sort of jelly drink with ice: I thought it was just okay but my boyfriend liked it.

Total came out to around 19 dollars. CASH ONLY - but it doesn't really bother me cause it's just like every other place that accepts cash only in SF. Creations is still my go-to late night dessert spot because I prefer the taste and it seems like they offer a wider variety of items. However, I wouldn't mind going here again since its less crowded and parking is easier to find. I'll probably just try different things next time.

excerpts: - Instant noodle w/ curry fish balls: I thought the only thing that was curry were the fish balls not the entire bowl of soup!
This dish was far too spicy for me to stomach...and I couldn't eat it.

The fish balls on the other hand was not spicy nor were they curried 
- Steamed egg custard with coconut milk: mMm
...this was so good and warmed my tummy.
fish balls.author: Serena F.
fish balls.review:
This place was dead when my bestie and I walked in at 11pm on a Wednesday night. We got to sit anywhere we wanted because there was no one to say anything if we sat in a table for 10. ;) Menus were placed on the table already and they were sticky. 

- Instant noodle w/ curry fish balls: I thought the only thing that was curry were the fish balls not the entire bowl of soup! This dish was far too spicy for me to stomach...and I couldn't eat it. The fish balls on the other hand was not spicy nor were they curried 
- Steamed egg custard with coconut milk: mMm...this was so good and warmed my tummy. It was just the right portion too.
- Creamed soda w/ milk: My best ordered this and the girl didn't give her the milk portion of the drink. I think she only heard cream soda and tuned out the rest because we were only charged for the cream soda.

Overall the food was not bad but you would think service would be better since we were the only ones in there...it wasn't. The girl was in her own little world. We had to holler in order to get her attention.

excerpts: They had the usually HK style desserts and snacks like Egg puffs, waffles with ice cream, curry fish balls, sandwiches, macaroni noodles, chicken wings, steamed egg custard/pudding, fruit juices, mixed fruit with fruit juices, etc.
it had strawberry jello on the bottom, whipped cream, BIG scoop of yummy strawberry ice cream, slice fresh strawberries all around and a wafer cookie on top.
-Steamed egg pudding with sesame ($3.95) had sesame paste on the bottom steamed with HEALTHY egg custard on top.
The custard was so smooth and soft and not too sweet at all.

Such a healthy dessert!
-Fried Bread with sweetened condensed milk (around $4) came with 4 big pieces of mon tou, fried bread, drizzled with sweetened condensed milk with a extra side of sweetened condensed milk.
I remember eating this when I was young and always loved it
so I knew I had to order it when I came here.
It was good
but I only finished one since I ordered so much food!
I wish they would not skimp and be stingy with my sweetened condensed milk though.
fish balls.author: Juliane N.
fish balls.review:
I remember coming here when it first opened and disliked it. We were looking for a HK style dessert place and wanted to go to Golden Island Cafe but My Favorite Cafes' ratings were higher and plus it's closer to my place so I picked to come here. 

Got V.I.P parking right out front! They must know a Ms. Can't parallel park is coming and saved it for me! =) This place was packed at 11 at night on a Sunday! They table was actually ready but I had to change the amount of people in our party so it took a little longer. We got seated first while waiting and I feel like the waiters were getting pissed off cuz we were taking long. Then they probably got even more mad when we had to add another 6 to our 10 and with all the arranging and moving, people still had to sit away from the big table. But they were nice about it.

The menu was humongous! They had the usually HK style desserts and snacks like Egg puffs, waffles with ice cream, curry fish balls, sandwiches, macaroni noodles, chicken wings, steamed egg custard/pudding, fruit juices, mixed fruit with fruit juices, etc.


I ordered the:
-Strawberry Madness (around $4-5) it had strawberry jello on the bottom, whipped cream, BIG scoop of yummy strawberry ice cream, slice fresh strawberries all around and a wafer cookie on top. 
-Steamed egg pudding with sesame ($3.95) had sesame paste on the bottom steamed with HEALTHY egg custard on top. The custard was so smooth and soft and not too sweet at all. Such a healthy dessert!
-Fried Bread with sweetened condensed milk (around $4) came with 4 big pieces of mon tou, fried bread, drizzled with sweetened condensed milk with a extra side of sweetened condensed milk. I remember eating this when I was young and always loved it so I knew I had to order it when I came here. It was good but I only finished one since I ordered so much food! I wish they would not skimp and be stingy with my sweetened condensed milk though. Way better when you drench it with the milk!

Service was slow but we had 12 people in our table so it's understandable!

excerpts: I ordered the curry fish ball with rice noodle for my meal; The curry fish balls were tender and had a kick of spice to them.

I wasn't too happy to see the noodles and fish balls swimming in greasy/fatty broth, but I had to comment to my friend Mellie P. about how MFC seemed to be a "good place to eat at to treat a hangover".
fish balls.author: Helene K.
fish balls.review:
I bet others have already thought of a joke for My Favorite Cafe, but I could not help but imagine the following conversation after I went to My Favorite Cafe last night:

Person 1: Hey, do you want to go to My Favorite Cafe?
Person 2: Sure, what's the name of the place?
Person 1: My Favorite Cafe.
Person 2: I know it's your favorite cafe, but what's the name?
Person 1: My Favorite Cafe.
Person 2: Uh?

Okay, maybe bad joke, sorry. But maybe the owners/servers get a similar joke at times?

Well, last night was my first time going to My Favorite Cafe, and I must say I rather liked it. It was actually my first time to be in the Outer Richmond part of Clement Street, and I thought it was a lot calmer/local-centric than the Inner Richmond part of Clement. The inside of the cafe/restaurant is lit with hard fluorescent bulbs, so that gives off a different feel from most "usual" cafes. Don't come here if you expect to find a "cozy, calm" place to sit and read.

I find that as I frequent more Chinese/Asian cafes, the ambience definitely differs a lot from the American POV of cafes. Inside a Chinese cafe, it's the usual hustle-bustle of a restaurant, but people can sit and chat for ages on end. The noise level can vary inside; nobody really thinks to be quiet at an Asian cafe. The atmosphere is more lively, casual, and less intimate. In some strange way, I find this all relaxing to me; it makes me really get a feeling of home.

Anyway, onto the actual review of My Favorite Cafe.

The menu at MFC is impressive; there are cafe specialties, sandwiches, noodles, hot AND cold desserts, and specialty drinks. All items are priced under $10, so one can definitely get a bargain bite at MFC. However, most of the foods are unhealthy, but...hey, sometimes it's okay to indulge.

I ordered the curry fish ball with rice noodle for my meal; The curry fish balls were tender and had a kick of spice to them. I wasn't too happy to see the noodles and fish balls swimming in greasy/fatty broth, but I had to comment to my friend Mellie P. about how MFC seemed to be a "good place to eat at to treat a hangover". Granted, I rarely ever drink until I get a hangover, but I've heard from many other peers about how greasy food is good for "sopping up" the alcohol from one's system.

Aside from the greasy brother, the meal itself was tasty and filling. Afterwards, I had dessert: sesame-filled dumplings. 5 cute mochi/rice ball dumplings in clear brother; the mochi had a good texture to it and had a hint of sweet saltiness. The servers were very generous in re-filling our cups with tea and letting Mellie P. and I sit at the cafe for 3 hours chatting.....

The clientele consisted of a mix of Asian/Asian-Americans. MFC looks like a good place for families, party-goers, and young people alike. I'd love to live near a place like this, just knowing that I could pop in at midnight and order some food/dessert from them.

I'm curious to try the "stewed snow frog" listed under both the hot and cold desserts sections. I will probably order that the next time I am back at My Favorite Cafe.

Oh, and I hate to say it, but I think "My Favorite Cafe" could very well become MY favorite cafe in the City. =P

excerpts:
My group got some curry fish balls, nutella french toast, and the mango delight.  

My friend thought the curry fish balls were a little too spicy for her and ordered some ice cream, and it came ON THE HOUSE! =]  

My friend thought the curry fish balls were a little too spicy for her and ordered some ice cream, and it came ON THE HOUSE! =]
fish balls.author: Rachelle T.
fish balls.review:
Maybe it was cravings for a good midnight snack or the company but I was satisfied with my whole experience here.  My friend has come here before and said that the service wasn't great, but it must have been a lucky Saturday night because the service was pretty good, especially since we ordered things three different times.  

My group got some curry fish balls, nutella french toast, and the mango delight.  

My friend thought the curry fish balls were a little too spicy for her and ordered some ice cream, and it came ON THE HOUSE! =]  

The guy wearing glasses was actually the person who was helping us the most: taking our orders, getting us ice cream, and coming over every time we needed something.  Much more helpful than the other guy who we tried to waive down for the bill, but never came over.  

I like this place because the food's pretty good and we were in desperate need of a snack place open late.

excerpts: I think that's what they put in their curry fish balls - human meat.
LOL jk.
But, no really, someone was stabbed but not in the kitchen.
fish balls.author: Chris Y.
fish balls.review:
My Favorite Cafe (Hahaha not really) is FOB-central as if it were a Chinese grocery market.  I don't have anything against FOBs (no, I lied, yes I do) but it'd be a good idea if they knew something about public etiquette and how you shouldn't smoke at the entrance of a restaurant so that the wind can blow all their second-hand smoke up into my nostrils, into my lungs and shorten my life span by half.  

It's cash only.  Who the hell carries cash anymore?  How archaic!

Customer service, as with all Asian establishments, is moot.  The waitress who brought us our complimentary tea yelled out "Watch out!"  Instead of, oh, I don't know...."excuse me?"

Last time we came here some dude was stabbed in the kitchen and ran out.  I think that's what they put in their curry fish balls - human meat.  LOL jk.  But, no really, someone was stabbed but not in the kitchen.  The smell of delinquent blood and my french fries usually don't go good together.

==========

-1 Star for lolservice
-1 Star for lolblood
-1 Star for fake UNO

*2 Stars out of 5*

excerpts: I ordered the Fish Balls with Radish and Pigskin but minus the pigskin and a Papaya Milk.
The Fish Balls took almost 10 minutes for it come out.
And when I tasted it, felt like something was definitely missing from the soup base.
I couldn't put my finger on it but definitely could've been better.
The Papaya Milk?
Way
TOO much milk and not enough papaya.
It was so creamy looking and not even orange-ish looking in color.
It was horrible and tasted mostly of milk and barely a hint of papaya.
YUCK!
Mind you
I was still semi-hungry, having just gotten out of night class.
fish balls.author: Linda X.
fish balls.review:
I use to come here a lot about 2 years ago? I haven't been back since. So it's been awhile ...

First off the girls don't really pay much attention to you unless you own a freaking penis! And mind you I was with 4 guys and still crap service..geez.

I ordered the Fish Balls with Radish and Pigskin but minus the pigskin and a Papaya Milk. The Fish Balls took almost 10 minutes for it come out. And when I tasted it, felt like something was definitely missing from the soup base. I couldn't put my finger on it but definitely could've been better. The Papaya Milk? Way TOO much milk and not enough papaya. It was so creamy looking and not even orange-ish looking in color. It was horrible and tasted mostly of milk and barely a hint of papaya. YUCK! Mind you I was still semi-hungry, having just gotten out of night class. So I ordered a Luncheon Meat and Egg sandwich. That was the only reason I gave this place 3 stars. It was great *smiles*. Soft bread crispy spam and eggs prepared just the way I like it. *thumbs up*

excerpts: The fish balls are terrible - extremely rubbery, and it always takes more time than needed to get your food AND your check.
None of the staff speak English, but I think they should learn the words to simple things customers might ask for, like a toothpick.
I'm Asian, I'm not hating, but if it were me
I'd make that effort.
Golden Island in the sunset is a better option.
fish balls.author: Vivian H.
fish balls.review: This is definitely not my favorite cafe, and I'm not sure if it's really anybody's favorite cafe, and it probably isn't even the owner's favorite cafe.  I'm getting a little sick of Asian desserts.. but the papaya sago here was ridiculously bad.  It was extremely icey, and even having to pay four or five bucks for it wasn't going to make me finish that thing.  The fish balls are terrible - extremely rubbery, and it always takes more time than needed to get your food AND your check.  None of the staff speak English, but I think they should learn the words to simple things customers might ask for, like a toothpick.  I'm Asian, I'm not hating, but if it were me I'd make that effort.  Golden Island in the sunset is a better option.

excerpts: I had the curry fish balls, which weren't very curry-like (I prefer Kowloon's).
The steamed custard with ginger was very yummy (and good for you).
They messed up on the preserved vegetable & pork rice noodle and gave us macaroni instead, but my company had no complaints about the taste.
fish balls.author: Elaine H.
fish balls.review:
Your average cafe place, but a little more "fun and colorful" looking. I like how they have some nicer chairs (more modern look) near the windows. Bright lighting, very cute. But the dessert... just as anywhere else right?

edit: came back again today 5/22/08 when my company wanted to go to Kowloon. I recall this place being neater and less crowded (an so I was right about the less crowded part (but probably because its a Thursday night at 11:30pm vs. Saturday night at 1am). The place is bigger than crowded and the tables are definitely arranged so that they aren't all cramped together. 

I had the curry fish balls, which weren't very curry-like (I prefer Kowloon's). The steamed custard with ginger was very yummy (and good for you). They messed up on the preserved vegetable & pork rice noodle and gave us macaroni instead, but my company had no complaints about the taste. We also had some sort of hot tapioca w/ coconut (sauce and actual slices of perhaps baby coconut), and it was very good. 

4 items and the total came out to be a little over $17 before tips.

edit 5/31/08 their coconut/mango drink doesn't compare to the one at Creations, but I still love this place. It was one of my friend's first time here, and even she said she likes this place more than Kowloon. It was Friday night yesterday around 1:45am when we came here, and it was not at all crowded. Their mango madness LOOKED and TASTED so good..

excerpts: We decided to try a handful of items: deep fried sweet breads, beef stew with lettuce, curry fish balls, and green tea shake.
The curry fish balls had a ton of cumin and packed a small punch.
The curry fish balls had a ton of cumin and packed a small punch.
As for the beef stew with lettuce, my first impression was why would you order this?
It smelled like an Asian Big Mac.
I kid you not.
The wilted lettuce and random beef bits in the sauce seemed like a scaled back stew and smelled just like secret sauce.
Strange...
fish balls.author: Brent A.
fish balls.review:
My friend and I were driving around the area looking for a HK bistro of some sort and somehow discovered this place.  It looked really clean and bright from the outside as we drove by Sunday night at 11.

We parked and headed inside.  The menu is large, yet seemingly lacking in the tofu department.  We decided to try a handful of items: deep fried sweet breads, beef stew with lettuce, curry fish balls, and green tea shake.  The service was fairly spot on with tea brought by with regularity and tables being cleared immediately after patrons left the cafe.

The green tea shake was a little strange.  The wafer cookie inside was good, yet the taste of the drink overall had a strange green tea and matcha flavor with cardboard-esque aftertaste.  It wasn't what we expected, but it was fine by any means.

The sweet breads are delectable.  If you love condensed milk, then this little piece of dough will not let you down as it comes with a condensed milk as a dipping sauce.  

The curry fish balls had a ton of cumin and packed a small punch.  

As for the beef stew with lettuce, my first impression was why would you order this?  It smelled like an Asian Big Mac.  I kid you not.  The wilted lettuce and random beef bits in the sauce seemed like a scaled back stew and smelled just like secret sauce.  Strange...  It was fairly tasty though.

If you come here after 8, make sure you plan on ordering something at least $2.50 in value.  Also, make sure you bring cash as that is all they accept.

I would certainly hit this place up if I lived in the area.  It's cheap and has great desserts--the waffles covered with ice cream and fruits looked delectable and certainly mouth-watering.  Be sure to check it out if you're in the area.

excerpts: MFC has an extensive menu, and there is always something that you want on it, from egg puffs to sundaes to hot desserts to numerous cold desserts to savories like fish balls and fries.
We usually order at least one of everything I have named, and we have still not tried everything on the menu - there are close to 130+ items.

While the fruit is not as fresh as Creations, they make up for it in the level of extensive menu, and having things on the menu clearly labeled, which is a plus when you are allergic to peanuts (this has been a problem for me in other Chinese dessert cafes).
They are usually pretty quick about turning the orders out, but things can come out unevenly from time to time -
fish balls.author: Jessica S.
fish balls.review:
I really, really fretted about writing my 100th review, but this happened in the perfect place at the perfect time. 

I've been coming to My Favorite Cafe (or MFC, for short) for several years now; they have always been open late enough that if we got off work at the movie theater, we could get here and indulge in dessert or 'fourth meal', as we were still amped up from working all night. We started coming here so often for a spell that the owner would always say 'hi' when we walked in, immediately seat us, regardless of the hour, and would take our orders in a timely fashion. We've watched them turn people away who walked in right after us - now THAT'S service to loyal patrons! Another bonus about MFC is that they don't have a minimum (as far as I can tell) per person for ordering - which means you don't HAVE to get something even if your friends have the munchies; many places do have this kind of rule, and I find it to be stupid. Nicely done MFC.

They have a pretty basic setup; when you walk in, there are a row of tables to your right for smaller parties - say, less than 4, and some rounds pushed together for parties of 5 or more. There's a stack of magazines in the back in Chinese, and they always have some kind of entertainment channel running on the TV in the back, and I think they offer wireless now too. There are also 2 front seats with four comfy chairs, but be warned it's ALWAYS cold in those window nooks! It can feel more private sitting over there, but it can make it more of a challenge to flag down a server to get stuff taken care of. 

MFC has an extensive menu, and there is always something that you want on it, from egg puffs to sundaes to hot desserts to numerous cold desserts to savories like fish balls and fries. We usually order at least one of everything I have named, and we have still not tried everything on the menu - there are close to 130+ items. While the fruit is not as fresh as Creations, they make up for it in the level of extensive menu, and having things on the menu clearly labeled, which is a plus when you are allergic to peanuts (this has been a problem for me in other Chinese dessert cafes). They are usually pretty quick about turning the orders out, but things can come out unevenly from time to time - tonight, we waited for our waffle sundae to come out for an ungodly amount of time, but I think part of that was to blame on the waitstaff - they have some majorly ditzy girls working there right now, but they were eager to help, and came around and refilled the hot tea that is always served. 

I have been so many times, and cannot remember a single time I walked away disappointed. I am always blessed with good friends who go with me, and we always have had a good time.

Parking can be a nightmare here, and it's cash only, but for now, it will always be "My Favorite Cafe"

excerpts: And really dont order the curry fish balls with rice noodles it is SOOOOO PLAIN!
fish balls.author: Alice C.
fish balls.review:
So my boy friend brought me here, which a friend showed him this place. I like the restaurant how its very decorative and cute.. but the food.. wasn't the best. So i ordered rice noodles with curry balls which was a big mistake because first of all they gave me like 3-5 curry balls in a big bowl of rice noodles with water O.O. It was soo hard for me to finish and i was really upset because this was the very first CAFE my boy friend took ME!! he also ordered a milk tea which it totally didnt even taste like milk tea, for one thing it jus tasted like raw tea and they put food coloring into the milk tea to look like milk tea i don't know..
    Well soo because i wasnt full at all, i thought maybe the deserts would taste better. My boyfriend ordered a sundae... that stuff was sooo sweet!!
  Maybe i just didn't pick the right food from this restaurant and there and hopefully next time if i DO come back to this place, i just hope it would be better. And really dont order the curry fish balls with rice noodles it is SOOOOO PLAIN!

excerpts: I always order the waffle sandwich with condensed milk and peanut butter, curry fish balls, ramen, and steamed chang fen.
Every time I eat there I think about all those times I spent at the little Central snack at the CUHK campus.
fish balls.author: Rennie C.
fish balls.review: This past weekend I was in San Francisco and I drove past My Favorite Cafe. Aside from the fact that this place only takes cash, I really have to say that this is one of my favorite dessert/snack place to go to in San Francisco. It's not that their food is super duper yummy fabulous, but it's the fact they remind me a lot of Hong Kong. I always order the waffle sandwich with condensed milk and peanut butter, curry fish balls, ramen, and steamed chang fen. Every time I eat there I think about all those times I spent at the little Central snack at the CUHK campus.

excerpts: The prices are quite cheap, and if in a group, you could get a few plates of mozzarella sticks, curry fish balls, and dessert drinks
and you're good.
fish balls.author: Cooper S.
fish balls.review: Such a unique, late-night place!  Hong Kong-influenced desserts and snacks, with overly friendly girls serving you and Chinese soap-operas serenading you.  Some of the things on the menu have odd names (I've not had the courage to try the "snow frogs", etc.), but the dessert concoctions are amazing!  The prices are quite cheap, and if in a group, you could get a few plates of mozzarella sticks, curry fish balls, and dessert drinks and you're good.

excerpts: The food we ordered was good although I was a little disappointed by their fried fish balls (I like Quickly's better).
I'd definitely come back.
fish balls.author: Tiff L.
fish balls.review: I came here for the first time the other night. It's good for late night snacks. It wasn't too crowded when we came so the service was pretty quick...almost too quick. The food we ordered was good although I was a little disappointed by their fried fish balls (I like Quickly's better). I'd definitely come back.

excerpts: We also ordered the deep fried sweet bread which was surprisingly pretty good.
Its served with condensed milk.
We also ordered the coconut milk in black sticky rice - and that came out kinda funny.
The milk didn't taste like coconut milk at all...and when we told them that..they brought us some more coconut milk in its own cup, and it tasted a little spoiled.
So they were nice enough to take the dessert away and asked if we wanted something else.
deep fried sweet bread.author: Betty S.
deep fried sweet bread.review:
Came here tonight with a few girlfriends. Its a weds night so it wasn't very busy at all - in fact there was only one other table when I got here. Another table came in while we were there..overall not busy on a weeknight at all. We come here because its a decent place to come to have Asian dessert to catch up on each others lives. 

We always ordered the eggettes to share. Normally it comes out nice and crunchy, but tonight it came out kinda soft and mushy..we always ask for a side of condensed milk to dip it in. And they always just give it to us with no problem. We also ordered the sesame balls in sweet soup - and that was pretty good. I ordered the taro tapioca, and it wasn't too sweet and it wasn't bland at all....I really liked this. We also ordered the deep fried sweet bread which was surprisingly pretty good. Its served with condensed milk. We also ordered the coconut milk in black sticky rice - and that came out kinda funny. The milk didn't taste like coconut milk at all...and when we told them that..they brought us some more coconut milk in its own cup, and it tasted a little spoiled. So they were nice enough to take the dessert away and asked if we wanted something else. We got a hot lemon tea. 

Overall, they have a lot of hk style desserts here. And if you have the munchies- they have sandwiches and ramen (probably instant) to eat. Everything here is cheap (around $2.50 - $6) and pretty decent. The space is pretty big and you should be able to get a seat on a weekday. I've been here on the weekends before as well and it can get packed. Overall, its not a bad place that stays open late to come and grab a dessert from.

excerpts: Friend and I both ordered the Deep fried sweet bread with condense milk sauce.
GOOOD GOOD GOOOD stuff.
Food came out freshly made and wasn't fried too much.
deep fried sweet bread.author: Garrick L.
deep fried sweet bread.review:
Came here hoping to get the free eggpuffs that I got from a website, but they ran out ! How do you run out of eggpuffs? Anyways, waitress was nice enough to let me choose another appetizer free of charge.

Friend and I both ordered the Deep fried sweet bread with condense milk sauce. GOOOD GOOD GOOOD stuff. Food came out freshly made and wasn't fried too much. Only problem is, it costs $3.95 for 4 pieces of small bread. 

Other friend ordered the nutella french toast. Order came decent size for the price. Must eat it hot though, because if you wait and eat it cold, it's just flat out nasty. ($3.95)

Why only 3 stars? Service was rather lacking even though there were nobody at the restaurant, and the atmosphere wasn't really appealing. 

P.S: They still charge 9.5% tax! Last time I check, tax is now 8.5%

excerpts: We sampled cheese sticks, sesame balls, deep fried sweet bread (no, not the french kind) and a shake.
I could've eaten 3-4 servings of sweet bread.
deep fried sweet bread.author: Joanne D.
deep fried sweet bread.review:
I've just been here for the first time the other night with my husband.  It was so cheap and tasty!  We sampled cheese sticks, sesame balls, deep fried sweet bread (no, not the french kind) and a shake.  I could've eaten 3-4 servings of sweet bread. Then again, I'm a starch freak who can eat bread and rice with any meal. 

If you're looking for a funky late night cafe for some authentic HK style dessert and drinks, you'll love MFC.

excerpts: SO FUNNY, I couldn't help but laugh, when i ordered mozzarella sticks and pot stickers at the same time!!!
I felt like a little kid making dinner for myself.
sounds funny, but I loved it.
Service was friendly and fast.
Prices are incredibly cheap.
Its a great place to stop in for a snack.
And they are open Late!
And I love a late snack!
pot stickers.author: Joy I.
pot stickers.review: SO FUNNY, I couldn't help but laugh, when i ordered mozzarella sticks and pot stickers at the same time!!! I felt like a little kid making dinner for myself. sounds funny, but I loved it. Service was friendly and fast. Prices are incredibly cheap. Its a great place to stop in for a snack. And they are open Late! And I love a late snack!

excerpts:
Mozzarella Sticks
Potstickers
mozzarella sticks.author: Joey C.
mozzarella sticks.review:
Be prepared to wait if you are doing take-out. I ordered five items and it took about 15-20 minutes. The food won me over so I'm not super mad. My friends and I were very sad that Purple Kow's kitchen closed. We decided to go here for some snacks. I'm Chinese so I know my cafes very well but my Filipino friends have rarely ever been to any. 

Our Order: 
Ham and Egg Sandwich (ask for toasted)
Luncheon Meat and Egg Sandwich (not Spam)
Egg Sandwich (toasted)
Mozzarella Sticks
Potstickers

The portion size is pretty big for the price. It fed the three of us for only $22! I mean these items are pretty inexpensive so it shouldn't be more than that. Anyways, I was just really happy this place is open late. There was only one lady running the whole thing and I'm sure there was a cook in the back. I will definitely be back to dine here! I love Chinese cafes!

excerpts: Sesame paste and your teeth are BFFs..lol) and since mozzarella sticks were phased out at Jack in the Box and McDonald's is nowhere to be found in  the area, this place actually serves good fries and mozzarella sticks.
mozzarella sticks.author: Gail M.
mozzarella sticks.review:
"You should go to my favorite cafe" Ok, where is it? "My favorite cafe" I know! But where?!"  That was my reaction when my friend told me about this place.
Hmm, where should I start? I would say this place was surprisingly good a.k.a  better than I expected! :) 
We got the mango delight which has the perfect dense and sweetness...oohh yess! You heard me! Puuurrffect sweetness!! (Yupp.. I'm talking about the mangoes too!!), egg puff-- which wasn't bad at all. Soft, moist, and has the perfect crisp on the edges. Oh! And not to mention their Nutella french toast with a scoop of butter(score!), chocolate drizzle and powdered sugar on top hits the spot!!!
Their sesame paste balls are my favorite!!(make sure to drink water before you smile though. Sesame paste and your teeth are BFFs..lol) and since mozzarella sticks were phased out at Jack in the Box and McDonald's is nowhere to be found in  the area, this place actually serves good fries and mozzarella sticks. :)

However, on the negative side,  you (most of the time ) have to waive your hand to get the server's attention.  Other than that,  it's worth a try! :)

excerpts: I love the friendly service, egg puffs are awesome, especially with whipped butter, the mozzarella sticks freaking rule!
mozzarella sticks.author: mia l.
mozzarella sticks.review:
For a late night bite, there is no better place than my favorite cafe, yes, the name says it all. I love the friendly service, egg puffs are awesome, especially with whipped butter, the mozzarella sticks freaking rule!

Coconut milk with tapioca was what was to be expected in the name sake-speaking of which, does anyone know what stewed snow frogs are? The french toast with ham and cheese is drop dead delicious, with a lot of maple syrup! my stomach is still thanking me for that one!
So if your not on a diet and need late night sweets, this is the place to be!!!

Huge selection of snacks and drinks.
Opens late.
Good place to come to for a midnight snack
peanut butter and condensed milk toast.author: Jean V.
peanut butter and condensed milk toast.review: Egg puffs are good. My favorite is the peanut butter and condensed milk toast. Huge selection of snacks and drinks. Opens late. Good place to come to for a midnight snack

excerpts: - Peanut butter french toast: Fluffy french toast, warmed peanut butter in between, drizzled with maple syrup
- B Jai grass jelly:
Ample fruit and grass jelly with a syrup.

Healthy dessert
- Happy Hour:
Cheap for good portion, wide selection, happy.
french toast.author: C. C.
french toast.review:
Unknowingly, it really did become my favorite cafe. Just realized that I basically frequent it weekly. Really friendly family owned business.

Favorites:
- Cold lemon honey: Theirs is the best because it's a refreshing kind of sweet. I think it's a lighter honey that they use.
- Peanut butter french toast: Fluffy french toast, warmed peanut butter in between, drizzled with maple syrup
- B Jai grass jelly: Ample fruit and grass jelly with a syrup. Healthy dessert
- Happy Hour: Cheap for good portion, wide selection, happy.

excerpts: French toast
bc they were out.
french toast.author: Zelda S.
french toast.review: Delicious mango pudding. Texture and flavor for a princess 彡 mango pieces are fresh. We got two waffles instead of French toast bc they were out. Tons of fruit and jellies and ice cream. Made me feel so happy *･゜ﾟ･*:.｡..｡.:*･'(*ﾟﾟ*)'･*:.｡. .｡.:*･゜ﾟ･*

excerpts: Nutella French Toast is BOMB!!!
french toast.author: Linda N.

excerpts: I thought the french toast w/ ham and cheese was just okay.
I do
like their sweet dinner rolls w/ condense milk
french toast.author: Jenna L.
french toast.review:
I thought the french toast w/ ham and cheese was just okay. I do like their sweet dinner rolls w/ condense milk :D

Their watermelon juice is really refreshing. But if you get a mixed fruit concoction - I advise to ask for less ice. It's mainly ice and very little fruit. 

Milk tea is not that sweet, so maybe ask for sugar on the side ;)

excerpts: And not to mention their Nutella french toast with a scoop of butter(score!), chocolate drizzle and powdered sugar on top hits the spot!!!
Their sesame paste balls are my favorite!!(make sure to drink water before you smile though.

excerpts: Oh, i don't like their french toast
..it reminds me of Chinese Doughnuts.
french toast.author: Michael N.
french toast.review:
Tha first time i came here, i was really excited ! I've heard about this place nd their sandwiches so I've wanted to try it out. First time, it was good nd maybe even great. But after coming several other times, this place becomes less nd less "great". Depends on your mood nd what you get.. Some of their selections are really good nd some are ok...ish. 

This place has just become a place to get some desert for around $4-5 at a really late time. Around 12 am.. I really like their smoothies, waffles with ice cream, potstickers nd sandwiches/fries ! Those are what i recommend on their menu, dont really know about tha others because i haven't really tried everything. Oh, i don't like their french toast..it reminds me of Chinese Doughnuts.

excerpts: I haven't been to this place that many times, only about 4 or 5 times and I usually get their mango or green tea shakes along with the nutella french toast, ramen or sandwiches.
I'm not a fan of the lighting.... it secretly trips me out but every time I've come here
I've had so much fun with my friends.
I love saying "hey let's go to my favorite cafe!"
and I really like that they're opened late.
One time I made the boyfriend go out with me at 1 am just to get my green tea shake.
Lumpy as it looks, it's just sooooo good.
I mean, it's not diet-friendly.
My first time trying the nutella french toast was an accident.
I thought I read nutella toast and what I saw almost disappointed me when it was served.
My first time trying the nutella french toast was an accident.
I thought I read nutella toast and what I saw almost disappointed me when it was served.
I HATE french toast.
But I thought, "Well, nutella makes everything taste better.
Let's just give it a try.
I am forever going to be in love with this place for making me a believer.
I'm not saying I like french toast now, but I'm not frenchtoast-phobic anymore.
french toast.author: Bonnie S.
french toast.review:
I haven't been to this place that many times, only about 4 or 5 times and I usually get their mango or green tea shakes along with the nutella french toast, ramen or sandwiches. I'm not a fan of the lighting.... it secretly trips me out but every time I've come here I've had so much fun with my friends. I love saying "hey let's go to my favorite cafe!" and I really like that they're opened late. One time I made the boyfriend go out with me at 1 am just to get my green tea shake. Lumpy as it looks, it's just sooooo good. I mean, it's not diet-friendly. None of the items on the menu are. 

My first time trying the nutella french toast was an accident. I thought I read nutella toast and what I saw almost disappointed me when it was served. I HATE french toast. But I thought, "Well, nutella makes everything taste better. Let's just give it a try." I am forever going to be in love with this place for making me a believer. I'm not saying I like french toast now, but I'm not frenchtoast-phobic anymore. Yipyip!

I've never had a bad experience with the service yet. Last year me and a group of like, 12 friends came busting in at 9 PM after Lovefest and they accommodated us so well. They were very patient with us when we were ordering, and at the end when we were just horsing around and trying to figure out the bill.

If you're a normal human being, I recomment it. And for all those yelpers who gave this place a low rating, I think your expectations are too high for a DESSERT cafe. (No offense :] ) Isn't a cafe just a place to enjoy some snacks, and hang out with friends? My Favorite Cafe is a nice place to go for that purpose.

excerpts:
My group got some curry fish balls, nutella french toast, and the mango delight.  

My friend thought the curry fish balls were a little too spicy for her and ordered some ice cream, and it came ON THE HOUSE! =]  

My friend thought the curry fish balls were a little too spicy for her and ordered some ice cream, and it came ON THE HOUSE! =]
french toast.author: Rachelle T.
french toast.review:
Maybe it was cravings for a good midnight snack or the company but I was satisfied with my whole experience here.  My friend has come here before and said that the service wasn't great, but it must have been a lucky Saturday night because the service was pretty good, especially since we ordered things three different times.  

My group got some curry fish balls, nutella french toast, and the mango delight.  

My friend thought the curry fish balls were a little too spicy for her and ordered some ice cream, and it came ON THE HOUSE! =]  

The guy wearing glasses was actually the person who was helping us the most: taking our orders, getting us ice cream, and coming over every time we needed something.  Much more helpful than the other guy who we tried to waive down for the bill, but never came over.  

I like this place because the food's pretty good and we were in desperate need of a snack place open late.

excerpts:
My favorite selections are posted in the picture section, but my recommendations are as follows:

- Peanut Butter French Toast
- Mixed Fruit in honey dew juice with sago
- Mango Madness
- Strawberry Madness
- Instant noodles with fried egg and spam
- Soy sauce chicken wings
french toast.author: Michael J.
french toast.review:
My Favorite Cafe is my favorite cafe!

When I'm hungry and when it's late at night, this is my top choice of places of going to get some snacks and desserts. Probably the only time I come here is when I am hanging out with my Asian friends, but other than that I'm rarely here. This place offers affordable snacks and desserts and a place to just talk and play card games or what not. 

Yes, why do I think this is the best in the city, it's because the variety of things you can get here is probably greater here than other places. I mean yes other places have good variety, but this is the only place that has good variety and tastes good as well. The only thing that sucks about this place is it's location. It's located all the way out in the Richmond District where there is no parking whatsoever. Yes you can drive around and get lucky, but if not, try walking 3-5 blocks. What sucks even more is that once you get to the front door of the cafe, some car leaves right in front of the place. 

Anyhow, my definite top choice in late night cafes is My Favorite Cafe hands down.  My favorite selections are posted in the picture section, but my recommendations are as follows:

- Peanut Butter French Toast
- Mixed Fruit in honey dew juice with sago
- Mango Madness
- Strawberry Madness
- Instant noodles with fried egg and spam
- Soy sauce chicken wings

excerpts: I'm also in love with their nutella french toast.
french toast.author: Beatrice T.
french toast.review:
Of all the Hong Kong cafes in the area, this one is my favorite for winter/fall.  (Creations is my favorite when mango is back in season).

Open late, never a wait, and service is generally pretty prompt.  I love their peanut paste egg waffles!  It's not on their usual menu but ask for it!  The paste is infused into the dough so it's not like you're eating chunks of peanut butter.  I'm also in love with their nutella french toast.  

But be warned that they're waffles are not like Belgium or sugar waffles.. they taste kinda chewy and almost like the egg waffles?  Not a fan.  

Their savory stuff is great too.  Much better than Kowloon Tong.  I like their house noodle that comes with a lil chicken.. a lil egg..  spam and some other stuff? 

And I rank their dun dan above Golden Island's.

But when it comes to the fresh fruit desserts.. theirs are good, but Creations is still the best.

excerpts: Like, I'm gonna take two pieces of french toast, slather them with nutella, batter the whole thing to make it into one solid mass, and then deep fry the entire concoction!
french toast.author: Michelle B.
french toast.review:
You know when you were a kid and you would sit around making up outrageous dessert concoctions in your head? 

Like, I'm gonna take two pieces of french toast, slather them with nutella, batter the whole thing to make it into one solid mass, and then deep fry the entire concoction! Cinnamon Toast Crunch ain't got nuthin' on my  ridiculous food combo skillz! 

The people at My Favorite Cafe have a two page menu devoted to things like this and they definitely put my dessert imagination to shame. Looking over their two page menu is an exercise in decoding a  six year olds view of what a menu should look like. Do I want something called a snow frog? I'm not entirely sure what that is and "fun fun mango " comes with a side of noodles so who knows what I'm in for if I decide to order Mango Madness? I could only hope that wind instruments would be involved in the presentation - doo doo dee doo!

excerpts: Other friend ordered the nutella french toast.
Order came decent size for the price.
Must eat it hot though, because if you wait and eat it cold, it's just flat out nasty.
french toast.author: Garrick L.
french toast.review:
Came here hoping to get the free eggpuffs that I got from a website, but they ran out ! How do you run out of eggpuffs? Anyways, waitress was nice enough to let me choose another appetizer free of charge.

Friend and I both ordered the Deep fried sweet bread with condense milk sauce. GOOOD GOOD GOOOD stuff. Food came out freshly made and wasn't fried too much. Only problem is, it costs $3.95 for 4 pieces of small bread. 

Other friend ordered the nutella french toast. Order came decent size for the price. Must eat it hot though, because if you wait and eat it cold, it's just flat out nasty. ($3.95)

Why only 3 stars? Service was rather lacking even though there were nobody at the restaurant, and the atmosphere wasn't really appealing. 

P.S: They still charge 9.5% tax! Last time I check, tax is now 8.5%

excerpts: gotta try the nutella french toast... love the milk tea pudding... love the black sticky rice with coconut milk.. love the strawberry madness... love the oreo milkshake.. love the strawberry juice...
I like everything...
french toast.author: s d.
french toast.review:
I think I've tried everything on the menu... seriously they should give me a membership card....

No.44 (dry noodles with chicken wings, beef and soup) is my favorite.
gotta try the nutella french toast... love the milk tea pudding... love the black sticky rice with coconut milk.. love the strawberry madness... love the oreo milkshake.. love the strawberry juice... I like everything... it's definitely my favorite cafe.

the only thing I don't like... parking is a pain in da butt.

excerpts: We ordered the Nutella french toast, deep friend banana with ice cream, chicken sandwich, green tea milkshake, &this one mango sago drink.
The food was pretty good & was reasonably cheap.
We spent a little bit less than $25 on everything.
french toast.author: BrendaJoy G.
french toast.review:
Yesterday was the first time I came in here. A friend &I came here in the afternoon, so there weren't much customers. We ordered the Nutella french toast, deep friend banana with ice cream, chicken sandwich, green tea milkshake, &this one mango sago drink. The food was pretty good & was reasonably cheap. We spent a little bit less than $25 on everything. The service was a little slow, but really friendly.

I have yet to explore the rest of their menu &I am forsure coming back if I crave any Asian desserts.

excerpts: The french toast with ham and cheese is drop dead delicious, with a lot of maple syrup!
my stomach is still thanking me for that one!
So if your not on a diet and need late night sweets, this is the place to be!!!
french toast.author: mia l.
french toast.review:
For a late night bite, there is no better place than my favorite cafe, yes, the name says it all. I love the friendly service, egg puffs are awesome, especially with whipped butter, the mozzarella sticks freaking rule!

Coconut milk with tapioca was what was to be expected in the name sake-speaking of which, does anyone know what stewed snow frogs are? The french toast with ham and cheese is drop dead delicious, with a lot of maple syrup! my stomach is still thanking me for that one!
So if your not on a diet and need late night sweets, this is the place to be!!!

excerpts: I LOVE THE nutella french toast with a side of ice cream.
Its also very cheap.
The only thing that sucks about this place is that they dont take CARD!!
BUT ITS still a great kick it spot ususally at night when there is nothing to do.

french toast.review: This is the place for desert. I LOVE THE nutella french toast with a side of ice cream. Its also very cheap. The only thing that sucks about this place is that they dont take CARD!! BUT ITS still a great kick it spot ususally at night when there is nothing to do.

excerpts: I love the French Toast the most.
It's thicker than what you get from other Cantonese cafe.

excerpts: - Peanut butter french toast: Fluffy french toast, warmed peanut butter in between, drizzled with maple syrup
- B Jai grass jelly:
Ample fruit and grass jelly with a syrup.

Healthy dessert
- Happy Hour:
Cheap for good portion, wide selection, happy.
peanut butter french toast.author: C. C.
peanut butter french toast.review:
Unknowingly, it really did become my favorite cafe. Just realized that I basically frequent it weekly. Really friendly family owned business.

Favorites:
- Cold lemon honey: Theirs is the best because it's a refreshing kind of sweet. I think it's a lighter honey that they use.
- Peanut butter french toast: Fluffy french toast, warmed peanut butter in between, drizzled with maple syrup
- B Jai grass jelly: Ample fruit and grass jelly with a syrup. Healthy dessert
- Happy Hour: Cheap for good portion, wide selection, happy.

excerpts: And not to mention their Nutella french toast with a scoop of butter(score!), chocolate drizzle and powdered sugar on top hits the spot!!!
Their sesame paste balls are my favorite!!(make sure to drink water before you smile though.
nutella french toast.author: Gail M.
nutella french toast.review:
"You should go to my favorite cafe" Ok, where is it? "My favorite cafe" I know! But where?!"  That was my reaction when my friend told me about this place.
Hmm, where should I start? I would say this place was surprisingly good a.k.a  better than I expected! :) 
We got the mango delight which has the perfect dense and sweetness...oohh yess! You heard me! Puuurrffect sweetness!! (Yupp.. I'm talking about the mangoes too!!), egg puff-- which wasn't bad at all. Soft, moist, and has the perfect crisp on the edges. Oh! And not to mention their Nutella french toast with a scoop of butter(score!), chocolate drizzle and powdered sugar on top hits the spot!!!
Their sesame paste balls are my favorite!!(make sure to drink water before you smile though. Sesame paste and your teeth are BFFs..lol) and since mozzarella sticks were phased out at Jack in the Box and McDonald's is nowhere to be found in  the area, this place actually serves good fries and mozzarella sticks. :)

However, on the negative side,  you (most of the time ) have to waive your hand to get the server's attention.  Other than that,  it's worth a try! :)

excerpts: The next thing we love is the luncheon meat and egg sandwich, we can honestly make it at home but something about the hk style makes it better.
The eggs are perfectly cooked, the spam isn't overly cooked and the crust is cut off!
I don't know if they add butter to the bread
but it tastes like it
egg sandwich.author: Stella J.
egg sandwich.review:
My favorite cafe isn't my favorite cafe but i do love the fact that it's located so close to my house. Back in the day my sisters and I use to love coming here for late night Hong Kong desserts and we absolutely loved it! 

I came back recently with one of my sisters and the quality is still great! We love love love the steamed milk with ginger, it's always a must order! The milk is steamed to perfection with a nice gingery flavor. It's not a spicy gingery bit a slightly sweet ginger taste that pulls this flavor together! 

The next thing we love is the luncheon meat and egg sandwich, we can honestly make it at home but something about the hk style makes it better. The eggs are perfectly cooked, the spam isn't overly cooked and the crust is cut off! I don't know if they add butter to the bread but it tastes like it and it's delicious! 

The other things that I like here are their fresh fruit sago and mango/ strawberry focused desserts those are usually a good bet on being delicious. Though I don't come here as often, I still make visits from time to time and they are still just as delicious!

Total for 2 people: $28

excerpts:
Our Order: 
Ham and Egg Sandwich (ask for toasted)
Luncheon Meat and Egg Sandwich 
(not Spam)
Egg Sandwich (toasted)
egg sandwich.author: Joey C.
egg sandwich.review:
Be prepared to wait if you are doing take-out. I ordered five items and it took about 15-20 minutes. The food won me over so I'm not super mad. My friends and I were very sad that Purple Kow's kitchen closed. We decided to go here for some snacks. I'm Chinese so I know my cafes very well but my Filipino friends have rarely ever been to any. 

Our Order: 
Ham and Egg Sandwich (ask for toasted)
Luncheon Meat and Egg Sandwich (not Spam)
Egg Sandwich (toasted)
Mozzarella Sticks
Potstickers

The portion size is pretty big for the price. It fed the three of us for only $22! I mean these items are pretty inexpensive so it shouldn't be more than that. Anyways, I was just really happy this place is open late. There was only one lady running the whole thing and I'm sure there was a cook in the back. I will definitely be back to dine here! I love Chinese cafes!

excerpts: So I ordered a Luncheon Meat and Egg sandwich.
That was the only reason I gave this place 3 stars.
It was great *
smiles*. Soft bread crispy spam and eggs prepared just the way I like it.
*thumbs up*
egg sandwich.author: Linda X.
egg sandwich.review:
I use to come here a lot about 2 years ago? I haven't been back since. So it's been awhile ...

First off the girls don't really pay much attention to you unless you own a freaking penis! And mind you I was with 4 guys and still crap service..geez.

I ordered the Fish Balls with Radish and Pigskin but minus the pigskin and a Papaya Milk. The Fish Balls took almost 10 minutes for it come out. And when I tasted it, felt like something was definitely missing from the soup base. I couldn't put my finger on it but definitely could've been better. The Papaya Milk? Way TOO much milk and not enough papaya. It was so creamy looking and not even orange-ish looking in color. It was horrible and tasted mostly of milk and barely a hint of papaya. YUCK! Mind you I was still semi-hungry, having just gotten out of night class. So I ordered a Luncheon Meat and Egg sandwich. That was the only reason I gave this place 3 stars. It was great *smiles*. Soft bread crispy spam and eggs prepared just the way I like it. *thumbs up*

Anyways, I was just really happy this place is open late. There was only one lady running the whole thing and I'm sure there was a cook in the back. I will definitely be back to dine here! I love Chinese cafes!

excerpts: So I ordered a Luncheon Meat and Egg sandwich.
That was the only reason I gave this place 3 stars.
It was great *
smiles*. Soft bread crispy spam and eggs prepared just the way I like it.
*thumbs up*
luncheon meat and egg sandwich.author: Linda X.
luncheon meat and egg sandwich.review:
I use to come here a lot about 2 years ago? I haven't been back since. So it's been awhile ...

First off the girls don't really pay much attention to you unless you own a freaking penis! And mind you I was with 4 guys and still crap service..geez.

I ordered the Fish Balls with Radish and Pigskin but minus the pigskin and a Papaya Milk. The Fish Balls took almost 10 minutes for it come out. And when I tasted it, felt like something was definitely missing from the soup base. I couldn't put my finger on it but definitely could've been better. The Papaya Milk? Way TOO much milk and not enough papaya. It was so creamy looking and not even orange-ish looking in color. It was horrible and tasted mostly of milk and barely a hint of papaya. YUCK! Mind you I was still semi-hungry, having just gotten out of night class. So I ordered a Luncheon Meat and Egg sandwich. That was the only reason I gave this place 3 stars. It was great *smiles*. Soft bread crispy spam and eggs prepared just the way I like it. *thumbs up*

excerpts: Their club sandwich and chicken sandwich are also pretty good too.
chicken sandwich.author: Kathy L.
chicken sandwich.review:
This is one of my default dessert places even though I rarely eat dessert whenever I go. I love the steamed rice noodles with hoisin & sesame peanut butter and the French fries. Their club sandwich and chicken sandwich are also pretty good too.

The service can be either spot-on or spotty. They are usually friendly and good with refilling tea. 

It's one of those places where you can go if you want to just chill somewhere late at night.

excerpts: I ordered a Chicken Sandwich w/ Fries ($5.25).
chicken sandwich.author: Vicky P.
chicken sandwich.review:
I looked up this place thinking that since the menu had a large variety of food, it'd be worth a shot to try it out. 

When we walked in, there were two separate groups already seated. I'm not sure if it was the quiet atmosphere or the lack of service, but from the get-go, I wasn't really diggin' it. The waitress, albeit kind, didn't pay much attention to us after we seated (we relocated afterward, choosing to sit by the window-seats with the comfy chairs); instead, she went to return a jacket to the group that just recently left (brownie points for her, but we were getting impatient). It felt quite chilly in the capacious cafe. Our food took awhile to get to us too (an even longer wait). I ordered a Chicken Sandwich w/ Fries ($5.25). The plate was small, although the size of the sandwich was fair enough, I suppose. 

I'm willing to try it again because of their variety of food and desserts. I'm going to shoot for the desserts rather than the actual food next time. Hopefully the service will be up-to-par the next time I visit.

excerpts: I always get my usual tofu  fa with mixed fruit, somebody always gets the french fries, the chicken sandwich, eggettes, ice cream waffle, ice lemon tea, etc etc.
This place does get pretty busy later at night so come earlier to get a seat or be prepared to wait
but its never that long.
chicken sandwich.author: Sarah L.
chicken sandwich.review:
Met some friends here last night for dessert. Its our usual dessert place. Wouldn't say its our favorite (in terms of taste) but they never rush us, we can sit/hang out/catch up with friends for as long as we like, and they'll always refill the hot tea. Which is what dessert is all about for us, especially since we don't get to see much of each other during the week anymore (post college days).

We've come here a lot over the years so we've tried our share of the menu. Nothings ever amazing but its not bad either. I always get my usual tofu  fa with mixed fruit, somebody always gets the french fries, the chicken sandwich, eggettes, ice cream waffle, ice lemon tea, etc etc. This place does get pretty busy later at night so come earlier to get a seat or be prepared to wait but its never that long.

excerpts: For the food during our visit, we ordered the chicken sandwich (includes fries) and sesame dumplings.
The chicken sandwich tasted a bit like the chicken burgers one can get at Burger King... except with bread rather than a bun.
That's nothing bad, but worth noting.
At $5, it was a good value.
chicken sandwich.author: Sami R.
chicken sandwich.review:
We had an early lunch, and so were craving a light dinner with dessert. Looking for something nearby, we opted for My Favorite Cafe to satisfy our dinner and sweet tooth craving.

For the food during our visit, we ordered the chicken sandwich (includes fries) and sesame dumplings. The chicken sandwich tasted a bit like the chicken burgers one can get at Burger King... except with bread rather than a bun. That's nothing bad, but worth noting. At $5, it was a good value. The sesame dumplings were also good, and a nice warm dessert.

Overall, we have nothing particularly bad to say about this place. It wasn't great, but is still okay, might even deserve a "high 3". Overall, we probably won't be back, but if we lived right next door we might frequent this place more often as a late night dessert hub.

excerpts: We ordered the Nutella french toast, deep friend banana with ice cream, chicken sandwich, green tea milkshake, &this one mango sago drink.
The food was pretty good & was reasonably cheap.
We spent a little bit less than $25 on everything.
chicken sandwich.author: BrendaJoy G.
chicken sandwich.review:
Yesterday was the first time I came in here. A friend &I came here in the afternoon, so there weren't much customers. We ordered the Nutella french toast, deep friend banana with ice cream, chicken sandwich, green tea milkshake, &this one mango sago drink. The food was pretty good & was reasonably cheap. We spent a little bit less than $25 on everything. The service was a little slow, but really friendly.

I have yet to explore the rest of their menu &I am forsure coming back if I crave any Asian desserts.

excerpts: I always get the chicken sandwich which is pretty good.
Always a good place to just eat, chill, and play cards if you're with a bunch of friends.
chicken sandwich.author: Benjamin L.
chicken sandwich.review: I've been to this place a bunch of times for late night dessert. If you're from SF, you know that service isn't that great. They don't come every now and then to check up on how you're doing with your food so you have to flag them down if you want anything. I always get the chicken sandwich which is pretty good. Always a good place to just eat, chill, and play cards if you're with a bunch of friends.

excerpts: I order the chicken sandwich was was good.
My friends ordered desserts.
I just got off work
and I was hungry.
We got here after one o'clock in the morning.
Not lot of people before it closes for the night.
Take only money.

chicken sandwich.review: The service was pretty fast. I order the chicken sandwich was was good.  My friends ordered desserts. I just got off work and I was hungry.  We got here after one o'clock in the morning.  Not lot of people before it closes for the night.  Take only money.

excerpts: I stopped by 2:30 today for a snack and ordered some chicken wings, toast, and a club sandwich.
The wings were super crispy, the toast had a good balanced of butter to condensed milk, and the club sandwich was everything I expected from a club sandwich.
I would definitely come back if I'm in the area looking for a snack.
Keep in mind, cash only.
club sandwich.author: Austin W.
club sandwich.review:
Definitely not a Tsui Wah, but pretty good HK diner food for cheap. I stopped by 2:30 today for a snack and ordered some chicken wings, toast, and a club sandwich. 

The wings were super crispy, the toast had a good balanced of butter to condensed milk, and the club sandwich was everything I expected from a club sandwich. I would definitely come back if I'm in the area looking for a snack. Keep in mind, cash only.

excerpts: This is MY go-to place for a good club sandwich with fries on my lazy days.
Who wants to go home from a bad day to have no food around and/or
club sandwich.author: Christina L.
club sandwich.review:
I feel like this place doesn't get enough recognition. Sure, it isn't the BEST food around town, but it's fairly decent as far as Asian desserts/munchies go. 

This is MY go-to place for a good club sandwich with fries on my lazy days. Who wants to go home from a bad day to have no food around and/or you have to cook?! 

Oh, and their oreo cookie milkshake here is yum!! Quite a while back when I was still in school (feeling old...), my classmate met me here for a snack and study session. I recommended the shake and my friend did not concentrate on anything I was trying to teach him until he was done - like, it had to be in his stomach or he'd be constantly reaching for (or eyeing) it. Lol. Oh, and maybe it was because they were not busy at the time, but they never rushed us off - pretty sure the two of us stayed for around two hours because we had a big test to study for and all we really ordered was a meal (I was starving) and a shake (he was trying it and loved it).

Yeah, yeah. Nothing stands out here THAT much, but it is pretty good in my opinion and they have ALWAYS been friendly to me - whether I was there, ordering to-go in-person or over the phone (there is now an extra $0.15 charge, but they give you a bag & napkins/utensils without even asking you), or just plain walking by. 

I live nearby and I hate how people brush them off just because nothing stands out with their food and whatnot. They are good people with pretty good food and a pleasant environment. That's all there is to it. ^-^

excerpts: the Club Sandwich.
For $5.95, the café's version had turkey, ham, eggs, lettuce, tomato, and bacon in three-toasted bread.
I also get a pile of fries with the sandwich.
This is not a http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VxT3LXwPdHEz1qpXeI5hig?select=_BbmMSXgtyPln_6H3Yh77gbad sandwich and the price isn't bad either.
Club sandwich:
club sandwich.author: Matt G.
club sandwich.review:
I'm not a big fan of most Hong Kong-style cafés and restaurants. Some of the places can be a haphazard. 

But this place is okay. The café serve appetizers, noodle and rice dishes, blended beverages and other sweet and savory treats made from fresh ingredients. 

I do like the late closing hours, which conveniently fit my frequent graveyard schedule. I was here last night (Tuesday night) for my lunch at 11:30pm and ordered #33: the Club Sandwich. For $5.95, the café's version had turkey, ham, eggs, lettuce, tomato, and bacon in three-toasted bread. I also get a pile of fries with the sandwich. This is not a http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VxT3LXwPdHEz1qpXeI5hig?select=_BbmMSXgtyPln_6H3Yh77gbad sandwich and the price isn't bad either. Club sandwich: 

I also ordered a cup of Watermelon juice. For $3.50, the watermelon chunks is pureed into a juice. Eh...okay, but bland. The drink wasn't too exciting. My drink: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VxT3LXwPdHEz1qpXeI5hig?select=FoOrNTlZ36XAjhoqWZWyuwexciting but did the job. Drink: 

The workers were very nice. Many of the younger patrons were having fun in the café. 

Despite being twice the age of many of the younger crowds, I do enjoy my time here.

excerpts: Their club sandwich and chicken sandwich are also pretty good too.

club sandwich.review:
This is one of my default dessert places even though I rarely eat dessert whenever I go. I love the steamed rice noodles with hoisin & sesame peanut butter and the French fries. Their club sandwich and chicken sandwich are also pretty good too.

The service can be either spot-on or spotty. They are usually friendly and good with refilling tea.

excerpts: Even if you happen to miss dinner because of oversleeping due to depression, this place serves a killer bacon club sandwich up until 2 A.M.!
The chicken/spam ramen is also a popular choice among us young independent individuals.
club sandwich.author: Andrew A.
club sandwich.review:
My Favorite Café

Ah... this cozy little store brings back fond memories. Nothing soothes a broken heart the way a Mango Madness does. There's just something about a mountain of mangos mixed in a bowl with ice cream and jelly that puts the soul at ease. 

Even if you happen to miss dinner because of oversleeping due to depression, this place serves a killer bacon club sandwich up until 2 A.M.! The chicken/spam ramen is also a popular choice among us young independent individuals. They also provide cool board games like Connect Four for you to play with during your stay (company not provided).

Whether you're looking for place to celebrate with fruity goodies or trying to fill an empty void over an ex-girlfriend who broke up with you because she's still in love with her ex-boyfriend after several weeks of entertaining a doomed and hopeless relationship with you, this place is family friendly for all!

excerpts: The only good late-night hunger satisfier I discovered is the club sandwich with fries, though an easy entree like that is pretty hard to screw up.
club sandwich.author: Felix C.
club sandwich.review:
This place is okay. Its big so seating is (almost) guaranteed on the busier nights. The food isn't really anything to write home about. The only good late-night hunger satisfier I discovered is the club sandwich with fries, though an easy entree like that is pretty hard to screw up.

Besides the space and location, I'd rather hit up 100% a few blocks away. Though I will admit the service here is better than the other dessert places, and its easier to find parking too.

excerpts: I came here with a friend and had a club sandwich with fries.
The fries were nice and crunchy, the sandwich wasn't too far off from what you'd get at Denny's but for a couple bucks cheaper.
They even had a few fried eggs in there for good measure.
club sandwich.author: Tony L.
club sandwich.review:
The name is misleading, but if you're in the mood for some edible food on the cheap, you've come to the right place.  I came here with a friend and had a club sandwich with fries.  The fries were nice and crunchy, the sandwich wasn't too far off from what you'd get at Denny's but for a couple bucks cheaper.  They even had a few fried eggs in there for good measure.  Not bad for around five bucks.

You could also spend the same kind of money at Le Cafe just a few blocks down and get a much better sandwich, but you wouldn't get the the same variety.  You can also get soup, noodles, and rice dishes.  If you're a local that's feeling too lazy to cook, My Favorite Cafe might be the place for you.

excerpts:
Our Order: 
Ham and Egg Sandwich (ask for toasted)
Luncheon Meat and Egg Sandwich 
(not Spam)
Egg Sandwich (toasted)
ham and egg.author: Joey C.
ham and egg.review:
Be prepared to wait if you are doing take-out. I ordered five items and it took about 15-20 minutes. The food won me over so I'm not super mad. My friends and I were very sad that Purple Kow's kitchen closed. We decided to go here for some snacks. I'm Chinese so I know my cafes very well but my Filipino friends have rarely ever been to any. 

Our Order: 
Ham and Egg Sandwich (ask for toasted)
Luncheon Meat and Egg Sandwich (not Spam)
Egg Sandwich (toasted)
Mozzarella Sticks
Potstickers

The portion size is pretty big for the price. It fed the three of us for only $22! I mean these items are pretty inexpensive so it shouldn't be more than that. Anyways, I was just really happy this place is open late. There was only one lady running the whole thing and I'm sure there was a cook in the back. I will definitely be back to dine here! I love Chinese cafes!

excerpts: The next thing we love is the luncheon meat and egg sandwich, we can honestly make it at home but something about the hk style makes it better.
The eggs are perfectly cooked, the spam isn't overly cooked and the crust is cut off!
I don't know if they add butter to the bread
but it tastes like it
luncheon meat and egg.author: Stella J.
luncheon meat and egg.review:
My favorite cafe isn't my favorite cafe but i do love the fact that it's located so close to my house. Back in the day my sisters and I use to love coming here for late night Hong Kong desserts and we absolutely loved it! 

I came back recently with one of my sisters and the quality is still great! We love love love the steamed milk with ginger, it's always a must order! The milk is steamed to perfection with a nice gingery flavor. It's not a spicy gingery bit a slightly sweet ginger taste that pulls this flavor together! 

The next thing we love is the luncheon meat and egg sandwich, we can honestly make it at home but something about the hk style makes it better. The eggs are perfectly cooked, the spam isn't overly cooked and the crust is cut off! I don't know if they add butter to the bread but it tastes like it and it's delicious! 

The other things that I like here are their fresh fruit sago and mango/ strawberry focused desserts those are usually a good bet on being delicious. Though I don't come here as often, I still make visits from time to time and they are still just as delicious!

Total for 2 people: $28

*thumbs up*
