luncheon meat and egg.review:
I use to come here a lot about 2 years ago? I haven't been back since. So it's been awhile ...

First off the girls don't really pay much attention to you unless you own a freaking penis! And mind you I was with 4 guys and still crap service..geez.

I ordered the Fish Balls with Radish and Pigskin but minus the pigskin and a Papaya Milk. The Fish Balls took almost 10 minutes for it come out. And when I tasted it, felt like something was definitely missing from the soup base. I couldn't put my finger on it but definitely could've been better. The Papaya Milk? Way TOO much milk and not enough papaya. It was so creamy looking and not even orange-ish looking in color. It was horrible and tasted mostly of milk and barely a hint of papaya. YUCK! Mind you I was still semi-hungry, having just gotten out of night class. So I ordered a Luncheon Meat and Egg sandwich. That was the only reason I gave this place 3 stars. It was great *smiles*. Soft bread crispy spam and eggs prepared just the way I like it. *thumbs up*

excerpts: I ordered the curry fish ball with rice noodle for my meal; The curry fish balls were tender and had a kick of spice to them.

I wasn't too happy to see the noodles and fish balls swimming in greasy/fatty broth, but I had to comment to my friend Mellie P. about how MFC seemed to be a "good place to eat at to treat a hangover".
curry fish ball.author: Helene K.
curry fish ball.review:
I bet others have already thought of a joke for My Favorite Cafe, but I could not help but imagine the following conversation after I went to My Favorite Cafe last night:

Person 1: Hey, do you want to go to My Favorite Cafe?
Person 2: Sure, what's the name of the place?
Person 1: My Favorite Cafe.
Person 2: I know it's your favorite cafe, but what's the name?
Person 1: My Favorite Cafe.
Person 2: Uh?

Okay, maybe bad joke, sorry. But maybe the owners/servers get a similar joke at times?

Well, last night was my first time going to My Favorite Cafe, and I must say I rather liked it. It was actually my first time to be in the Outer Richmond part of Clement Street, and I thought it was a lot calmer/local-centric than the Inner Richmond part of Clement. The inside of the cafe/restaurant is lit with hard fluorescent bulbs, so that gives off a different feel from most "usual" cafes. Don't come here if you expect to find a "cozy, calm" place to sit and read.

I find that as I frequent more Chinese/Asian cafes, the ambience definitely differs a lot from the American POV of cafes. Inside a Chinese cafe, it's the usual hustle-bustle of a restaurant, but people can sit and chat for ages on end. The noise level can vary inside; nobody really thinks to be quiet at an Asian cafe. The atmosphere is more lively, casual, and less intimate. In some strange way, I find this all relaxing to me; it makes me really get a feeling of home.

Anyway, onto the actual review of My Favorite Cafe.

The menu at MFC is impressive; there are cafe specialties, sandwiches, noodles, hot AND cold desserts, and specialty drinks. All items are priced under $10, so one can definitely get a bargain bite at MFC. However, most of the foods are unhealthy, but...hey, sometimes it's okay to indulge.

I ordered the curry fish ball with rice noodle for my meal; The curry fish balls were tender and had a kick of spice to them. I wasn't too happy to see the noodles and fish balls swimming in greasy/fatty broth, but I had to comment to my friend Mellie P. about how MFC seemed to be a "good place to eat at to treat a hangover". Granted, I rarely ever drink until I get a hangover, but I've heard from many other peers about how greasy food is good for "sopping up" the alcohol from one's system.

Aside from the greasy brother, the meal itself was tasty and filling. Afterwards, I had dessert: sesame-filled dumplings. 5 cute mochi/rice ball dumplings in clear brother; the mochi had a good texture to it and had a hint of sweet saltiness. The servers were very generous in re-filling our cups with tea and letting Mellie P. and I sit at the cafe for 3 hours chatting.....

The clientele consisted of a mix of Asian/Asian-Americans. MFC looks like a good place for families, party-goers, and young people alike. I'd love to live near a place like this, just knowing that I could pop in at midnight and order some food/dessert from them.

I'm curious to try the "stewed snow frog" listed under both the hot and cold desserts sections. I will probably order that the next time I am back at My Favorite Cafe.

Oh, and I hate to say it, but I think "My Favorite Cafe" could very well become MY favorite cafe in the City. =P

excerpts: Their "My Favorite Cafe Tossed Noodle" is SO GOOD !
But it's a bit over priced .
I had the fried buns last night ( haha ) with
condensed milk-- mmm soo good !!!
The prices are pretty reasonable .
Although it's kind of far for me to go to, it's still worth it because the food is good .
Even my mom & her friends come here -___-"
tossed noodle.author: Jenny Y.
tossed noodle.review: This is one of my favorite places to go to for late night desserts & snacks . Their "My Favorite Cafe Tossed Noodle" is SO GOOD ! But it's a bit over priced . I had the fried buns last night ( haha ) with condensed milk-- mmm soo good !!! The prices are pretty reasonable . Although it's kind of far for me to go to, it's still worth it because the food is good . Even my mom & her friends come here -___-"

excerpts: The preserved pickle & sliced pork chow mein was WAY TOO SALTY .
I decided to try the milk pudding because I've never had it before .
It tasted very odd .
Idk , maybe that's the way it's supposed to taste .
The egg puffs were good though .
Still like the ones at Eggette's more but the ones here are good too .
This place has dropped two stars in my book .
But since the owner or whoever was nice enough to read my review and tell me that he would improve things , I will give it an extra star .
Also because I like the slogan for this place .
Don't know what it is ?
Next time you visit , read the back of the servers' shirts .
sliced pork.author: Eileen L.
sliced pork.review: Like I said in my review of 100% Healthy Dessert , since I've been working at a dessert place I've been paying more attention to desserts . I came here again twice a few weeks ago with my friend to try some new things . I got a pear juice which taste a little odd . I got the three colored peanut dumplings  which was WAY TOO SWEET . The B-kid Jellygrass was not sweet enough . The milk tea pudding tastes kind of bitter and odd . I also didn't like its texture .. it's mushy just like the mango pudding I ordered . The preserved pickle & sliced pork chow mein was WAY TOO SALTY . I decided to try the milk pudding because I've never had it before . It tasted very odd . Idk , maybe that's the way it's supposed to taste . The egg puffs were good though . Still like the ones at Eggette's more but the ones here are good too . This place has dropped two stars in my book . But since the owner or whoever was nice enough to read my review and tell me that he would improve things , I will give it an extra star . Also because I like the slogan for this place . Don't know what it is ? Next time you visit , read the back of the servers' shirts .

excerpts:
The fish balls on the other hand was not spicy nor were they curried 
- Steamed egg custard with coconut milk: mMm
...this was so good and warmed my tummy.
steamed egg custard with coconut milk.author: Serena F.
steamed egg custard with coconut milk.review:
This place was dead when my bestie and I walked in at 11pm on a Wednesday night. We got to sit anywhere we wanted because there was no one to say anything if we sat in a table for 10. ;) Menus were placed on the table already and they were sticky. 

- Instant noodle w/ curry fish balls: I thought the only thing that was curry were the fish balls not the entire bowl of soup! This dish was far too spicy for me to stomach...and I couldn't eat it. The fish balls on the other hand was not spicy nor were they curried 
- Steamed egg custard with coconut milk: mMm...this was so good and warmed my tummy. It was just the right portion too.
- Creamed soda w/ milk: My best ordered this and the girl didn't give her the milk portion of the drink. I think she only heard cream soda and tuned out the rest because we were only charged for the cream soda.

Overall the food was not bad but you would think service would be better since we were the only ones in there...it wasn't. The girl was in her own little world. We had to holler in order to get her attention.

excerpts: I had the steamed egg custard with ginger.
This dish is actually pretty hard to find done well and this cafe does it very well.
The customer was smooth and creamy with just enough of the ginger bite.
Nice and balanced and they served it piping hot.
Also had the taro and tapioca soup.
Again, not overpowering with sweetness, served with fresh taro chunks and again served hot.
Add to it a nice set of hot and cold beverages and you have a really nice spot for an after dinner treat.
steamed egg custard with ginger.author: Scott C.
steamed egg custard with ginger.review: cheap with good desserts.  I am not sure about the savory snacks, but this place has a good selection of desserts.  I had the steamed egg custard with ginger.  This dish is actually pretty hard to find done well and this cafe does it very well.  The customer was smooth and creamy with just enough of the ginger bite.  Nice and balanced and they served it piping hot.  Also had the taro and tapioca soup.  Again, not overpowering with sweetness, served with fresh taro chunks and again served hot.  Add to it a nice set of hot and cold beverages and you have a really nice spot for an after dinner treat.

excerpts: But they had enough to make two servings of the steamed egg custard with sesame paste...
wait, what?
(They're also supposed to be open until midnight or so?
And they're out of these staples already?)
steamed egg custard with sesame paste.author: Yvonne K.
steamed egg custard with sesame paste.review:
The food is decent, but the ambience and service have a lot to be desired.

We came in around 4PM on a Saturday afternoon, looking for an afternoon delight/pick-me-up in the form of some tasty HK-style desserts. There were 6 of us, so they put us at a big table in the front next to the window. As soon as we sat down, everything felt... sticky. The table, the chairs, probably even the walls if we dared to touch them. After the worker placed the menus on the table, we literally had to peel them off.

We glanced through the menu and saw an assortment of delicious-sounding desserts. Steamed egg custard, steamed milk custard, sesame paste, egg puffs, blended fruit drinks. I wanted to try their milk tea pudding, but they were out. Boo. My mom wanted to try their black sesame paste, but they were also all out of that. But they had enough to make two servings of the steamed egg custard with sesame paste... wait, what? (They're also supposed to be open until midnight or so? And they're out of these staples already?) We shrugged and just let it go and ended up ordering two steamed egg custards with sesame paste, a mango smoothie, sesame egg puffs, and momo chacha (a dessert with taro chunks, yams, sago, and coconut milk).

As we waited, we began regretting the fact that we ordered pretty much all hot desserts. Even though the front door was open, there was zero air flow at the table we were seated at. And it was next to a window, so the sunshine that filtered in was magnified. It was like sitting in a greenhouse. We thought about asking to move, but that was their only large table, so we would all have to split up. It was a family outing, so... no dice on that.

The desserts came, and yeah, they were pretty good. (Except the mango smoothie... can someone say syrup overload?) We tried to eat as fast as we could so we wouldn't melt, but we also didn't want to burn our tongues on the hot food. Dilemmaaaaa. We eventually made it through, paid our bill, and rolled out. We interacted with the worker a total of six times: when she told us where to sit, when she set the menus down, when she took our order, when she gave us our bill, when she returned for the bill, and when she returned to give us the receipt. No friendly service here.

So, My Favorite Cafe? Not really. I would much rather go to one of the many other HK dessert shops in the Richmond area. The food here is decent, so I'm bumping them up to three stars, but the shoddy environment kills the good taste.

excerpts: I got the steamed EGG CUSTARD WITH SESAME PASTE combo.
BIG MISTAKE.
They serve the sesame paste at the bottom and the egg custard on top (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VxT3LXwPdHEz1qpXeI5hig?select=8mfWLulw-OuRdamwIFYbFw).
(I assume that they pour the egg custard mixture on top of the sesame paste and then steam the whole thing.)
The sesame paste itself was actually decent but the egg custard was absolutely disgusting.
Why, you ask?
It was undercook and still runny in the center (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VxT3LXwPdHEz1qpXeI5hig?select=LEihGlrvrQeSofUQHxKl0w).
This would've so much better
steamed egg custard with sesame paste.author: Steph L.
steamed egg custard with sesame paste.review:
I can never make up my mind when it comes to Chinese desserts. Black sesame paste, milk custard, egg custard, sesame dumplings, black sticky rice, grass jelly, HK-style waffle - I want them all!

This is why during my last visit to MFC I got the steamed EGG CUSTARD WITH SESAME PASTE combo. BIG MISTAKE. They serve the sesame paste at the bottom and the egg custard on top (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VxT3LXwPdHEz1qpXeI5hig?select=8mfWLulw-OuRdamwIFYbFw). (I assume that they pour the egg custard mixture on top of the sesame paste and then steam the whole thing.) The sesame paste itself was actually decent but the egg custard was absolutely disgusting. Why, you ask? It was undercook and still runny in the center (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VxT3LXwPdHEz1qpXeI5hig?select=LEihGlrvrQeSofUQHxKl0w). This would've so much better had they cooked the egg custard at the bottom first... 

I also got a HK-STYLE WAFFLE with peanut butter and condensed milk (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VxT3LXwPdHEz1qpXeI5hig?select=9sWRf79iCpmsohQtvGwFfw). This wasn't great, but at least it was edible. The waffle itself didn't seem fresh, though they are made to order. It was hard and served at room temperature - not like the waffles I had in HK at all. There wasn't enough peanut butter but they were very generous with the condensed milk.

This was a 2-star visit, but previous visits bump my rating up to 3 stars. I know they can do better!

excerpts: Came here late night after seeing Dan B posted a photo of steamed milk custard with durian.
And boy was it steaming good!
Milk and durian work well together because of its creamy texture.
I will rate this as my favorite hot durian desserts I've ever had.
steamed milk custard.author: Stan L.
steamed milk custard.review:
Durian run continues into My Favorite Cafe. 

Came here late night after seeing Dan B posted a photo of steamed milk custard with durian. And boy was it steaming good! Milk and durian work well together because of its creamy texture. I will rate this as my favorite hot durian desserts I've ever had. Ok, enough of my durian praise...

MFC is your typical Hong Kong style cafe serving small bite appetizers, rice/noodle dishes, blended fruit drinks, milk teas and desserts. I've yet tried the food but the watermelon drink and durian steamed milk custards were excellent. Cashier was very friendly. The place could use a renovation as the floors and green painted walls were pretty old. Will come back to try the food in the near future.

excerpts: Steamed egg custard, steamed milk custard, sesame paste, egg puffs, blended fruit drinks.
steamed milk custard.author: Yvonne K.
steamed milk custard.review:
The food is decent, but the ambience and service have a lot to be desired.

We came in around 4PM on a Saturday afternoon, looking for an afternoon delight/pick-me-up in the form of some tasty HK-style desserts. There were 6 of us, so they put us at a big table in the front next to the window. As soon as we sat down, everything felt... sticky. The table, the chairs, probably even the walls if we dared to touch them. After the worker placed the menus on the table, we literally had to peel them off.

We glanced through the menu and saw an assortment of delicious-sounding desserts. Steamed egg custard, steamed milk custard, sesame paste, egg puffs, blended fruit drinks. I wanted to try their milk tea pudding, but they were out. Boo. My mom wanted to try their black sesame paste, but they were also all out of that. But they had enough to make two servings of the steamed egg custard with sesame paste... wait, what? (They're also supposed to be open until midnight or so? And they're out of these staples already?) We shrugged and just let it go and ended up ordering two steamed egg custards with sesame paste, a mango smoothie, sesame egg puffs, and momo chacha (a dessert with taro chunks, yams, sago, and coconut milk).

As we waited, we began regretting the fact that we ordered pretty much all hot desserts. Even though the front door was open, there was zero air flow at the table we were seated at. And it was next to a window, so the sunshine that filtered in was magnified. It was like sitting in a greenhouse. We thought about asking to move, but that was their only large table, so we would all have to split up. It was a family outing, so... no dice on that.

The desserts came, and yeah, they were pretty good. (Except the mango smoothie... can someone say syrup overload?) We tried to eat as fast as we could so we wouldn't melt, but we also didn't want to burn our tongues on the hot food. Dilemmaaaaa. We eventually made it through, paid our bill, and rolled out. We interacted with the worker a total of six times: when she told us where to sit, when she set the menus down, when she took our order, when she gave us our bill, when she returned for the bill, and when she returned to give us the receipt. No friendly service here.

So, My Favorite Cafe? Not really. I would much rather go to one of the many other HK dessert shops in the Richmond area. The food here is decent, so I'm bumping them up to three stars, but the shoddy environment kills the good taste.

excerpts: Recently, they've also had steamed milk custard with durian (榴蓮燉奶) and it is a bowl of steamed milk chock full of durian pieces.
steamed milk custard.author: Renee L.
steamed milk custard.review:
I can't say this is my favorite cafe, but it is in my top three for HK dessert in the Richmond/Sunset area.  I have been coming here for ages and I like that not much has changed.  Still don't like parking in the area though.  They still show random talk shows on the TV, are still a popular hangout for large young groups, still have so many off-menu items taped all over, have old men playing Chinese checkers loudly at night...  And they still use real ingredients for their desserts.  This place is the best if you're looking for traditional Chinese desserts. 

Lately, my favorite has been the sweet potato soup (番薯糖水) which has a heavenly amount of ginger in it.  It's got an amazing spicy punch and it's hard to find anywhere else but home that will add so much ginger into the soup.  They also use different types of sweet potatoes so you've got shades of purples, oranges, and yellows while you eat.  Recently, they've also had steamed milk custard with durian (榴蓮燉奶) and it is a bowl of steamed milk chock full of durian pieces.  Of course, if you want something more normal, the mango delight (mango pomelo sago soup, 楊枝甘露) is a great safe choice. The steamed rice noodles are the best here too.  Overall good value across the menu. 

I believe it is cash only.

excerpts: #67 Ginger-infused steamed milk custard:
A hongkie standard.
Very smooth and deep ginger flavor.
steamed milk custard.author: Jana C.
steamed milk custard.review:
#84 Mango Madness... mango pudding (with great flavor) topped with thin layer of mango sauce... diced mangoes delicately placed in that sauce, and huge scoop of mango ice cream to finish off the madness. Great.

#67 Ginger-infused steamed milk custard: A hongkie standard. Very smooth and deep ginger flavor.

excerpts: i love my steamed milk custard with durian.
My two favorite things in one bowl!
If only parking wasn't such a pain in this area.
This one girl that works here is always super nice!
And we always get good service here.
steamed milk custard.author: Belinda C.
steamed milk custard.review: This place was my college hang out place. This was the place where we went when we didn't go to class, after the movies, after the clubs, after dinner and so much more.  Therefore, i apologize to you, My Favorite Cafe for a long long over due review.  You still make the best MoMo Cha Cha in the city.  You are generous with your portions of red bean and taro, and it's cooked perfectly right,it's soft but not to soft. It's the perfect amount of gooey-ness ( if that is even a word) . Your steamed ginger milk custard is smooth and not too sweet or too gingery.    And now you service Durian desserts!!!  I love it!! i love my steamed milk custard with durian. My two favorite things in one bowl!   If only parking wasn't such a pain in this area. This one girl that works here is always super nice! And we always get good service here.

excerpts: Steamed milk custard with sesame was good, although people said that it was better with coconut milk.
steamed milk custard.author: Ted W.
steamed milk custard.review:
Came here for a pre-dinner snack before we went to PPQ down the street. We probably should have come here earlier and ordered more food since it's not like you can really get full on crab. 

Steamed milk custard with sesame was good, although people said that it was better with coconut milk.

The egg puffs are also good -- nice and crispy, much better than Break Time down in Cupertino Village. 

I'll also have to try and find out what the snow frogs are next time...

excerpts:
Milk Sandwich - very yummy - better than PB&J
Black Rice with Warm Coconut Milk - tasted healthy in a good way
Steamed Milk Custard - reminiscent of Cream of Wheat or a hot milk to help you go to bed
and
steamed milk custard.author: Andrew K.
steamed milk custard.review:
Very good. We had.
LOTS OF TEA REFILLS FOR FREE.
Mango Yum Yum - fresh/refreshing
Peanut Butter Condensed Milk Sandwich - very yummy - better than PB&J
Black Rice with Warm Coconut Milk - tasted healthy in a good way
Steamed Milk Custard - reminiscent of Cream of Wheat or a hot milk to help you go to bed
and Egg Waffle - a unique texture
In a nutshell it was all very delicious AND brought me back to Taiwan.

excerpts: I only get one thing here...the steamed milk custard.
It is super yummy.
I've never eaten any other foods here.
I had the most delicious steamed milk custard in Hong Kong and have been trying to find something comparable.
So far My Favorite Cafe has come the closest.
steamed milk custard.author: Kathy L.
steamed milk custard.review: I only get one thing here...the steamed milk custard. It is super yummy. I've never eaten any other foods here. I had the most delicious steamed milk custard in Hong Kong and have been trying to find something comparable. So far My Favorite Cafe has come the closest.

excerpts: #Silken Milk with Ginger: B-.
For some reasons, the top layer of this dish was very nice (my roommate was even saying the dish was a 5-star), but after digging down deeper it became worse and worse.
silken milk with ginger.author: Simon C.
silken milk with ginger.review:
After finishing dim sum on a Saturday afternoon, was craving for some desserts. Saw this cafe with quite high rating and decided to give it a try.

It was around 3pm and the place was almost empty. Sat down and was quickly provided menus.

#Mixed Fruits Mango Pudding: B-.
The mango pudding was not very good. Usually a good one would have soft, smooth and silky texture but the one I had was a bit hard - I don't think it was because of over frozen but it's more related to the making process I suppose. The fruit was not fresh at all. Papaya and kiwi are the ones among the most disappointed ones.

#Hong Kong Style Egg Puff: B.
Not crispy, and not hot enough. More like eating soft bread.

#Silken Milk with Ginger: B-.
For some reasons, the top layer of this dish was very nice (my roommate was even saying the dish was a 5-star), but after digging down deeper it became worse and worse. Clearly it was also a making process type of thing.

I don't think I will go back again. Question: How come I still can't find a good Hong Kong style dessert joint in SF?

excerpts: Coconut milk with tapioca was what was to be expected in the name sake-speaking of which, does anyone know what stewed snow frogs are?
coconut milk with tapioca.author: mia l.
coconut milk with tapioca.review:
For a late night bite, there is no better place than my favorite cafe, yes, the name says it all. I love the friendly service, egg puffs are awesome, especially with whipped butter, the mozzarella sticks freaking rule!

Coconut milk with tapioca was what was to be expected in the name sake-speaking of which, does anyone know what stewed snow frogs are? The french toast with ham and cheese is drop dead delicious, with a lot of maple syrup! my stomach is still thanking me for that one!
So if your not on a diet and need late night sweets, this is the place to be!!!

excerpts: I had the coconut milk with white fungus and tapioca.
It was really good and don't let the name fool you.
coconut milk with white fungus and tapio.author: Jeanne L.
coconut milk with white fungus and tapio.review: Its just like any other Asian dessert spot.  I came with a huge group after a wedding banquet so I got to try a few other items. There's was the black sticky rice with coconut milk which was not too sweet at all and the best waffle and ice cream I've ever laid eyes on.  Overall I thought the desserts were good. I had the coconut milk with white fungus and tapioca. It was really good and don't let the name fool you.They also have chocolate chip egg puffs! How weird is that?! Gotta try it yourself.

excerpts: Taro with tapioca for $3.50.
Dammit.
It was already too late to change my order!
taro with tapioca.author: B B.
taro with tapioca.review:
You are NOT my favorite cafe.  

As I'm looking at the "cold drink" menu, I ask the worker....

Me:  "Do you have any cold taro drinks?"

Worker: "No. But we have this....."
 *points to milk tea, ovaltine and some other drinks that don't interest me..*

*I'm thinking "WTF?! I don't want that sh*t! I asked for taro!"*

Me: "Can I try the coconut milk and mango juice w/aloe, please?"

He takes my order and starts making my drink. As I'm waiting, guess what I noticed on their "Hot Dessert" menu? Taro with tapioca for $3.50. Dammit. It was already too late to change my order! Maybe next time...

Even though they didn't have taro tea w/boba, the drink I ordered filled my heart with joy. Didn't have my camera but I believe this is the same drink: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VxT3LXwPdHEz1qpXeI5hig?select=CgpsYx1dwOp-YuZ9yavKYg Who would have thought mango juice and coconut milk would taste soooo good together! Every sip I took, chunks of aloe and fresh mango traveled up my straw and went inside my mouth. Man, oh man, that drink was delicious! Totally worth the $3.95!    

I've passed this place 10 billions times. Today was the first time I actually went inside. I'm glad I did because they actually have some tasty looking desserts here! They also have food! Btw, they're open til 2am on Fri-Sat. Guess where I'll be going after a night of drinking. Yup, that's right... "My Favorite Cafe" which is NOT my favorite cafe. But I'll definitely be back. =P

excerpts: - the taro with tapioca: i thought it was a drink.
it wasn't.
it was a bowl with warm taro and tapioca.
i was pleasantly surprised.
- the peanut butter thick toast: f-ing awesome.
nuff said.
- and this "speacial tofu dish with red bean and sesame paste" that didn't have any tofu in it: wtf?
minus one star.
boooo.
taro with tapioca.author: geneive j.
taro with tapioca.review:
i'm always down for a place that you can roll hella late, sit there forever playing your cards, and nosh on a gigantic menu of treats.. yay.

i went here cuz it was past twelve and my bf and i had a serious case of the munchies.. so we ordered: 
- the eggettes: pretty good. but not as crispy as i would have wanted it.
- the waffle with ice cream and fruit: the waffle was crispy. and the fruit was decent. the ice cream was.. meh. more icy than creamy.
- the taro with tapioca: i thought it was a drink. it wasn't. it was a bowl with warm taro and tapioca. i was pleasantly surprised.
- the peanut butter thick toast: f-ing awesome. nuff said.
- and this "speacial tofu dish with red bean and sesame paste" that didn't have any tofu in it: wtf? minus one star. boooo. i wanted tofu.

other than that.. it was chill. i'd go back and try some more stuff.. maybe this time i'll bring board games and sit in the comfy chairs by the window..

excerpts: We shrugged and just let it go and ended up ordering two steamed egg custards with sesame paste, a mango smoothie, sesame egg puffs, and momo chacha (a dessert with taro chunks, yams, sago, and coconut milk).
momo chacha.author: Yvonne K.
momo chacha.review:
The food is decent, but the ambience and service have a lot to be desired.

We came in around 4PM on a Saturday afternoon, looking for an afternoon delight/pick-me-up in the form of some tasty HK-style desserts. There were 6 of us, so they put us at a big table in the front next to the window. As soon as we sat down, everything felt... sticky. The table, the chairs, probably even the walls if we dared to touch them. After the worker placed the menus on the table, we literally had to peel them off.

We glanced through the menu and saw an assortment of delicious-sounding desserts. Steamed egg custard, steamed milk custard, sesame paste, egg puffs, blended fruit drinks. I wanted to try their milk tea pudding, but they were out. Boo. My mom wanted to try their black sesame paste, but they were also all out of that. We shrugged and just let it go and ended up ordering two steamed egg custards with sesame paste, a mango smoothie, sesame egg puffs, and momo chacha (a dessert with taro chunks, yams, sago, and coconut milk).

As we waited, we began regretting the fact that we ordered pretty much all hot desserts. Even though the front door was open, there was zero air flow at the table we were seated at. And it was next to a window, so the sunshine that filtered in was magnified. It was like sitting in a greenhouse. The desserts came, and yeah, they were pretty good. (Except the mango smoothie... can someone say syrup overload?)
