So, My Favorite Cafe? Not really. I would much rather go to one of the many other HK dessert shops in the Richmond area. The food here is decent, so I'm bumping them up to three stars, but the shoddy environment kills the good taste.

excerpts: I do wish there were more pictures since some of the desserts like "Mango Delight" and "Mango Madness" are hard to distinguish what exactly goes in.
Lots of yummy hot food dishes if you and your friends skipped dinner, etc.
mango madness.author: Jennifer C.
mango madness.review:
Mom and Pop's type of dessert shop.

I love how this is one of the few dessert spots in SF that is opened past midnight. The prices are relatively cheap and they have so many desserts. I do wish there were more pictures since some of the desserts like "Mango Delight" and "Mango Madness" are hard to distinguish what exactly goes in. Lots of yummy hot food dishes if you and your friends skipped dinner, etc. I got the fried bananas with ice cream and it was so good, hot crispy fried bananas with cold ice cream and some whipped cream for less than $7???? Tell me where else you could get that in SF. The only downside is that the tables are kind of sticky but besides that service is friendly, desserts and food are inexpensive and plentiful.

excerpts: Back then, my go-to's were the mango madness, strawberry madness, and the egg puffs.
I decided to stick with what I now and ordered the mango madness and egg puffs again because why fix something that isn't broken?
Mango madness is mango pudding topped with a scoop of mango ice cream and big mango cubes that surround the ice cream.
mango madness.author: Cynthia T.
mango madness.review:
[3.5 stars]

Haven't been to this place in years! Used to come here all the time in high school on Friday nights. Two of my friends hit me up last Thursday night saying they wanted to come here and I was so down. This is one of the few dessert places that stay open past midnight in the area which is nice for those late night dessert cravings. 

The place has lots of seating and I've never had to wait for a table. Back then, my go-to's were the mango madness, strawberry madness, and the egg puffs. I decided to stick with what I now and ordered the mango madness and egg puffs again because why fix something that isn't broken?

Mango madness is mango pudding topped with a scoop of mango ice cream and big mango cubes that surround the ice cream. Mango pudding wasn't overly sweet which is a good thing, the mango ice cream was a very generous scoop and mango cubes were sweet as well. If you love mango, this is the dessert choice for you! 

Now onto the egg puffs! Before when I got it, the inside was very cakey. I think they used a pancake batter. It wasn't bad but it wasn't as good as Eggettes which is still my number one place to go to for egg puffs. However when I bit into the egg puff this time, it tasted exactly like Eggettes! Omg I was so happy. Don't know what they changed about their batter but I hope they never change it again. 

Service can be kind of slow even if it is nearly empty because there's only one worker taking orders and making the cold desserts and I'm guessing only one or two workers in the back who make the hot food orders. Oh! And this place is cash only.

excerpts: strawberry madness and mango madness.
It's a great place to play board games and grab a bite.
I give it a three star because they are not that faithful to their opening hours.
Went there on a weekend in the afternoon, and they were not open.
No sign or anything on the door saying they would be closed.
Disappointed.
mango madness.author: Laura Z.
mango madness.review: Good food and a good place to hang out with friends. Their desserts are really worth the price esp. strawberry madness and mango madness. It's a great place to play board games and grab a bite. I give it a three star because they are not that faithful to their opening hours. Went there on a weekend in the afternoon, and they were not open. No sign or anything on the door saying they would be closed. Disappointed.

excerpts: I couldn't tell the difference between a Mango Delight vs. a Mango Madness even by looking at the picture
but maybe that's just my own problem.
Mango Madness - I was really disappointed by this.
mango madness.author: Laverne N.
mango madness.review:
My Favorite Cafe is not my favorite cafe.

My visit could be described in one word: Okay 

I had a difficult time navigating the menu since some of the menu items have names that don't really depict anything about what it actually is. I couldn't tell the difference between a Mango Delight vs. a Mango Madness even by looking at the picture but maybe that's just my own problem. :|

We ordered:
1. Egg puff - It was good!
2. Mango Madness - I was really disappointed by this. :( Maybe I'm too used to Creations' mango pudding but I felt this one was way too sweet and it didn't have a 'refreshing' aspect to it.
3. Fish balls + pig skin (appetizer?): I didn't try it but my boyfriend said it was really good.
4. Some sort of jelly drink with ice: I thought it was just okay but my boyfriend liked it.

Total came out to around 19 dollars. CASH ONLY - but it doesn't really bother me cause it's just like every other place that accepts cash only in SF. Creations is still my go-to late night dessert spot because I prefer the taste and it seems like they offer a wider variety of items. However, I wouldn't mind going here again since its less crowded and parking is easier to find. I'll probably just try different things next time.

excerpts: and they have a decent mango madness.
mango madness.author: Norris T.
mango madness.review:
This is my no.2 latenight goto for your standard chinese dessert shop fare. They have decent ice cream dishes that can be very artistic and I will as a I like and they have a decent mango madness. 

Quick Tip: get the dessert duh!

excerpts: #84 Mango Madness... mango pudding (with great flavor) topped with thin layer of mango sauce...
mango madness.author: Jana C.
mango madness.review:
#84 Mango Madness... mango pudding (with great flavor) topped with thin layer of mango sauce... diced mangoes delicately placed in that sauce, and huge scoop of mango ice cream to finish off the madness. Great.

#67 Ginger-infused steamed milk custard: A hongkie standard. Very smooth and deep ginger flavor.

excerpts: Mango Madness and Strawberry Madness are really good.
mango madness.author: Colleen M.
mango madness.review:
Certainly not my favorite cafe, but it's a go-to place for late night dessert.

It can get insanely crowded in here at night, but it's worth the wait.

The hot desserts are yummy; hot sesame balls in syrup. Too bad it's $3.99 for five measly balls.
Mango Madness and Strawberry Madness are really good.

This is probably irrelevant but the waitress that served us was SUPER cute! She looked like a little squirrel behind big glasses. This is not meant to be mean at all, she was just adorable.

excerpts: Nothing soothes a broken heart the way a Mango Madness does.
mango madness.author: Andrew A.
mango madness.review:
My Favorite Café

Ah... this cozy little store brings back fond memories. Nothing soothes a broken heart the way a Mango Madness does. There's just something about a mountain of mangos mixed in a bowl with ice cream and jelly that puts the soul at ease. 

Even if you happen to miss dinner because of oversleeping due to depression, this place serves a killer bacon club sandwich up until 2 A.M.! The chicken/spam ramen is also a popular choice among us young independent individuals. They also provide cool board games like Connect Four for you to play with during your stay (company not provided).

Whether you're looking for place to celebrate with fruity goodies or trying to fill an empty void over an ex-girlfriend who broke up with you because she's still in love with her ex-boyfriend after several weeks of entertaining a doomed and hopeless relationship with you, this place is family friendly for all!

excerpts: I eventually settled with the Mango madness and my friends had the strawberry madness.

The waiter then got to work (he's the only one working at the time), I know the food was definitely worth the wait because when he came with his tray of goodies, I noticed the strawberry was sculpted so beautifully.
It was indeed, edible art and tasty as well.
mango madness.author: Tina O.
mango madness.review:
Thanks to Yelp, I've gained such a huge burden (more like craving) to try all of the Asian dessert joints around the city. One more stop to add to the list was My Favorite Cafe.

This place was very empty when we arrived Friday evening. I'm assuming this is because most people show up in the later hours. No complaints here, that means we have the waiter's attention all to ourselves. The menu was pretty extensive and yet again I had trouble deciding what I wanted. I usually go with my gut feeling by looking at the pictures but they were so tiny (thumbnail size) and weren't so many to look at. What a bummer! I asked about the Fun Fun Mango, it seemed too daring at the time; coconut flavored ho fun noodles with mango. I eventually settled with the Mango madness and my friends had the strawberry madness. The waiter then got to work (he's the only one working at the time), I know the food was definitely worth the wait because when he came with his tray of goodies, I noticed the strawberry was sculpted so beautifully. It was indeed, edible art and tasty as well. Overall, It was decently priced for icecream, mango pudding, and real fruit ~ $5. I can see why many can call this their favorite cafe.

P.S I had no idea they served Durian (reading from past reviews), I gotta come back to try it.

excerpts: We ordered the Mango Madness, Strawberry Madness, and the Hong Kong style egg puff.
The strawberry madness really was a delicious conglomerate of strawberry madness.
The mango madness was pretty similar, except it had a lot more mango pieces in it.
The egg puff was pretty unique, but tasted really good for something so simple.
Overall, this place was great and was very cheap as well!
mango madness.author: Dmitriy S.
mango madness.review:
After battling the Pho Challenge across the street and failing miserably, we were looking for a good dessert place to just relax and eat some yummy Chinese desserts. This place turned out to be exactly what we were looking for!

At first, the waitress was a bit slow taking our orders and messed up, but it happens with a large group of people. At 11pm on a Monday night, this place still had quite a good amount of customers. 

We ordered the Mango Madness, Strawberry Madness, and the Hong Kong style egg puff. The strawberry madness really was a delicious conglomerate of strawberry madness. It consisted of strawberry jello, (but not the kind you get out of a box from Safeway) covered with strawberry ice cream, pieces of strawberry and whipped cream. The mango madness was pretty similar, except it had a lot more mango pieces in it. The egg puff was pretty unique, but tasted really good for something so simple. Overall, this place was great and was very cheap as well!

excerpts: I snuck some of the mango madness and strawberry madness from my friends and those were tasty.
Fiance got the banana smoothie which was pretty darn delicious.
mango madness.author: Shana B.
mango madness.review:
All my SF friends have iPhones anyways so it wasn't hard to find this late night spot for desserts after getting out of PPQ around 10pm or so. Very large menu of both sweet and savory items so it was really hard for our group to decide on what to order. I snuck some of the mango madness and strawberry madness from my friends and those were tasty. Fiance got the banana smoothie which was pretty darn delicious. I got the sesame dumplings, which reminded me of my childhood, so that was very satisfying. 

Overall, great place for late night sweets and chilling with friends.

excerpts: I ordered the mango madness, which was pretty good.
mango madness.author: Julia K.
mango madness.review:
Definitely not my favorite cafe, but it was ok. It's just another late-night dessert place, but I don't know if I'll come back.

The service wasn't bad like some people below have said - the main guy who was in charge took care of us pretty well. 

I ordered the mango madness, which was pretty good. It was mango ice cream in a pool of mango puree which was the top layer to a mango pudding. I thought everything was really good, until I hit the pudding. It was a funny texture that I didn't really like with my ice cream and mango puree. 

My friend saw a picture of one of their desserts that was a big flavored shaved ice with fruit toppings. She was really excited about it, but when it arrived at the table, it was a disappointment. the ice was supposed to be honeydew flavored, but it was really watered down and just tasted like ice. There was very minimal fruit on it as well. Overall, that dessert was not very good.

I still prefer late night dessert places like Creations and Crepe Temptations.

excerpts: My friend ordered the Mango Madness(?) which I believe was mangoo puree with pieces of mango and mango ice cream.
mango madness.author: Justine O.
mango madness.review:
My craving for ice cream changed to sago and then went back to ice cream. My friend ordered the Mango Madness(?) which I believe was mangoo puree with pieces of mango and mango ice cream. I ended up getting a banana split -- something I haven't had in a looong time. Then we split egg puffs. The banana split was pretty big and I was already full from dinner so I had trouble finishing it. The egg puffs were delicious. They were crispy on the edges which I love.

When we went, it was pretty empty. They had a TV turned to ABC so we ended up staying and watching Dancing with the Stars for a bit. My friend and I aren't really into the show, but we definitely were that night. Haha it felt like we were hanging out in my living room.

I went up to pay and I noticed there was a bowl of lollipops so I took one to enjoy as I left :).

excerpts:
My favorite selections are posted in the picture section, but my recommendations are as follows:

- Peanut Butter French Toast
- Mixed Fruit in honey dew juice with sago
- Mango Madness
- Strawberry Madness
- Instant noodles with fried egg and spam
- Soy sauce chicken wings
mango madness.author: Michael J.
mango madness.review:
My Favorite Cafe is my favorite cafe!

When I'm hungry and when it's late at night, this is my top choice of places of going to get some snacks and desserts. Probably the only time I come here is when I am hanging out with my Asian friends, but other than that I'm rarely here. This place offers affordable snacks and desserts and a place to just talk and play card games or what not. 

Yes, why do I think this is the best in the city, it's because the variety of things you can get here is probably greater here than other places. I mean yes other places have good variety, but this is the only place that has good variety and tastes good as well. The only thing that sucks about this place is it's location. It's located all the way out in the Richmond District where there is no parking whatsoever. Yes you can drive around and get lucky, but if not, try walking 3-5 blocks. What sucks even more is that once you get to the front door of the cafe, some car leaves right in front of the place. 

Anyhow, my definite top choice in late night cafes is My Favorite Cafe hands down.  My favorite selections are posted in the picture section, but my recommendations are as follows:

- Peanut Butter French Toast
- Mixed Fruit in honey dew juice with sago
- Mango Madness
- Strawberry Madness
- Instant noodles with fried egg and spam
- Soy sauce chicken wings

excerpts: I'm not entirely sure what that is and "fun fun mango " comes with a side of noodles so who knows what I'm in for if I decide to order Mango Madness?
I could only hope that wind instruments would be involved in the presentation - doo doo dee doo!
mango madness.author: Michelle B.
mango madness.review:
You know when you were a kid and you would sit around making up outrageous dessert concoctions in your head? 

Like, I'm gonna take two pieces of french toast, slather them with nutella, batter the whole thing to make it into one solid mass, and then deep fry the entire concoction! Cinnamon Toast Crunch ain't got nuthin' on my  ridiculous food combo skillz! 

The people at My Favorite Cafe have a two page menu devoted to things like this and they definitely put my dessert imagination to shame. Looking over their two page menu is an exercise in decoding a  six year olds view of what a menu should look like. Do I want something called a snow frog? I'm not entirely sure what that is and "fun fun mango " comes with a side of noodles so who knows what I'm in for if I decide to order Mango Madness? I could only hope that wind instruments would be involved in the presentation - doo doo dee doo!

excerpts: We came here on a Friday night for dessert and ordered the Nutella toast, cheurn fun, mango madness, and the sesame dumplings.
Only the Nutella toast was good, everything else was below average.
The service did not help either, it took them 15 minutes just to get our orders.
They also messed up our order and charged us extra for something we did not order!!!
I would not recommend this place but if your hungry and everywhere else is closed, I guess this place is better than nothing.....
mango madness.author: Casey N.
mango madness.review: What can I say about My Favorite Cafe........ except it isn't my favorite cafe, far from it. We came here on a Friday night for dessert and ordered the Nutella toast, cheurn fun, mango madness, and the sesame dumplings. Only the Nutella toast was good, everything else was below average. The service did not help either, it took them 15 minutes just to get our orders. They also messed up our order and charged us extra for something we did not order!!! I would not recommend this place but if your hungry and everywhere else is closed, I guess this place is better than nothing.....

excerpts: The mango madness is it?!?
Something with mango.
But that will satisfy that sweet tooth of yours.
mango madness.author: Paul Christian M.
mango madness.review:
I like this place. It's a pretty chill place...

They got hella choices to choose from. If you're hungry they got a wide variety of meals. Pretty basic food. Wouldn't really come if I was just looking for an actual meal, it's usually things you can just make at home...

But the desserts are really good. The mango madness is it?!? Something with mango. But that will satisfy that sweet tooth of yours. Also the sesame balls are good, soft and chewy(sounds... Nvm) but yes very crackin. 

They're open hella late on weekends so that's a plus. Service was kind and pretty quick no problem with that. The only thing is sometimes parking sucks. You'll pass it a couple times usually, before getting a nice spot... Other than that, it's cool...

excerpts: Their mango madness LOOKED and TASTED so good..
mango madness.author: Elaine H.
mango madness.review:
Your average cafe place, but a little more "fun and colorful" looking. I like how they have some nicer chairs (more modern look) near the windows. Bright lighting, very cute. But the dessert... just as anywhere else right?

edit: came back again today 5/22/08 when my company wanted to go to Kowloon. I recall this place being neater and less crowded (an so I was right about the less crowded part (but probably because its a Thursday night at 11:30pm vs. Saturday night at 1am). The place is bigger than crowded and the tables are definitely arranged so that they aren't all cramped together. 

I had the curry fish balls, which weren't very curry-like (I prefer Kowloon's). The steamed custard with ginger was very yummy (and good for you). They messed up on the preserved vegetable & pork rice noodle and gave us macaroni instead, but my company had no complaints about the taste. We also had some sort of hot tapioca w/ coconut (sauce and actual slices of perhaps baby coconut), and it was very good. 

4 items and the total came out to be a little over $17 before tips.

edit 5/31/08 their coconut/mango drink doesn't compare to the one at Creations, but I still love this place. It was one of my friend's first time here, and even she said she likes this place more than Kowloon. It was Friday night yesterday around 1:45am when we came here, and it was not at all crowded. Their mango madness LOOKED and TASTED so good..

excerpts: so far i've tried the onion rings, which aren't as greasy as most places, the ramen noodles with spam, egg, chicken wings, and some beef thing.. mango madness, egg custard with ginger, and sesame dumplings.
every single item has hit the spot and only cost about $5! service is kind of spotty but whatever, it's an asian place.
mango madness.author: Angela L.
mango madness.review:
any place that is open until 12:30 on a weekday gets an A in my book. add the fact that they serve DELICIOUS desserts and food for cheap, and it gets an A freaking +.

so far i've tried the onion rings, which aren't as greasy as most places, the ramen noodles with spam, egg, chicken wings, and some beef thing.. mango madness, egg custard with ginger, and sesame dumplings. every single item has hit the spot and only cost about $5! service is kind of spotty but whatever, it's an asian place. there is one guy that works here who's actually pretty nice and friendly. 

parking sucks, but if you go later on a weekday it should be fine. 

this is totally my favorite cafe.. mwahaha. lame. i know, but i had to.

excerpts: Mango Madness; MADNESS REALLY?!
I didn't see what I wanted.
But I like the mango
mango madness.author: Carolyn Y.
mango madness.review:
It's not all great. But it's not all bad.
1 star for the CRAZY mangoness. I love most.
+1 star for showing the Bee movie!
+2 for the right in front of the store parking.
Mango Madness; MADNESS REALLY?! I didn't see what I wanted.
But I like the mango..
Love the ice cream, just like everywhere else with ice cream.
Cute baby too! 
I was talking about Eggettes with my friend, and some person just intruded.
And started a conversation on their own about eggettes.
Kinda uncomfortable... but it was alrighty. I feel lame, after eatting all these deserts!  I like creations (:

excerpts: The mango madness was yummy goodness (lots of mango, mango jelly, mango ice cream, real mango chunks).
Now I only have to head back to try out all the other stuff on their rmenu.
mango madness.author: Lily L.
mango madness.review: My friend recommended this as opposed to 100% healthy desserts. The first time we went, we couldn't get any seats and was on the waiting list, but being impatient decided to skip. This weekend we returned, we didn't have to wait for a table, fantastic! The waitress was nice and friendly giving good suggestions for alternatives since they didn't have any of the milkshakes until 20 minutes later (20 minutes for a milkshake? that's ridiculous). I had the black sesame paste (delicious, not the best i've had, but it was good). My sister had the sesame rice noodles (peanut butter sauce?) was actually really tasty, wish the portion was bigger. The mango madness was yummy goodness (lots of mango, mango jelly, mango ice cream, real mango chunks). Now I only have to head back to try out all the other stuff on their rmenu.

excerpts: I do wish there were more pictures since some of the desserts like "Mango Delight" and "Mango Madness" are hard to distinguish what exactly goes in.
Lots of yummy hot food dishes if you and your friends skipped dinner, etc.
mango delight.author: Jennifer C.
mango delight.review:
Mom and Pop's type of dessert shop.

I love how this is one of the few dessert spots in SF that is opened past midnight. The prices are relatively cheap and they have so many desserts. I do wish there were more pictures since some of the desserts like "Mango Delight" and "Mango Madness" are hard to distinguish what exactly goes in. Lots of yummy hot food dishes if you and your friends skipped dinner, etc. I got the fried bananas with ice cream and it was so good, hot crispy fried bananas with cold ice cream and some whipped cream for less than $7???? Tell me where else you could get that in SF. The only downside is that the tables are kind of sticky but besides that service is friendly, desserts and food are inexpensive and plentiful.

excerpts: I couldn't tell the difference between a Mango Delight vs. a Mango Madness even by looking at the picture
but maybe that's just my own problem.
Mango Madness - I was really disappointed by this.
mango delight.author: Laverne N.
mango delight.review:
My Favorite Cafe is not my favorite cafe.

My visit could be described in one word: Okay 

I had a difficult time navigating the menu since some of the menu items have names that don't really depict anything about what it actually is. I couldn't tell the difference between a Mango Delight vs. a Mango Madness even by looking at the picture but maybe that's just my own problem. :|

We ordered:
1. Egg puff - It was good!
2. Mango Madness - I was really disappointed by this. :( Maybe I'm too used to Creations' mango pudding but I felt this one was way too sweet and it didn't have a 'refreshing' aspect to it.
3. Fish balls + pig skin (appetizer?): I didn't try it but my boyfriend said it was really good.
4. Some sort of jelly drink with ice: I thought it was just okay but my boyfriend liked it.

Total came out to around 19 dollars. CASH ONLY - but it doesn't really bother me cause it's just like every other place that accepts cash only in SF. Creations is still my go-to late night dessert spot because I prefer the taste and it seems like they offer a wider variety of items. However, I wouldn't mind going here again since its less crowded and parking is easier to find. I'll probably just try different things next time.

excerpts: Of course, if you want something more normal, the mango delight (mango pomelo sago soup, 楊枝甘露) is a great safe choice.
mango delight.author: Renee L.
mango delight.review:
I can't say this is my favorite cafe, but it is in my top three for HK dessert in the Richmond/Sunset area.  I have been coming here for ages and I like that not much has changed.  Still don't like parking in the area though.  They still show random talk shows on the TV, are still a popular hangout for large young groups, still have so many off-menu items taped all over, have old men playing Chinese checkers loudly at night...  And they still use real ingredients for their desserts.  This place is the best if you're looking for traditional Chinese desserts. 

Lately, my favorite has been the sweet potato soup (番薯糖水) which has a heavenly amount of ginger in it.  It's got an amazing spicy punch and it's hard to find anywhere else but home that will add so much ginger into the soup.  They also use different types of sweet potatoes so you've got shades of purples, oranges, and yellows while you eat.  Recently, they've also had steamed milk custard with durian (榴蓮燉奶) and it is a bowl of steamed milk chock full of durian pieces.  Of course, if you want something more normal, the mango delight (mango pomelo sago soup, 楊枝甘露) is a great safe choice. The steamed rice noodles are the best here too.  Overall good value across the menu. 

I believe it is cash only.

excerpts: #86 Mango Delight is just another, simpler & similar version of #110 Mixed Fruit w/ Mango Juice.
The only difference is #86 is $0.25 more, doesn't have extra fruit, and is a bit sour due to some citrus pulps mixed into it.
Go for #110 instead; it's more worth it and is more colorful too!
mango delight.author: Priscilla W.
mango delight.review:
My friends and I came here around 3PM, and there was only about four other people inside. There was only one waitress, and she was pretty nice. Our orders didn't take too long, but it didn't come in a flash either. My Favorite Cafe has a huge menu with over 150 different selections but with only few pictures to catch my eye. The good thing is that those pictures are really what you see, unlike those on the TV dinner boxes.

#86 Mango Delight is just another, simpler & similar version of #110 Mixed Fruit w/ Mango Juice. The only difference is #86 is $0.25 more, doesn't have extra fruit, and is a bit sour due to some citrus pulps mixed into it. Go for #110 instead; it's more worth it and is more colorful too! I should have tried the Milk Tea Pudding instead... maybe next time. They give you complimentary tea too, in a plastic cup that shouldn't be used to serve hot drinks.

excerpts: We got the mango delight which has the perfect dense and sweetness...
oohh yess!
You heard me!
Puuurrffect sweetness!!
(Yupp.. I'm talking about the mangoes too!!), egg puff-- which wasn't bad at all.
Soft, moist, and has the perfect crisp on the edges.
Oh!
mango delight.author: Gail M.
mango delight.review:
"You should go to my favorite cafe" Ok, where is it? "My favorite cafe" I know! But where?!"  That was my reaction when my friend told me about this place.
Hmm, where should I start? I would say this place was surprisingly good a.k.a  better than I expected! :) 
We got the mango delight which has the perfect dense and sweetness...oohh yess! You heard me! Puuurrffect sweetness!! (Yupp.. I'm talking about the mangoes too!!), egg puff-- which wasn't bad at all. Soft, moist, and has the perfect crisp on the edges. Oh! And not to mention their Nutella french toast with a scoop of butter(score!), chocolate drizzle and powdered sugar on top hits the spot!!!
Their sesame paste balls are my favorite!!(make sure to drink water before you smile though. Sesame paste and your teeth are BFFs..lol) and since mozzarella sticks were phased out at Jack in the Box and McDonald's is nowhere to be found in  the area, this place actually serves good fries and mozzarella sticks. :)

However, on the negative side,  you (most of the time ) have to waive your hand to get the server's attention.  Other than that,  it's worth a try! :)

excerpts:
Mango Delight
2.)
mango delight.author: Angela L.
mango delight.review:
3.5
DESSERT AND DRANK:
1.) Mango Delight
2.) Milk Tea - tasted funny


SERVICE:
Nice, but slow


ATMOSPHERE:
A verrry casual HK cafe....

excerpts:
My group got some curry fish balls, nutella french toast, and the mango delight.  

My friend thought the curry fish balls were a little too spicy for her and ordered some ice cream, and it came ON THE HOUSE! =]  

My friend thought the curry fish balls were a little too spicy for her and ordered some ice cream, and it came ON THE HOUSE! =]
mango delight.author: Rachelle T.
mango delight.review:
Maybe it was cravings for a good midnight snack or the company but I was satisfied with my whole experience here.  My friend has come here before and said that the service wasn't great, but it must have been a lucky Saturday night because the service was pretty good, especially since we ordered things three different times.  

My group got some curry fish balls, nutella french toast, and the mango delight.  

My friend thought the curry fish balls were a little too spicy for her and ordered some ice cream, and it came ON THE HOUSE! =]  

The guy wearing glasses was actually the person who was helping us the most: taking our orders, getting us ice cream, and coming over every time we needed something.  Much more helpful than the other guy who we tried to waive down for the bill, but never came over.  

I like this place because the food's pretty good and we were in desperate need of a snack place open late.

excerpts: i like this one more than the mango delight because it has mango chunks instead of just tapioca pudding.
-Rice Noodles:
I forget what their called on the menu but they're steamed and kinda sticky.
More of a dim sum like item, rather than a desert.
I really like it though.
It comes out piping hot and with a salty dipping sauce (hoisin i think).
-Egg
Puff:
One time I came here and the lady said she didn't have condensed milk.
mango delight.author: Danielle G.
mango delight.review:
Hmm, I really wish we could rate with half stars because I want to say 3.5 stars. Unfortunately, it had to drop to 3 instead of up-ing it to 4. I like to joke and say that this is really my favorite cafe. Ok, well it is not, but it is a place I like to go for a late night dessert or snack. 

I've had a few things on the menu and I've always been pretty happy:
-Mango Delight: really yummy and a nice sweet treat. i am such a sucker for mango anything.
-Mango Madness: love the fact that this one has ice cream with it. i like this one more than the mango delight because it has mango chunks instead of just tapioca pudding.
-Rice Noodles: I forget what their called on the menu but they're steamed and kinda sticky. More of a dim sum like item, rather than a desert. I really like it though. It comes out piping hot and with a salty dipping sauce (hoisin i think).
-Egg Puff: One time I came here and the lady said she didn't have condensed milk. I don't think she understood us because the next time we got condensed milk with no questions asked. 

I'm sure I've tried other things, but I can't remember at the moment. They do give you complimentary hot tea. Parking sucks. Service can be okay, depending. I suggest trying it out.

excerpts: it is kind of pricey, i tried the mango delight..
okay.. the mango delight was better, this isnt the best dessert place i went to, but its okay.
there was only one person working here, the service wasnt the best.
mango delight.author: Bailey L.
mango delight.review: it is kind of pricey, i tried the mango delight.. my friend had like the strawberry madness, it looked nice! but  it tasted okay.. the mango delight was better, this isnt the best dessert place i went to, but its okay. there was only one person working here, the service wasnt the best.

excerpts: I had the mango delight (yeung gee gum lo) which is mango + pomelo + small tapioca.
It was sickening sweet and lacked the fruity flavors.
mango delight.author: Nancie T.
mango delight.review:
After dinner at Genki Ramen...

Me: Lets go to My Favorite Cafe, I haven't been there in a while.
Friend: ok, where is your favorite cafe? 
Me: No, its not MY favorite cafe. Its their name, which sucks, because it isn't really MY favorite cafe. But I don't feel like the crappy customer service at Kowloon Tong.

which leads to a meager 3-stars at Kowloon Tong. I had the mango delight (yeung gee gum lo) which is mango + pomelo + small tapioca. It was sickening sweet and lacked the fruity flavors. The friend ordered 2 scoops of ice cream. Now - my advice to you - when you go to a HK-style cafe, you don't order ice cream! You know that they get their ice cream from those 2 gallon buckets at Foods Co. Its like going to Baskin Robbins and ordering **gasp** Vanilla! No offense, but you can buy a half-gallon of Dreyers at Safeway for wayyy less. Ok, back to topic. So the friend gets her 2 scoops of green tea ice cream and it was horrid. It was bitter, had no green tea flavor whatsoever, and had that ice burn smell. Nasty. So we asked the server if we can get another flavor instead. The server was very nice and promptly exchanged it to Mango for us. Once again, nothing spectacular. It was sweet and had that artificial flavoring color. Note to My Favorite Cafe: please do your customers a favor order your ice cream from Magnolia or Polly-Anns.. or at least get the real stuff with no artificial flavoring!

excerpts: I've tried the mango delight, the waffles with ice cream, and the fried banana which were all good.
But I cant figure out their ice cream...
their strawberry taste too strawberry almost fake and their coconut is a bit to coconutty for me, but it tastes fine eaten with whatever its served.
mango delight.author: Maritess N.
mango delight.review: This is the place I go to when I get a weird Asian dessert craving. Its the first Asian dessert place I have been to & I don't mind it (I'm still trying out other places). The best part is that their open super late! Easy to get to with lots of parking. I've tried the mango delight, the waffles with ice cream, and the fried banana which were all good. But I cant figure out their ice cream... their strawberry taste too strawberry almost fake and their coconut is a bit to coconutty for me, but it tastes fine eaten with whatever its served.

excerpts: Back then, my go-to's were the mango madness, strawberry madness, and the egg puffs.
I decided to stick with what I now and ordered the mango madness and egg puffs again because why fix something that isn't broken?
Mango madness is mango pudding topped with a scoop of mango ice cream and big mango cubes that surround the ice cream.
strawberry madness.author: Cynthia T.
strawberry madness.review:
[3.5 stars]

Haven't been to this place in years! Used to come here all the time in high school on Friday nights. Two of my friends hit me up last Thursday night saying they wanted to come here and I was so down. This is one of the few dessert places that stay open past midnight in the area which is nice for those late night dessert cravings. 

The place has lots of seating and I've never had to wait for a table. Back then, my go-to's were the mango madness, strawberry madness, and the egg puffs. I decided to stick with what I now and ordered the mango madness and egg puffs again because why fix something that isn't broken?

Mango madness is mango pudding topped with a scoop of mango ice cream and big mango cubes that surround the ice cream. Mango pudding wasn't overly sweet which is a good thing, the mango ice cream was a very generous scoop and mango cubes were sweet as well. If you love mango, this is the dessert choice for you! 

Now onto the egg puffs! Before when I got it, the inside was very cakey. I think they used a pancake batter. It wasn't bad but it wasn't as good as Eggettes which is still my number one place to go to for egg puffs. However when I bit into the egg puff this time, it tasted exactly like Eggettes! Omg I was so happy. Don't know what they changed about their batter but I hope they never change it again. 

Service can be kind of slow even if it is nearly empty because there's only one worker taking orders and making the cold desserts and I'm guessing only one or two workers in the back who make the hot food orders. Oh! And this place is cash only.

excerpts: strawberry madness and mango madness.
It's a great place to play board games and grab a bite.
I give it a three star because they are not that faithful to their opening hours.
Went there on a weekend in the afternoon, and they were not open.
No sign or anything on the door saying they would be closed.
Disappointed.
strawberry madness.author: Laura Z.
strawberry madness.review: Good food and a good place to hang out with friends. Their desserts are really worth the price esp. strawberry madness and mango madness. It's a great place to play board games and grab a bite. I give it a three star because they are not that faithful to their opening hours. Went there on a weekend in the afternoon, and they were not open. No sign or anything on the door saying they would be closed. Disappointed.

excerpts: Eating dessert here is a meal in it of itself - we had the bean curd dessert soup with the egg and the strawberry madness.
And they threw in some nutella and banana waffles.
I was really full!
Everything was really good and yummy and the service was attentive and efficient.
strawberry madness.author: Chris L.
strawberry madness.review: Eating dessert here is a meal in it of itself - we had the bean curd dessert soup with the egg and the strawberry madness.  And they threw in some nutella and banana waffles.  I was really full!  Everything was really good and yummy and the service was attentive and efficient.

excerpts: Mango Madness and Strawberry Madness are really good.
strawberry madness.author: Colleen M.
strawberry madness.review:
Certainly not my favorite cafe, but it's a go-to place for late night dessert.

It can get insanely crowded in here at night, but it's worth the wait.

The hot desserts are yummy; hot sesame balls in syrup. Too bad it's $3.99 for five measly balls.
Mango Madness and Strawberry Madness are really good.

This is probably irrelevant but the waitress that served us was SUPER cute! She looked like a little squirrel behind big glasses. This is not meant to be mean at all, she was just adorable.

excerpts: and I just shared a Steamed Rice Roll and a Strawberry Madness.
My friend suggested me to try the Strawberry Madness http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VxT3LXwPdHEz1qpXeI5hig?select=FcO1Jd0Whoww_VvoafGpvA since she knows I like strawberries.
strawberry madness.author: Mona C.
strawberry madness.review:
[M]ona: 3.5 Stars
[W]ayne: 3 Stars
Average: 3.25 Stars
 
+ Open Late
+ Fast Service
+ Good Variety of Foods and Desserts
+ Lots of Magazines

- Rounded Tables
- Cash Only

[M] Erm... definitely not my favorite cafe... I came here with Wayne and my girlfriends the other night and found this place to be quite lively. We sat ourselves near the back while waiting for my other friends to come. One thing I found quite irritating about My Favorite Cafe was that all their tables are all rounded. It was difficult to figure out a way to sit the 5 of us~  

We weren't really in the mood to eat so Wayne and I just shared a Steamed Rice Roll and a Strawberry Madness.

[W] The Steamed Rice Rolls http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VxT3LXwPdHEz1qpXeI5hig?select=Y69ceZI1qqDTU1Xe08oDJQ were pretty good but it could've used a little more dipping sauce on the side. It was very juicy and tasty though. 

[M] My friend suggested me to try the Strawberry Madness http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VxT3LXwPdHEz1qpXeI5hig?select=FcO1Jd0Whoww_VvoafGpvA since she knows I like strawberries. Not the best tasting dessert ever, though I did like the ice cream on top. The jello on the bottom, however, was too "milky" so I couldn't eat it.. Other than that, the presentation was nice I suppose. 

[W] The environment is like any other Chinese dessert place. Nothing too special other than it probably had a better selection of desserts to choose from other than your regular places where people always order Eggettes and whatnot.

excerpts: I eventually settled with the Mango madness and my friends had the strawberry madness.

The waiter then got to work (he's the only one working at the time), I know the food was definitely worth the wait because when he came with his tray of goodies, I noticed the strawberry was sculpted so beautifully.
It was indeed, edible art and tasty as well.
strawberry madness.author: Tina O.
strawberry madness.review:
Thanks to Yelp, I've gained such a huge burden (more like craving) to try all of the Asian dessert joints around the city. One more stop to add to the list was My Favorite Cafe.

This place was very empty when we arrived Friday evening. I'm assuming this is because most people show up in the later hours. No complaints here, that means we have the waiter's attention all to ourselves. The menu was pretty extensive and yet again I had trouble deciding what I wanted. I usually go with my gut feeling by looking at the pictures but they were so tiny (thumbnail size) and weren't so many to look at. What a bummer! I asked about the Fun Fun Mango, it seemed too daring at the time; coconut flavored ho fun noodles with mango. I eventually settled with the Mango madness and my friends had the strawberry madness. The waiter then got to work (he's the only one working at the time), I know the food was definitely worth the wait because when he came with his tray of goodies, I noticed the strawberry was sculpted so beautifully. It was indeed, edible art and tasty as well. Overall, It was decently priced for icecream, mango pudding, and real fruit ~ $5. I can see why many can call this their favorite cafe.

P.S I had no idea they served Durian (reading from past reviews), I gotta come back to try it.

excerpts: We ordered the Mango Madness, Strawberry Madness, and the Hong Kong style egg puff.
The strawberry madness really was a delicious conglomerate of strawberry madness.
The mango madness was pretty similar, except it had a lot more mango pieces in it.
The egg puff was pretty unique, but tasted really good for something so simple.
Overall, this place was great and was very cheap as well!
strawberry madness.author: Dmitriy S.
strawberry madness.review:
After battling the Pho Challenge across the street and failing miserably, we were looking for a good dessert place to just relax and eat some yummy Chinese desserts. This place turned out to be exactly what we were looking for!

At first, the waitress was a bit slow taking our orders and messed up, but it happens with a large group of people. At 11pm on a Monday night, this place still had quite a good amount of customers. 

We ordered the Mango Madness, Strawberry Madness, and the Hong Kong style egg puff. The strawberry madness really was a delicious conglomerate of strawberry madness. It consisted of strawberry jello, (but not the kind you get out of a box from Safeway) covered with strawberry ice cream, pieces of strawberry and whipped cream. The mango madness was pretty similar, except it had a lot more mango pieces in it. The egg puff was pretty unique, but tasted really good for something so simple. Overall, this place was great and was very cheap as well!

excerpts: I snuck some of the mango madness and strawberry madness from my friends and those were tasty.
Fiance got the banana smoothie which was pretty darn delicious.
strawberry madness.author: Shana B.
strawberry madness.review:
All my SF friends have iPhones anyways so it wasn't hard to find this late night spot for desserts after getting out of PPQ around 10pm or so. Very large menu of both sweet and savory items so it was really hard for our group to decide on what to order. I snuck some of the mango madness and strawberry madness from my friends and those were tasty. Fiance got the banana smoothie which was pretty darn delicious. I got the sesame dumplings, which reminded me of my childhood, so that was very satisfying. 

Overall, great place for late night sweets and chilling with friends.

excerpts:
My favorite selections are posted in the picture section, but my recommendations are as follows:

- Peanut Butter French Toast
- Mixed Fruit in honey dew juice with sago
- Mango Madness
- Strawberry Madness
- Instant noodles with fried egg and spam
- Soy sauce chicken wings
strawberry madness.author: Michael J.
strawberry madness.review:
My Favorite Cafe is my favorite cafe!

When I'm hungry and when it's late at night, this is my top choice of places of going to get some snacks and desserts. Probably the only time I come here is when I am hanging out with my Asian friends, but other than that I'm rarely here. This place offers affordable snacks and desserts and a place to just talk and play card games or what not. 

Yes, why do I think this is the best in the city, it's because the variety of things you can get here is probably greater here than other places. I mean yes other places have good variety, but this is the only place that has good variety and tastes good as well. The only thing that sucks about this place is it's location. It's located all the way out in the Richmond District where there is no parking whatsoever. Yes you can drive around and get lucky, but if not, try walking 3-5 blocks. What sucks even more is that once you get to the front door of the cafe, some car leaves right in front of the place. 

Anyhow, my definite top choice in late night cafes is My Favorite Cafe hands down.  My favorite selections are posted in the picture section, but my recommendations are as follows:

- Peanut Butter French Toast
- Mixed Fruit in honey dew juice with sago
- Mango Madness
- Strawberry Madness
- Instant noodles with fried egg and spam
- Soy sauce chicken wings

excerpts: strawberry madness
- I only sampled this one
but I liked it because I normally love strawberries.
strawberry madness.author: Karen Y.
strawberry madness.review:
I used to live a block away from My Favorite Cafe and never stepped foot in there until after I moved away. How ironic! It's just a typical Hong Kong dessert place that sells blended fruit drinks, sago/tapioca/glutinous rice desserts, cold or hot HK style drinks, as well as various snacks and Chinese dishes. 

It was SO packed when me and the bf arrived around 11pm (yes, it's open late all the time) but we were able to snag the last free table in the room. Service was incredibly slow and the workers didn't attempt to move if we just made eye contact with them, we had to wave them down before we received any attention. I know they were busy but that still doesn't excuse the fact that they were negligent. 

Here's what we ordered:

hong kong style egg puffs - These were just OK. They were kinda cold when they came out and most of the egg puffs were hollow...I like them more doughy. At least they tasted pretty good with a hint of sweetness and crunch.

strawberry madness - I only sampled this one but I liked it because I normally love strawberries. It was pretty much strawberry flavored jello topped with strawberry ice cream, fresh strawberries, and whipped cream. Can't forget the cigar cookie too! It all went well together but nothing you can't make at home.

It came out to being around $7-8. Cash only of course and warning that it gets busy late night on the weekends. I'm willing to give it another shot when it's not so bustling though.

excerpts: gotta try the nutella french toast... love the milk tea pudding... love the black sticky rice with coconut milk.. love the strawberry madness... love the oreo milkshake.. love the strawberry juice...
I like everything...
strawberry madness.author: s d.
strawberry madness.review:
I think I've tried everything on the menu... seriously they should give me a membership card....

No.44 (dry noodles with chicken wings, beef and soup) is my favorite.
gotta try the nutella french toast... love the milk tea pudding... love the black sticky rice with coconut milk.. love the strawberry madness... love the oreo milkshake.. love the strawberry juice... I like everything... it's definitely my favorite cafe.

the only thing I don't like... parking is a pain in da butt.

excerpts: I also tried some of the Strawberry Madness.
strawberry madness.author: Joseph F.
strawberry madness.review:
I ordered the:

Mango Milkshake-$3.99

Egg Puffs- I do not remember how much they cost. 

The mango milkshake tasted weird and I cannot really describe the taste. It may have been too sweet or the mango ice cream they used was not good. The fresh mangos and the whipcream they put in was good though.

The egg puffs were good, crispy on the outside and soft and chewy on the inside. 

I also tried some of the Strawberry Madness. It had fresh strawberries, strawberry ice cream, and it all sits on top of strawberry jello. It tasted good, but it was hard to eat because everything sat on top of the jello.

excerpts: We went with the Strawberry Madness and when our order came out, it definitely was not strawberry.
I believe they confused our order for another table's and brought over some type of mango dessert instead.
When we informed them of their mistake, they took a while to even take it back which caused us to get a few weird looks from the table who did order it.
After a couple of minutes, our server finally took the wrong order from our table and when she returned with the correct order, it seemed to have melted a bit.
Whenever my food comes out lookin' like that, it always makes me wonder how long our server passed it up and just let it sit out in the kitchen but whatever.
Our Strawberry Madness was pretty good, so I give 'em an extra star for that.
strawberry madness.author: Gabby T.
strawberry madness.review:
My friend and I joined my best friend and her cousins for her cousin's birthday so we were a pretty large group.  Since my friend and I arrived much later than the rest of the party, we were seated at a separate table.  Since it was our first time at My Favorite Cafe, we needed a few minutes to look over the menu before deciding what to order.  We went with the Strawberry Madness and when our order came out, it definitely was not strawberry.  I believe they confused our order for another table's and brought over some type of mango dessert instead.  When we informed them of their mistake, they took a while to even take it back which caused us to get a few weird looks from the table who did order it.  After a couple of minutes, our server finally took the wrong order from our table and when she returned with the correct order, it seemed to have melted a bit.  Whenever my food comes out lookin' like that, it always makes me wonder how long our server passed it up and just let it sit out in the kitchen but whatever. Our Strawberry Madness was pretty good, so I give 'em an extra star for that. 

In conclusion.. will I be returning for another visit? No, mainly because parking was a bitch that night and the service could have been much better. It looks like this is not My Favorite Cafe afterall.

excerpts: I had the strawberry madness which was worth my money.
However, the service was terrible.
My friend ordered the sesame soup, but he did not receive it due to their screwup by mixing different batters together.
In addition, after we finished out dessert, it literally took them 30 mins to give us our check and thats only because we asked.
If we didn't ask for the check who knows how long we could have been sitting there.
Oh wait get this, there were only 2 other parties in the restaurant!
How can you not notice that we were waiting for the check?
Do you not want us to pay you?
Bad service!

strawberry madness.review: The food was pretty good. I had the strawberry madness which was worth my money. However, the service was terrible. fun fun mango.author: Tina O.
fun fun mango.review:
Thanks to Yelp, I've gained such a huge burden (more like craving) to try all of the Asian dessert joints around the city. One more stop to add to the list was My Favorite Cafe.

This place was very empty when we arrived Friday evening. I'm assuming this is because most people show up in the later hours. No complaints here, that means we have the waiter's attention all to ourselves. The menu was pretty extensive and yet again I had trouble deciding what I wanted. I usually go with my gut feeling by looking at the pictures but they were so tiny (thumbnail size) and weren't so many to look at. What a bummer! I asked about the Fun Fun Mango, it seemed too daring at the time; coconut flavored ho fun noodles with mango. I eventually settled with the Mango madness and my friends had the strawberry madness. The waiter then got to work (he's the only one working at the time), I know the food was definitely worth the wait because when he came with his tray of goodies, I noticed the strawberry was sculpted so beautifully. excerpts: The golden sesame dumplings were so crispy on the outside, the fried chicken leg was huge, the "fun fun mango" was creative, the beer battered onion rings didn't fall apart at all, and the sweet waffle sandwich was to die for.
Keep this up and it'll really be my favorite cafe.
My favorite was the sweet waffle sandwich.
JONASAPPROVED!
They finally extended their busines hours to close past midnight instead of 11pm
so I decided to give it another try.
A lot of the desserts/sauces seemed watered down, but the food still tasted alright.
It's very loud in a Chinesey way, if that makes any sense at all.
Just picture a crowded room of Chinese folks yelling at each other in Chinese.
fun fun mango.author: Jonas T.
fun fun mango.review:
UPDATE 7/29 - Changed from 3 stars to 4 stars

This place has improved a lot since I last came here a month ago. I didn't order the same things as last time, but nothing disappointed me at all this time. The portions were fair for its price and the food looked and tasted delicious. The golden sesame dumplings were so crispy on the outside, the fried chicken leg was huge, the "fun fun mango" was creative, the beer battered onion rings didn't fall apart at all, and the sweet waffle sandwich was to die for. Keep this up and it'll really be my favorite cafe.

My favorite was the sweet waffle sandwich. JONASAPPROVED!

-------------------

They finally extended their busines hours to close past midnight instead of 11pm so I decided to give it another try. A lot of the desserts/sauces seemed watered down, but the food still tasted alright. It's very loud in a Chinesey way, if that makes any sense at all. Just picture a crowded room of Chinese folks yelling at each other in Chinese. 

Soy sauce chicken wings are delicious, and you can never go wrong with steamed rice noodle rolls no matter how watered down the peanut sauce is. JONASAPPROVED!

excerpts: I'm not entirely sure what that is and "fun fun mango " comes with a side of noodles so who knows what I'm in for if I decide to order Mango Madness?
I could only hope that wind instruments would be involved in the presentation - doo doo dee doo!
fun fun mango.author: Michelle B.
fun fun mango.review:
You know when you were a kid and you would sit around making up outrageous dessert concoctions in your head? 

Like, I'm gonna take two pieces of french toast, slather them with nutella, batter the whole thing to make it into one solid mass, and then deep fry the entire concoction! Cinnamon Toast Crunch ain't got nuthin' on my  ridiculous food combo skillz! 

The people at My Favorite Cafe have a two page menu devoted to things like this and they definitely put my dessert imagination to shame. Looking over their two page menu is an exercise in decoding a  six year olds view of what a menu should look like. Do I want something called a snow frog? I'm not entirely sure what that is and "fun fun mango " comes with a side of noodles so who knows what I'm in for if I decide to order Mango Madness? I could only hope that wind instruments would be involved in the presentation - doo doo dee doo!

excerpts: I also love the hilarious names like "Snow Frog" and "Fun Fun Mango"
fun fun mango.author: Renee K.
fun fun mango.review:
I tell my friends to meet me at "My Favorite Cafe" and they always ask "oh which one?" Props to this establishment for coming up with a conveniently confusing name. I love the trashy Hong Kong magazines they stack up against the register. I also love the hilarious names like "Snow Frog" and "Fun Fun Mango"

The cafe's strength lies not in the its food, but in its niche position. I like the variety of Hong-Kong snacks offered and the low key atmosphere. Where else can you get sesame pudding and random savory snacks at 1 in the morning? Where else can you see months-old magazines featuring the Edison Chen scandal? It's my guilty pleasure dessert hangout, and I adore it.

excerpts: Custards always take awhile to cook, so while I waited I got to try the fun fun mango from someone else.
Thanks!
Yes, fun fun was the flat noodles with lots of mango.
Very fun and sweet!
Finally, my dessert came out.
It was in a warm bowl and it was like a yellow sun looking at me.
I grabbed my spoon and broke the seal while the sesame paste oozed out for me to place on my spoon.
As I placed it in my mouth, it gave me a warm tingling feeling.
I love custards, sesame paste things like the sesame paste balls (tang yuan) with Chinese rice wine.
Oh my!
I can't wait to go back and try something else there
fun fun mango.author: Jennifer G.H. W.
fun fun mango.review: Atmosphere definitely feels like late hang out spot for Asians....Taiwanese style. Came here after dinner for dessert. It was pretty empty (not late night yet). LOL! Menu has a pretty good selection of sweet delights from strawberry surprises, tapioca tea, and milk/egg custards. I also noticed people had order some dishes for dinner and there is also free Wi-Fi. Since it was cold outside, I wanted a warm dessert. Reminiscing when my mom made me custard at home, I browsed through the selections of egg and milk custards. I chose the egg custard (heavier then milk) with sesame paste. Custards always take awhile to cook, so while I waited I got to try the fun fun mango from someone else. Thanks! :O) Yes, fun fun was the flat noodles with lots of mango. Very fun and sweet! Finally, my dessert came out. It was in a warm bowl and it was like a yellow sun looking at me. I grabbed my spoon and broke the seal while the sesame paste oozed out for me to place on my spoon. As I placed it in my mouth, it gave me a warm tingling feeling. I love custards, sesame paste things like the sesame paste balls (tang yuan) with Chinese rice wine. Oh my! I can't wait to go back and try something else there

excerpts: Mango madness is mango pudding topped with a scoop of mango ice cream and big mango cubes that surround the ice cream.
Mango pudding wasn't overly sweet which is a good thing, the mango ice cream was
a very generous scoop and mango cubes were sweet as well.
Mango pudding wasn't overly sweet which is a good thing, the mango ice cream was
a very generous scoop and mango cubes were sweet as well.
mango pudding.author: Cynthia T.
mango pudding.review:
[3.5 stars]

Haven't been to this place in years! Used to come here all the time in high school on Friday nights. Two of my friends hit me up last Thursday night saying they wanted to come here and I was so down. This is one of the few dessert places that stay open past midnight in the area which is nice for those late night dessert cravings. 

The place has lots of seating and I've never had to wait for a table. Back then, my go-to's were the mango madness, strawberry madness, and the egg puffs. I decided to stick with what I now and ordered the mango madness and egg puffs again because why fix something that isn't broken?

Mango madness is mango pudding topped with a scoop of mango ice cream and big mango cubes that surround the ice cream. Mango pudding wasn't overly sweet which is a good thing, the mango ice cream was a very generous scoop and mango cubes were sweet as well. If you love mango, this is the dessert choice for you! 

Now onto the egg puffs! Before when I got it, the inside was very cakey. I think they used a pancake batter. It wasn't bad but it wasn't as good as Eggettes which is still my number one place to go to for egg puffs. However when I bit into the egg puff this time, it tasted exactly like Eggettes! Omg I was so happy. Don't know what they changed about their batter but I hope they never change it again. 

Service can be kind of slow even if it is nearly empty because there's only one worker taking orders and making the cold desserts and I'm guessing only one or two workers in the back who make the hot food orders. Oh! And this place is cash only.

excerpts: #Mixed Fruits Mango Pudding: B-.
The mango pudding was not very good.
Usually a good one would have soft, smooth and silky texture but the one I had was a bit hard -
I don't think it was because of over frozen
but it's more related to the making process I suppose.
The fruit was not fresh at all.
mango pudding.author: Simon C.
mango pudding.review:
After finishing dim sum on a Saturday afternoon, was craving for some desserts. Saw this cafe with quite high rating and decided to give it a try.

It was around 3pm and the place was almost empty. Sat down and was quickly provided menus.

#Mixed Fruits Mango Pudding: B-.
The mango pudding was not very good. Usually a good one would have soft, smooth and silky texture but the one I had was a bit hard - I don't think it was because of over frozen but it's more related to the making process I suppose. The fruit was not fresh at all. Papaya and kiwi are the ones among the most disappointed ones.

#Hong Kong Style Egg Puff: B.
Not crispy, and not hot enough. More like eating soft bread.

#Silken Milk with Ginger: B-.
For some reasons, the top layer of this dish was very nice (my roommate was even saying the dish was a 5-star), but after digging down deeper it became worse and worse. Clearly it was also a making process type of thing.

I don't think I will go back again. Question: How come I still can't find a good Hong Kong style dessert joint in SF?

excerpts: Maybe I'm too used to Creations' mango pudding
but I felt this one was way too sweet and it didn't have a 'refreshing' aspect to it.
mango pudding.author: Laverne N.
mango pudding.review:
My Favorite Cafe is not my favorite cafe.

My visit could be described in one word: Okay 

I had a difficult time navigating the menu since some of the menu items have names that don't really depict anything about what it actually is. I couldn't tell the difference between a Mango Delight vs. a Mango Madness even by looking at the picture but maybe that's just my own problem. :|

We ordered:
1. Egg puff - It was good!
2. Mango Madness - I was really disappointed by this. :( Maybe I'm too used to Creations' mango pudding but I felt this one was way too sweet and it didn't have a 'refreshing' aspect to it.
3. Fish balls + pig skin (appetizer?): I didn't try it but my boyfriend said it was really good.
4. Some sort of jelly drink with ice: I thought it was just okay but my boyfriend liked it.

Total came out to around 19 dollars. CASH ONLY - but it doesn't really bother me cause it's just like every other place that accepts cash only in SF. Creations is still my go-to late night dessert spot because I prefer the taste and it seems like they offer a wider variety of items. However, I wouldn't mind going here again since its less crowded and parking is easier to find. I'll probably just try different things next time.

excerpts: Delicious mango pudding.
Texture and flavor for a princess 彡 mango pieces are fresh.
We got two waffles instead of
mango pudding.author: Zelda S.
mango pudding.review: Delicious mango pudding. Texture and flavor for a princess 彡 mango pieces are fresh. We got two waffles instead of French toast bc they were out. Tons of fruit and jellies and ice cream. Made me feel so happy *･゜ﾟ･*:.｡..｡.:*･'(*ﾟﾟ*)'･*:.｡. .｡.:*･゜ﾟ･*

excerpts: #84 Mango Madness... mango pudding (with great flavor) topped with thin layer of mango sauce...
mango pudding.author: Jana C.
mango pudding.review:
#84 Mango Madness... mango pudding (with great flavor) topped with thin layer of mango sauce... diced mangoes delicately placed in that sauce, and huge scoop of mango ice cream to finish off the madness. Great.

#67 Ginger-infused steamed milk custard: A hongkie standard. Very smooth and deep ginger flavor.

excerpts: My bf had mango pudding and fried chicken wings.
The mango pudding was good--better actually than the mango pudding at ETC, which was a disappointment.
The condensed milk on top, however, tasted a little off--like it was an old can that was in the fridge a little too long.
The chicken wings came with fries.
mango pudding.author: Aly A.
mango pudding.review:
I came here last night in a group of people, and overall, I was disappointed.  It's definitely not my favorite cafe, and there are plenty more in the area that are much better.  That being said, I came when I was not very hungry and there were so items that I would like to try. 

I had hot milk tea.  It looked homogenous, but then turned out to be really bland.  When I got to the bottom, it was really sweet.  Why didn't they tell me to mix it?  It's not the sort of thing that you generally  have to mix.  My bf had mango pudding and fried chicken wings.  The mango pudding was good--better actually than the mango pudding at ETC, which was a disappointment.  The condensed milk on top, however, tasted a little off--like it was an old can that was in the fridge a little too long.  The chicken wings came with fries.  Fries were good, the wings were really bland, and not crispy enough.

If I came back, maybe I would try their beef noddle soup or their waffles, but definitely not my GO TO place.  Maybe I was just grumpy because I was cold...

excerpts: Ordered the mango pudding and it tasted alright.
The pudding's color is a bit faded out.
Looks like it may have sat too long.
The pudding taste had only a bit of mango.
There was real mango chunks on top of the pudding.
Overall, it was alright, but I had better.
mango pudding.author: Steven B.
mango pudding.review:
My Favorite Cafe is pretty low on the interior design. It looks a cheaply decorated restaurant. This place smells like a dirty mop.

The desserts are okay. Ordered the mango pudding and it tasted alright. The pudding's color is a bit faded out. Looks like it may have sat too long. The pudding taste had only a bit of mango. There was real mango chunks on top of the pudding. Overall, it was alright, but I had better.
