I usually go with my gut feeling by looking at the pictures but they were so tiny (thumbnail size) and weren't so many to look at. What a bummer! I asked about the Fun Fun Mango, it seemed too daring at the time; coconut flavored ho fun noodles with mango. I eventually settled with the Mango madness and my friends had the strawberry madness. The waiter then got to work (he's the only one working at the time), I know the food was definitely worth the wait because when he came with his tray of goodies, I noticed the strawberry was sculpted so beautifully. It was indeed, edible art and tasty as well. Overall, It was decently priced for icecream, mango pudding, and real fruit ~ $5. I can see why many can call this their favorite cafe.

P.S I had no idea they served Durian (reading from past reviews), I gotta come back to try it.

excerpts: On the bottom it was suppose to be mango pudding but it was tasteless and hard.
mango pudding.author: Anita W.
mango pudding.review:
Went for a dessert night with the girls and instead of going to our usual place, 100% sweet cafe, we decided to give this place a try. Its a lot bigger with more seating area and has a lot more selection of food and drinks. 

I ordered some mango dessert. On the bottom it was suppose to be mango pudding but it was tasteless and hard. It has mango ice cream and a few mango chunks here and there.

My friend ordered some strawberry dessert which is suppose to be like a parfait? But it was basically like the mango hard jelly underneath with some strawberry ice cream.

As for the other foods, they had a lore more variety of snacks to choose from. They had a tv and some board games you can play.

excerpts: I like the mango pudding here, too, even though it's right out of the fridge.
Place opens late.
During the day could be pretty empty, but at night, people come out and it can be pretty diverse group of people.
mango pudding.author: Janet T.
mango pudding.review: Decors at this place are not overwhelming at all, so it's a good place to focus on conversation, especially later into the night when you just want to vent or catch up with friends.  It can be quite echo-y so you might want to choose to sit on the couches near the window.  Eggettes here are not too sweet.  The rice noodles is good for someone hungry but doesn't want get too filled at night.  I like the mango pudding here, too, even though it's right out of the fridge.  Place opens late.  During the day could be pretty empty, but at night, people come out and it can be pretty diverse group of people.

excerpts: It was mango ice cream in a pool of mango puree which was the top layer to a mango pudding.
I thought everything was really good, until I hit the pudding.
It was a funny texture that I didn't really like with my ice cream and mango puree.
mango pudding.author: Julia K.
mango pudding.review:
Definitely not my favorite cafe, but it was ok. It's just another late-night dessert place, but I don't know if I'll come back.

The service wasn't bad like some people below have said - the main guy who was in charge took care of us pretty well. 

I ordered the mango madness, which was pretty good. It was mango ice cream in a pool of mango puree which was the top layer to a mango pudding. I thought everything was really good, until I hit the pudding. It was a funny texture that I didn't really like with my ice cream and mango puree. 

My friend saw a picture of one of their desserts that was a big flavored shaved ice with fruit toppings. She was really excited about it, but when it arrived at the table, it was a disappointment. the ice was supposed to be honeydew flavored, but it was really watered down and just tasted like ice. There was very minimal fruit on it as well. Overall, that dessert was not very good.

I still prefer late night dessert places like Creations and Crepe Temptations.

excerpts:
it comes with a little bit of everything and you can add as much or as little broth as you want
mango pudding with fresh fruit - really refreshing and has bits of mango in the pudding as well so its extra yum!
mango pudding.author: Christine W.
mango pudding.review:
As far as HK desset places go, this place is one of my favorite spots to go to as a late night option for food or desserts!

Depending on what night you go, there may be a line with sign up sheet and all. Luckily the times I've been there, there was hardly ever a wait.

Place is a little expensive as most HK dessert places but hey its late at night where else you gonna go for egg puffs?? :)

Yes i like the following items to get here:

egg puffs - delicious!
spam macaroni - the broth is just really tasty and it comes with a fried egg and spam, can't beat that
tossed noodles - this is great if you can't decide on what to get with your ramen noodles. it comes with a little bit of everything and you can add as much or as little broth as you want
mango pudding with fresh fruit - really refreshing and has bits of mango in the pudding as well so its extra yum!

I'll keep going here as I feel like this place has more room and the wait staff is more attentive then other HK dessert places.

Watch out for street parking, it may be a pain to find a good spot!

excerpts: I loved the mango pudding, but I'm a sucker for mango pudding in general.
Both items were $6 with tip
I'd rather stick to the mango pudding.
And I'm not usually a thai tea person, but they make a pretty good thai tea here.
Avoid the egg and tomato sandwich though; you could make one at home that tastes the same and is far cheaper.
I mean, only putting in two slices of tomato?
Psh.
mango pudding.author: k h.
mango pudding.review:
Four stars for price during happy hour tea time! The service was okay. The free tea wasn't terrible, but I only took two sips. I liked the milk tea, but the boba was a bit too firm for my liking. They put a good amount in the drink though. I loved the mango pudding, but I'm a sucker for mango pudding in general. Both items were $6 with tip so I would definitely go back. 

I don't know if they have free wifi because it wasn't posted anywhere and I felt awkward asking.

I also tried the milk tea pudding.  The presentation was nice, but it had a weird taste that I wasn't taking a liking to.  I'd rather stick to the mango pudding.  And I'm not usually a thai tea person, but they make a pretty good thai tea here.  Avoid the egg and tomato sandwich though; you could make one at home that tastes the same and is far cheaper.  I mean, only putting in two slices of tomato?  Psh.

excerpts: I got myself a hot milk tea and mixed fruit with mango pudding, since they didn't have coffee pudding.
Food came pretty quickly!
As did the food that my friends ordered.
Fries.
Egg Puffs.
Milk tea pudding.
Grass Jelly/Tapioca mixed fruit slush, thingy.
mango pudding.author: Susan Y.
mango pudding.review:
Came here on a Thursday night around 10:30p. Wasn't too packed. It was our 2nd choice since our first choice was full?!?! o__O" Anyway!
The server was really nice. :) Some of the stuff on the menu isn't there anymore.. So that knocked off a star. lol.
I got myself a hot milk tea and mixed fruit with mango pudding, since they didn't have coffee pudding. Food came pretty quickly! As did the food that my friends ordered. Fries. Egg Puffs. Milk tea pudding. Grass Jelly/Tapioca mixed fruit slush, thingy. Mango Ice Cream with Rainbox Jelly & Mixed Fruit... Not sure what the actual name of it was, but I'm sure it's easier to find. 
Everything was pretty awesome. And tasty. Decent prices. 
They also serve foods other than dessert, so it's pretty awesome. Gotta go back and try their other food!

excerpts: My wife was also craving mango pudding so we decided to stop by and check this place out.
We seated ourselves when we walked in at around 4pm.
We were the only customers at that time.
I ordered an egg puff and she ordered her mango pudding.
Her mango pudding came out right away while my puff took like 20-30 mins.
The egg puff looked very appetizing and crisp.
But when I tore off a piece, the egg puff was a grayish jello-y texture in the center.
It wasn't really what I was expecting.
Very very chewy.
I couldn't even finish another piece.
I'd say this was the second worst egg puff I ever had.
Should had driven to eggettes instead.
mango pudding.author: Gordon C.
mango pudding.review: Was craving an egg puff when I was in the area. I remembered seeing this place when I did the pho challenge across the street. My wife was also craving mango pudding so we decided to stop by and check this place out. We seated ourselves when we walked in at around 4pm. We were the only customers at that time. I ordered an egg puff and she ordered her mango pudding. Her mango pudding came out right away while my puff took like 20-30 mins. The egg puff looked very appetizing and crisp. But when I tore off a piece, the egg puff was a grayish jello-y texture in the center. It wasn't really what I was expecting. Very very chewy. I couldn't even finish another piece. I'd say this was the second worst egg puff I ever had. Should had driven to eggettes instead.

excerpts: Had the waffles with ice cream and fruit and a mango pudding.
Although it is not super expensive, I would say it wasn't all too great.
The waffle was like chewing on cardboard, the fruit wasn't fresh at all, and they gave us the wrong ice cream flavors =(.
I guess you pay for what you get.
mango pudding.author: Clifford C.
mango pudding.review: Had the waffles with ice cream and fruit and a mango pudding.  Although it is not super expensive, I would say it wasn't all too great.  The waffle was like chewing on cardboard, the fruit wasn't fresh at all, and they gave us the wrong ice cream flavors =(.  I guess you pay for what you get.

excerpts: mango pudding is good.
mango pudding.author: spiff e.
mango pudding.review: let's go to my favorite cafe!  that never gets old.  anyway, desserts here are great when i can drag my friends away from the bars.  mango pudding is good.  honeydew juice with tapioca is really good.  honey w/ lemon is nice when you're already desserted out.  and oh!  the egg puffs!  so good.  service is decent too.  you definitely never feel rushed to clear your table.  i'm pretty sure you could stay there from 8pm to 2am straight and they'd never "rush" you by putting your check on the table.

excerpts: I usually order the sesame dumplings, dun dan (egg custard), or mango pudding.
Minus 1 star for letting the place get kinda dirty.
It used to be really clean!
mango pudding.author: Al T.
mango pudding.review: Love their desserts here! Everything is good and fresh. I usually order the sesame dumplings, dun dan (egg custard), or mango pudding. Minus 1 star for letting the place get kinda dirty. It used to be really clean!

excerpts: it's mushy just like the mango pudding I ordered .
mango pudding.author: Eileen L.
mango pudding.review: Like I said in my review of 100% Healthy Dessert , since I've been working at a dessert place I've been paying more attention to desserts . I came here again twice a few weeks ago with my friend to try some new things . I got a pear juice which taste a little odd . I got the three colored peanut dumplings  which was WAY TOO SWEET . The B-kid Jellygrass was not sweet enough . The milk tea pudding tastes kind of bitter and odd . I also didn't like its texture .. it's mushy just like the mango pudding I ordered . The preserved pickle & sliced pork chow mein was WAY TOO SALTY . I decided to try the milk pudding because I've never had it before . It tasted very odd . Idk , maybe that's the way it's supposed to taste . The egg puffs were good though . Still like the ones at Eggette's more but the ones here are good too . This place has dropped two stars in my book . But since the owner or whoever was nice enough to read my review and tell me that he would improve things , I will give it an extra star . Also because I like the slogan for this place . Don't know what it is ? Next time you visit , read the back of the servers' shirts .

excerpts: I wanted to try their milk tea pudding, but they were out.
Boo.
My mom wanted to try their black sesame paste, but they were also all out of that.
milk tea pudding.author: Yvonne K.
milk tea pudding.review:
The food is decent, but the ambience and service have a lot to be desired.

We came in around 4PM on a Saturday afternoon, looking for an afternoon delight/pick-me-up in the form of some tasty HK-style desserts. There were 6 of us, so they put us at a big table in the front next to the window. As soon as we sat down, everything felt... sticky. The table, the chairs, probably even the walls if we dared to touch them. After the worker placed the menus on the table, we literally had to peel them off.

We glanced through the menu and saw an assortment of delicious-sounding desserts. Steamed egg custard, steamed milk custard, sesame paste, egg puffs, blended fruit drinks. I wanted to try their milk tea pudding, but they were out. Boo. My mom wanted to try their black sesame paste, but they were also all out of that. But they had enough to make two servings of the steamed egg custard with sesame paste... wait, what? (They're also supposed to be open until midnight or so? And they're out of these staples already?) We shrugged and just let it go and ended up ordering two steamed egg custards with sesame paste, a mango smoothie, sesame egg puffs, and momo chacha (a dessert with taro chunks, yams, sago, and coconut milk).

As we waited, we began regretting the fact that we ordered pretty much all hot desserts. Even though the front door was open, there was zero air flow at the table we were seated at. And it was next to a window, so the sunshine that filtered in was magnified. It was like sitting in a greenhouse. We thought about asking to move, but that was their only large table, so we would all have to split up. It was a family outing, so... no dice on that.

The desserts came, and yeah, they were pretty good. (Except the mango smoothie... can someone say syrup overload?) We tried to eat as fast as we could so we wouldn't melt, but we also didn't want to burn our tongues on the hot food. Dilemmaaaaa. We eventually made it through, paid our bill, and rolled out. We interacted with the worker a total of six times: when she told us where to sit, when she set the menus down, when she took our order, when she gave us our bill, when she returned for the bill, and when she returned to give us the receipt. No friendly service here.

So, My Favorite Cafe? Not really. I would much rather go to one of the many other HK dessert shops in the Richmond area. The food here is decent, so I'm bumping them up to three stars, but the shoddy environment kills the good taste.

excerpts: My cousin got the mixed fruit with milk tea pudding.
We were both unsatisfied with the food.
My mango drink had a slushie consistency with very little coconut milk.
The aloe didn't mix well with the drink at all.
My cousin's milk tea pudding tasted really bland.
I've had their chow fun before and it was alright.
Suitable for a stomach filler but not too stimulating for the taste buds.
Service was slow even though the place was more than half empty.
Cash only!
Come here only if the other dessert places in the area are full or if you want to hang out at a more quiet Asian dessert place.
My cousin's milk tea pudding tasted really bland.
I've had their chow fun before and it was alright.
Suitable for a stomach filler but not too stimulating for the taste buds.
Service was slow even though the place was more than half empty.
Cash only!
Come here only if the other dessert places in the area are full or if you want to hang out at a more quiet Asian dessert place.
milk tea pudding.author: Jennifer Z.
milk tea pudding.review:
My Favorite Cafe doesn't fully live up to its name. Yes, it's a great place to hang out and catch up because of it's spacious seatings and large menu but the food isn't so great at all. 
I came here on a Friday night with my cousin and ordered the coconut milk and mango drink with aloe. My cousin got the mixed fruit with milk tea pudding. We were both unsatisfied with the food. My mango drink had a slushie consistency with very little coconut milk. The aloe didn't mix well with the drink at all. My cousin's milk tea pudding tasted really bland. I've had their chow fun before and it was alright. Suitable for a stomach filler but not too stimulating for the taste buds. 
Service was slow even though the place was more than half empty. 
Cash only! 
Come here only if the other dessert places in the area are full or if you want to hang out at a more quiet Asian dessert place.

excerpts: I should have tried the Milk Tea Pudding instead... maybe next time.
They give you complimentary tea too, in a plastic cup that shouldn't be used to serve hot drinks.
milk tea pudding.author: Priscilla W.
milk tea pudding.review:
My friends and I came here around 3PM, and there was only about four other people inside. There was only one waitress, and she was pretty nice. Our orders didn't take too long, but it didn't come in a flash either. My Favorite Cafe has a huge menu with over 150 different selections but with only few pictures to catch my eye. The good thing is that those pictures are really what you see, unlike those on the TV dinner boxes.

#86 Mango Delight is just another, simpler & similar version of #110 Mixed Fruit w/ Mango Juice. The only difference is #86 is $0.25 more, doesn't have extra fruit, and is a bit sour due to some citrus pulps mixed into it. Go for #110 instead; it's more worth it and is more colorful too! I should have tried the Milk Tea Pudding instead... maybe next time. They give you complimentary tea too, in a plastic cup that shouldn't be used to serve hot drinks.

excerpts: The milk tea pudding was super bland and not sweet at all!
It did not taste anything like milk tea, and maybe had a faint tea flavour.
It comes with a tiny pot of sweet milk that you can add to it, but it really did not help.
milk tea pudding.author: Stephanie W.
milk tea pudding.review:
Definitely wanted to like this place, but I was pretty disappointed with the pudding I ordered. The milk tea pudding was super bland and not sweet at all! It did not taste anything like milk tea, and maybe had a faint tea flavour. It comes with a tiny pot of sweet milk that you can add to it, but it really did not help. Do not recommend this!! 

I also tried the egg puffs, which were good, and the cherng fun (rice noodles?) which were super yummy! I liked that they didn't have any of the dried shrimp in it, and it comes with a peanut butter dipping sauce. Yum yum. One of my friends also got a strawberry icecream/sundae dessert, which was pretty standard and really sweet. Someone else ordered ramen & wings, which were super greasy. I would probably stick with their desserts.

The service is pretty slow but it's open late!

excerpts: I also tried the milk tea pudding.
The presentation was nice, but it had a weird taste that I wasn't taking a liking to.
milk tea pudding.author: k h.
milk tea pudding.review:
Four stars for price during happy hour tea time! The service was okay. The free tea wasn't terrible, but I only took two sips. I liked the milk tea, but the boba was a bit too firm for my liking. They put a good amount in the drink though. I loved the mango pudding, but I'm a sucker for mango pudding in general. Both items were $6 with tip so I would definitely go back. 

I don't know if they have free wifi because it wasn't posted anywhere and I felt awkward asking.

I also tried the milk tea pudding.  The presentation was nice, but it had a weird taste that I wasn't taking a liking to.  I'd rather stick to the mango pudding.  And I'm not usually a thai tea person, but they make a pretty good thai tea here.  Avoid the egg and tomato sandwich though; you could make one at home that tastes the same and is far cheaper.  I mean, only putting in two slices of tomato?  Psh.

excerpts: Milk Tea Pudding - I saw a delicious looking picture of this on yelp
so I already knew I was going to order this.
I love milk tea!
And I love pudding.
But I barely even liked this dish.
It was very bland, tasted like no flavor jello but with the slightest hint of tea.
milk tea pudding.author: Julia T.
milk tea pudding.review:
I love late night dining, especially if it's sweets! I had a huge craving for desserts last Saturday night and off we went to My Favorite Cafe! I thought this name was pretty conceited and I was ready to prove them wrong (or right). We walked in and it wasn't crowded, just two other groups of people. Immediately I noticed the awkward dim lighting and messy tables. I would think since it's not that crowded, they would try to clean up a bit. We sat down at the least dirtiest table since no one told us where to sit. A server girl came to wipe it down and got crumbs on me. =/ All I thought was, food better be good! 

Milk Tea Pudding - I saw a delicious looking picture of this on yelp so I already knew I was going to order this. I love milk tea! And I love pudding. But I barely even liked this dish. It was very bland, tasted like no flavor jello but with the slightest hint of tea. The condensed milk and chocolate shavings on top was a good effort but that ran out quick. 

Mixed Fruit with Tapicoa and Mango Juice - This was much better. The mango juice was very sugary but had a nice, thick mango puree consistency. Tapioca and fruit is usually a good combo. 

Onion Rings - This was run of the mill and was a small portion served on a tiny plate. I'd say maybe seven rings? They didn't even offer us ketchup. 

There are a lot of other places I want to try so I doubt I'll be back here again. I do recommend coming here or to any dessert cafes with a bigger group so you can try more things without looking like a total fatty.

excerpts: They also have milk tea pudding which sounded pretty good
but I needed something HOT.
milk tea pudding.author: Tracy A.
milk tea pudding.review:
I came in on a Tuesday night with a few friends around 10:30pm and the place was packed. I wanted to go to a new dessert place since we always go to Golden Island, Creations, or Kowloon Tong Dessert. 

Since it was a cold rainy night I wanted to get something hot. The menu was huge. They had cold dessert selections such as ice cream and the regular watermelon juice with sago and mixed fruits. Hot desserts such as hot red bean soup (which i got) and dun don. They also have specialty desserts such as mango with flat rice noodles which I thought was kind of weird. They also have milk tea pudding which sounded pretty good but I needed something HOT. Everything on the menu was mostly under $4-5. 

They also had cake choices and that night they had tiramisu and cheesecake. There was an atomic ice cream bowl or something and our guy friends HAD to order that for the girls. It came with a scoop of green tea ice cream, chocolate, strawberry, mango, and I think the last was vanilla. We totally couldn't finish that. It was TOO big and too much. Even the guys couldn't finish the rest. Everything was pretty okay. Nothing really to wow about but then again I'm not really a big fan of Asian desserts. Probably a good place to just sit and have dessert with a couple of friends. You know those kind of places where you can sit and have long conversations and catch up with one another. 

**Note: There's a sign near the register that says they charge 10 cents for a to-go box.**

excerpts: Milk tea pudding.
Grass Jelly/Tapioca mixed fruit slush, thingy.

excerpts: gotta try the nutella french toast... love the milk tea pudding... love the black sticky rice with coconut milk.. love the strawberry madness... love the oreo milkshake.. love the strawberry juice...
I like everything...
milk tea pudding.author: s d.
milk tea pudding.review:
I think I've tried everything on the menu... seriously they should give me a membership card....

No.44 (dry noodles with chicken wings, beef and soup) is my favorite.
gotta try the nutella french toast... love the milk tea pudding... love the black sticky rice with coconut milk.. love the strawberry madness... love the oreo milkshake.. love the strawberry juice... I like everything... it's definitely my favorite cafe.

the only thing I don't like... parking is a pain in da butt.

excerpts: The milk tea pudding tastes kind of bitter and odd .
I also didn't like its texture ..

excerpts: and my friend, more adventurous, tried the mixed fruit coffee pudding.
the milky liquid it was in tasted like water with a hint of coffee...aka bland.
The fruit was good tho.
coffee pudding.author: Kat C.
coffee pudding.review:
How are you NOT eating at Pho Garden right across the street?  I'll say as long as Pho Garden is nearby this cafe, it'll take alot of convincing to eat here instead BUT I'll come here for quick dessert!  I walked in thinking it was a quickie cafe where u order and leave...wasn't expecting the tables and couches near the front; nice and chill.  :)

Tried their green tea ice cream (I dont think you can go wrong...) and my friend, more adventurous, tried the mixed fruit coffee pudding.  Not a fan...

The pudding was flavorful but texture was kinda yucky...plus the milky liquid it was in tasted like water with a hint of coffee...aka bland.  The fruit was good tho.  The menu is definately out of the ordinary.  

The lady who helped us was friendly but kinda ditsy...or maybe it's cause she couldn't understand our requests.

excerpts: good coffee pudding and steam eggs but very bad drinks.
the drinks are pretty watery and overly sweet after 3 times of visit.
It's a typical chinese dessert place where don't expect any good service
but they open late
coffee pudding.author: Janita s.
coffee pudding.review:
good coffee pudding and steam eggs but very bad drinks.  the drinks are pretty watery and overly sweet after 3 times of visit.  It's a typical chinese dessert place where don't expect any good service but they open late so it's a good hangout spot late at night.  

I'll go back for the pudding but probably that's all.  Last time we also ordered steam rice noodles and waffle.  the waffle is nothing but the prepacked ones from grocery shop and filled with lots of cream and fruits.

Tell me where else you could get that in SF.
The only downside is that the tables are kind of sticky but besides that service is friendly, desserts and food are inexpensive and plentiful.
ice cream.author: Jennifer C.
ice cream.review:
Mom and Pop's type of dessert shop.

I love how this is one of the few dessert spots in SF that is opened past midnight. The prices are relatively cheap and they have so many desserts. I do wish there were more pictures since some of the desserts like "Mango Delight" and "Mango Madness" are hard to distinguish what exactly goes in. Lots of yummy hot food dishes if you and your friends skipped dinner, etc. I got the fried bananas with ice cream and it was so good, hot crispy fried bananas with cold ice cream and some whipped cream for less than $7???? Tell me where else you could get that in SF. The only downside is that the tables are kind of sticky but besides that service is friendly, desserts and food are inexpensive and plentiful.

excerpts: I like the waffle and add green tea ice cream!
ice cream.author: Celi R.
ice cream.review:
Love this place for its:
-prices 
-open late night 
-free WiFi (great for working) 
-friendly staff.

I like the waffle and add green tea ice cream! Checkout my full review here:


celiinternational.com/blog/5-best-coffeeshops-to-work-at-in-san-francisco-2018

excerpts: Mango madness is mango pudding topped with a scoop of mango ice cream and big mango cubes that surround the ice cream.
Mango pudding wasn't overly sweet which is a good thing, the mango ice cream was
a very generous scoop and mango cubes were sweet as well.
Mango pudding wasn't overly sweet which is a good thing, the mango ice cream was
a very generous scoop and mango cubes were sweet as well.
ice cream.author: Cynthia T.
ice cream.review:
[3.5 stars]

Haven't been to this place in years! Used to come here all the time in high school on Friday nights. Two of my friends hit me up last Thursday night saying they wanted to come here and I was so down. This is one of the few dessert places that stay open past midnight in the area which is nice for those late night dessert cravings. 

The place has lots of seating and I've never had to wait for a table. Back then, my go-to's were the mango madness, strawberry madness, and the egg puffs. I decided to stick with what I now and ordered the mango madness and egg puffs again because why fix something that isn't broken?

Mango madness is mango pudding topped with a scoop of mango ice cream and big mango cubes that surround the ice cream. Mango pudding wasn't overly sweet which is a good thing, the mango ice cream was a very generous scoop and mango cubes were sweet as well. If you love mango, this is the dessert choice for you! 

Now onto the egg puffs! Before when I got it, the inside was very cakey. I think they used a pancake batter. It wasn't bad but it wasn't as good as Eggettes which is still my number one place to go to for egg puffs. However when I bit into the egg puff this time, it tasted exactly like Eggettes! Omg I was so happy. Don't know what they changed about their batter but I hope they never change it again. 

Service can be kind of slow even if it is nearly empty because there's only one worker taking orders and making the cold desserts and I'm guessing only one or two workers in the back who make the hot food orders. Oh! And this place is cash only.

excerpts: I ordered their fried banana ice cream with a side of fruit.
They have tons of items to choose from and traditional Chinese desserts.
There weren't many people inside at the time,(probably due to the windy weather), so it didn't take too long to get our food.
They have a TV planted on the wall
so we watched some wrestling in Spanish.
The fried banana and ice cream comes with 2 scoops of ice
The fried banana and ice cream comes with 2 scoops of ice
ice cream.author: Grace Anne D.
ice cream.review:
After getting some sushi, I immediately started craving for some fruit so I yelped on what was nearby and I found this place. 

This area in San Francisco is filled with little mom and pop shops, hidden hole-in-the-wall's, just overall great foodie places that I've seen so far. This place wasn't amazing looking inside but the dessert we received made up for it.

I ordered their fried banana ice cream with a side of fruit. They have tons of items to choose from and traditional Chinese desserts. There weren't many people inside at the time,(probably due to the windy weather), so it didn't take too long to get our food. They have a TV planted on the wall so we watched some wrestling in Spanish. The fried banana and ice cream comes with 2 scoops of ice cream(you can choose vanilla, chocolate, green tea(?) and strawberry(?)) and it came with a mix of cantaloupe, honey dew and watermelon fruit balls. The fried bananas were delicious and not doused in heavy batter which other places tend to do. 

The service was good too. The guy who helped us out was very friendly and welcoming. :) definitely coming back for more desserts !

excerpts: This Cafe is amazing definitely get the fruite and ice cream waffle.
Especially if you have the munchies q
ice cream.author: Savneet S.
ice cream.review: This Cafe is amazing definitely get the fruite and ice cream waffle. Especially if you have the munchies q

excerpts: I asked what flavors of ice cream did they have, she answered (with a little bit of difficulty), I asked is that all?, and she was kind of confused after that.
Eventually, I ordered the fried banana which came with two scoops of ice cream, I chose green tea and mango.
- The green tea ice cream was TASTELESS and ODD.
There was no green tea flavor almost, random pieces of (what I can guess) dried fruit, and tasted like freezer burn or ice cream that was melted and re-frozen multiple times.
- Finally, the mango ice cream tasted the best out of the whole dish
and I'm not even a big fan of mango!
I'm not sure if they buy or make their own ice cream, but I'm extremely disappointed with the green tea ice cream as it is my favorite flavor.
I think if I were to go back to try this place again
I'd give their food and their egg puffs a try.
I'll be avoiding their green tea ice cream, unfortunately.
ice cream.author: Cassy Y.
ice cream.review:
Came here on a Saturday night after dinner looking for some desserts. The waitress was kind of slow to answer questions especially when I asked in english. My Chinese wasn't good enough to ask in Chinese hence why I stuck with English (their menu had English, too). I asked what flavors of ice cream did they have, she answered (with a little bit of difficulty), I asked is that all?, and she was kind of confused after that. 

Eventually, I ordered the fried banana which came with two scoops of ice cream, I chose green tea and mango. 
- The fried banana inside tasted delicious but the outside batter tasted more like just oil than batter. I couldn't stand eating more than half of what was given. 
- The green tea ice cream was TASTELESS and ODD. There was no green tea flavor almost, random pieces of (what I can guess) dried fruit, and tasted like freezer burn or ice cream that was melted and re-frozen multiple times. 
- Finally, the mango ice cream tasted the best out of the whole dish and I'm not even a big fan of mango! It tasted fresh, perfect level of sweetness, and refreshing. 

I'm not sure if they buy or make their own ice cream, but I'm extremely disappointed with the green tea ice cream as it is my favorite flavor. I think if I were to go back to try this place again I'd give their food and their egg puffs a try. I'll be avoiding their green tea ice cream, unfortunately. 

Note: Free hot tea on a cold winter day was very welcomed! CASH ONLY PLACE.

excerpts: They have decent ice cream dishes that can be very artistic and I will as a I like
ice cream.author: Norris T.
ice cream.review:
This is my no.2 latenight goto for your standard chinese dessert shop fare. They have decent ice cream dishes that can be very artistic and I will as a I like and they have a decent mango madness. 

Quick Tip: get the dessert duh!

excerpts: Tons of fruit and jellies and ice cream.
ice cream.author: Zelda S.
ice cream.review: Delicious mango pudding. Texture and flavor for a princess 彡 mango pieces are fresh. We got two waffles instead of French toast bc they were out. Tons of fruit and jellies and ice cream. Made me feel so happy *･゜ﾟ･*:.｡..｡.:*･'(*ﾟﾟ*)'･*:.｡. .｡.:*･゜ﾟ･*

excerpts: diced mangoes delicately placed in that sauce, and huge scoop of mango ice cream to finish off the madness.
ice cream.author: Jana C.
ice cream.review:
#84 Mango Madness... mango pudding (with great flavor) topped with thin layer of mango sauce... diced mangoes delicately placed in that sauce, and huge scoop of mango ice cream to finish off the madness. Great.

#67 Ginger-infused steamed milk custard: A hongkie standard. Very smooth and deep ginger flavor.

excerpts: The ice cream melts pretty fast
ice cream.author: Eleanor E.
ice cream.review:
My best friend and I decided to go to a dessert cafe after our shift at work.  Our first choice was so packed and busy that we decided to find a different spot and stumbled upon this cafe.

The place looked a little bigger than our primary choice and it wasn't as busy.  The menus were laid down nicely on the tables and the women working seemed nice.

A lot of the food on the menu sounded REALLY GOOD.  I wanted to order just about everything but I resorted to the Steamed Rice Noodles, Snow Frog w/ Half a Papaya, and Fresh Strawberry Juice.

The juice was fantastic, I love strawberries and I loved that they even carry such a thing on their menu.  Steamed rice noodles always taste delicious, I love that it's served with sriracha.  And the Snow Frog w/Half Papaya was pretty good... The ice cream melts pretty fast but it's super fulfilling.

It's definitely a place we both would come back to to try out more food :D

excerpts: Waffle w/ ice cream looked like Richard Simmons had vomited into a bowl.
ice cream.author: Roy C.
ice cream.review:
Definitely not my favorite cafe, not even close. It's so bad that they had to shamelessly name themselves "My Favorite Cafe" just so someone would actually call it that, because otherwise, those words would never come out of anyone's mouth talking about this place.

Green bean sweet soup had strange, burnt chunks in it.
Condensed milk & butter toast had too much toast, too little flavor.
Hong kong style eggs were flavorless.
Waffle w/ ice cream looked like Richard Simmons had vomited into a bowl.

If you want Chinese desserts, this is definitely not the place to go.

excerpts: Not the best tasting dessert ever, though I did like the ice cream on top.
The jello on the bottom, however, was too "milky" so I couldn't eat it..
ice cream.author: Mona C.
ice cream.review:
[M]ona: 3.5 Stars
[W]ayne: 3 Stars
Average: 3.25 Stars
 
+ Open Late
+ Fast Service
+ Good Variety of Foods and Desserts
+ Lots of Magazines

- Rounded Tables
- Cash Only

[M] Erm... definitely not my favorite cafe... I came here with Wayne and my girlfriends the other night and found this place to be quite lively. We sat ourselves near the back while waiting for my other friends to come. One thing I found quite irritating about My Favorite Cafe was that all their tables are all rounded. It was difficult to figure out a way to sit the 5 of us~  

We weren't really in the mood to eat so Wayne and I just shared a Steamed Rice Roll and a Strawberry Madness.

[W] The Steamed Rice Rolls http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VxT3LXwPdHEz1qpXeI5hig?select=Y69ceZI1qqDTU1Xe08oDJQ were pretty good but it could've used a little more dipping sauce on the side. It was very juicy and tasty though. 

[M] My friend suggested me to try the Strawberry Madness http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VxT3LXwPdHEz1qpXeI5hig?select=FcO1Jd0Whoww_VvoafGpvA since she knows I like strawberries. Not the best tasting dessert ever, though I did like the ice cream on top. The jello on the bottom, however, was too "milky" so I couldn't eat it.. Other than that, the presentation was nice I suppose. 

[W] The environment is like any other Chinese dessert place. Nothing too special other than it probably had a better selection of desserts to choose from other than your regular places where people always order Eggettes and whatnot.

excerpts: I really like their smoothies, waffles with ice cream,
potstickers nd sandwiches/fries !
Those are what i recommend on their menu, dont really know about tha others because i haven't really tried everything.
ice cream.author: Michael N.
ice cream.review:
Tha first time i came here, i was really excited ! I've heard about this place nd their sandwiches so I've wanted to try it out. First time, it was good nd maybe even great. But after coming several other times, this place becomes less nd less "great". Depends on your mood nd what you get.. Some of their selections are really good nd some are ok...ish. 

This place has just become a place to get some desert for around $4-5 at a really late time. Around 12 am.. I really like their smoothies, waffles with ice cream, potstickers nd sandwiches/fries ! Those are what i recommend on their menu, dont really know about tha others because i haven't really tried everything. Oh, i don't like their french toast..it reminds me of Chinese Doughnuts.

excerpts: so I went with #96) Ice Cream ($2.50).
I know, it's very original.
It comes with two scoops
and you can pick from the following flavors below.
ice cream.author: Jason H.
ice cream.review:
3.0 Stars

Once you get seated at My Favorite Cafe you have a nice, hot cut of tea waiting for you. It's a great place to catch up with friends in a cozy, non-rushed environment. I find this placed fully packed especially on Friday and Saturday nights. My advice is to come in a little earlier to secure a seat.

My Favorite Cafe offers a wide array of HK style desserts, HK style drinks, tapioca, noodles, and sandwiches. In terms of HK style desserts you can expect to find the Steamed Egg Custard and the HK Style Egg Puff amongst other popular desserts.

The night I went I wasn't in the mood for any HK style dessert so I went with #96) Ice Cream ($2.50). I know, it's very original. It comes with two scoops and you can pick from the following flavors below. There could have been more, but these are the ones I do remember.

Strawberry
Vanilla
Chocolate
Green Tea
Mango
Coconut Pineapple

I picked Coconut Pineapple and Strawberry and the Strawberry was way better. The Coconut Pineapple had an interesting flavor that was a little tart. This could have been from the pineapple flavoring. I would have enjoyed it more if it was strictly coconut.

The service was pretty decent and the servers made sure to refill our tea cups when they were empty.

Bring that hard earned green paper, because this place is CASH only.

excerpts: Tried their green tea ice cream (I dont think you can go wrong...)
ice cream.author: Kat C.
ice cream.review:
How are you NOT eating at Pho Garden right across the street?  I'll say as long as Pho Garden is nearby this cafe, it'll take alot of convincing to eat here instead BUT I'll come here for quick dessert!  I walked in thinking it was a quickie cafe where u order and leave...wasn't expecting the tables and couches near the front; nice and chill.  :)

Tried their green tea ice cream (I dont think you can go wrong...) and my friend, more adventurous, tried the mixed fruit coffee pudding.  Not a fan...

The pudding was flavorful but texture was kinda yucky...plus the milky liquid it was in tasted like water with a hint of coffee...aka bland.  The fruit was good tho.  The menu is definately out of the ordinary.  

The lady who helped us was friendly but kinda ditsy...or maybe it's cause she couldn't understand our requests.

excerpts: There's just something about a mountain of mangos mixed in a bowl with ice cream and jelly that puts the soul at ease.
ice cream.author: Andrew A.
ice cream.review:
My Favorite Café

Ah... this cozy little store brings back fond memories. Nothing soothes a broken heart the way a Mango Madness does. There's just something about a mountain of mangos mixed in a bowl with ice cream and jelly that puts the soul at ease. 

Even if you happen to miss dinner because of oversleeping due to depression, this place serves a killer bacon club sandwich up until 2 A.M.! The chicken/spam ramen is also a popular choice among us young independent individuals. They also provide cool board games like Connect Four for you to play with during your stay (company not provided).

Whether you're looking for place to celebrate with fruity goodies or trying to fill an empty void over an ex-girlfriend who broke up with you because she's still in love with her ex-boyfriend after several weeks of entertaining a doomed and hopeless relationship with you, this place is family friendly for all!

excerpts:
It has mango ice cream and a few mango chunks here and there.

But it was basically like the mango hard jelly underneath with some strawberry ice cream.
ice cream.author: Anita W.
ice cream.review:
Went for a dessert night with the girls and instead of going to our usual place, 100% sweet cafe, we decided to give this place a try. Its a lot bigger with more seating area and has a lot more selection of food and drinks. 

I ordered some mango dessert. On the bottom it was suppose to be mango pudding but it was tasteless and hard. It has mango ice cream and a few mango chunks here and there.

My friend ordered some strawberry dessert which is suppose to be like a parfait? But it was basically like the mango hard jelly underneath with some strawberry ice cream.

As for the other foods, they had a lore more variety of snacks to choose from. They had a tv and some board games you can play.

excerpts: It consisted of strawberry jello, (but not the kind you get out of a box from Safeway) covered with strawberry ice cream, pieces of strawberry and whipped cream.
ice cream.author: Dmitriy S.
ice cream.review:
After battling the Pho Challenge across the street and failing miserably, we were looking for a good dessert place to just relax and eat some yummy Chinese desserts. This place turned out to be exactly what we were looking for!

At first, the waitress was a bit slow taking our orders and messed up, but it happens with a large group of people. At 11pm on a Monday night, this place still had quite a good amount of customers. 

We ordered the Mango Madness, Strawberry Madness, and the Hong Kong style egg puff. The strawberry madness really was a delicious conglomerate of strawberry madness. It consisted of strawberry jello, (but not the kind you get out of a box from Safeway) covered with strawberry ice cream, pieces of strawberry and whipped cream. The mango madness was pretty similar, except it had a lot more mango pieces in it. The egg puff was pretty unique, but tasted really good for something so simple. Overall, this place was great and was very cheap as well!

excerpts: I always get my usual tofu  fa with mixed fruit, somebody always gets the french fries, the chicken sandwich, eggettes, ice cream waffle, ice lemon tea, etc etc.
This place does get pretty busy later at night so come earlier to get a seat or be prepared to wait
but its never that long.
ice cream.author: Sarah L.
ice cream.review:
Met some friends here last night for dessert. Its our usual dessert place. Wouldn't say its our favorite (in terms of taste) but they never rush us, we can sit/hang out/catch up with friends for as long as we like, and they'll always refill the hot tea. Which is what dessert is all about for us, especially since we don't get to see much of each other during the week anymore (post college days).

We've come here a lot over the years so we've tried our share of the menu. Nothings ever amazing but its not bad either. I always get my usual tofu  fa with mixed fruit, somebody always gets the french fries, the chicken sandwich, eggettes, ice cream waffle, ice lemon tea, etc etc. This place does get pretty busy later at night so come earlier to get a seat or be prepared to wait but its never that long.

excerpts: They had the usually HK style desserts and snacks like Egg puffs, waffles with ice cream, curry fish balls, sandwiches, macaroni noodles, chicken wings, steamed egg custard/pudding, fruit juices, mixed fruit with fruit juices, etc.
it had strawberry jello on the bottom, whipped cream, BIG scoop of yummy strawberry ice cream, slice fresh strawberries all around and a wafer cookie on top.
-Steamed egg pudding with sesame ($3.95) had sesame paste on the bottom steamed with HEALTHY egg custard on top.
The custard was so smooth and soft and not too sweet at all.

Such a healthy dessert!
-Fried Bread with sweetened condensed milk (around $4) came with 4 big pieces of mon tou, fried bread, drizzled with sweetened condensed milk with a extra side of sweetened condensed milk.
I remember eating this when I was young and always loved it
so I knew I had to order it when I came here.
It was good
but I only finished one since I ordered so much food!
I wish they would not skimp and be stingy with my sweetened condensed milk though.
ice cream.author: Juliane N.
ice cream.review:
I remember coming here when it first opened and disliked it. We were looking for a HK style dessert place and wanted to go to Golden Island Cafe but My Favorite Cafes' ratings were higher and plus it's closer to my place so I picked to come here. 

Got V.I.P parking right out front! They must know a Ms. Can't parallel park is coming and saved it for me! =) This place was packed at 11 at night on a Sunday! They table was actually ready but I had to change the amount of people in our party so it took a little longer. We got seated first while waiting and I feel like the waiters were getting pissed off cuz we were taking long. Then they probably got even more mad when we had to add another 6 to our 10 and with all the arranging and moving, people still had to sit away from the big table. But they were nice about it.

The menu was humongous! They had the usually HK style desserts and snacks like Egg puffs, waffles with ice cream, curry fish balls, sandwiches, macaroni noodles, chicken wings, steamed egg custard/pudding, fruit juices, mixed fruit with fruit juices, etc.


I ordered the:
-Strawberry Madness (around $4-5) it had strawberry jello on the bottom, whipped cream, BIG scoop of yummy strawberry ice cream, slice fresh strawberries all around and a wafer cookie on top. 
-Steamed egg pudding with sesame ($3.95) had sesame paste on the bottom steamed with HEALTHY egg custard on top. The custard was so smooth and soft and not too sweet at all. Such a healthy dessert!
-Fried Bread with sweetened condensed milk (around $4) came with 4 big pieces of mon tou, fried bread, drizzled with sweetened condensed milk with a extra side of sweetened condensed milk. I remember eating this when I was young and always loved it so I knew I had to order it when I came here. It was good but I only finished one since I ordered so much food! I wish they would not skimp and be stingy with my sweetened condensed milk though. Way better when you drench it with the milk!

Service was slow but we had 12 people in our table so it's understandable!

excerpts: My friend thought the curry fish balls were a little too spicy for her and ordered some ice cream, and it came ON THE HOUSE! =]
The guy wearing glasses was actually the person who was helping us the most: taking our orders, getting us ice cream, and coming over every time we needed something.
ice cream.author: Rachelle T.
ice cream.review:
Maybe it was cravings for a good midnight snack or the company but I was satisfied with my whole experience here.  My friend has come here before and said that the service wasn't great, but it must have been a lucky Saturday night because the service was pretty good, especially since we ordered things three different times.  

My group got some curry fish balls, nutella french toast, and the mango delight.  

My friend thought the curry fish balls were a little too spicy for her and ordered some ice cream, and it came ON THE HOUSE! =]  

The guy wearing glasses was actually the person who was helping us the most: taking our orders, getting us ice cream, and coming over every time we needed something.  Much more helpful than the other guy who we tried to waive down for the bill, but never came over.  

I like this place because the food's pretty good and we were in desperate need of a snack place open late.

excerpts: The strawberry and yellow-colored vanilla ice cream that we ordered had a faint, yet unignorable taste of durian.
When we learned that durian ice cream was not even available, we could only wonder what polluted the order.
ice cream.author: Andrew M.
ice cream.review:
Summary: Come to My Favorite Cafe if you are desperate for table space with a medium-sized group, and some members in your group are willing to sacrifice money for a meal to order unsatisfying desserts or appetizers.

Maybe we ordered the wrong items or came on a bad day, but neither of these possibilities would put My Favorite Cafe into consideration for future trips.

One of us ordered the regular, iced milk tea and thought it was the worst milk tea he had ever had.  Even the additional sweetening did not change his opinion.

The strawberry and yellow-colored vanilla ice cream that we ordered had a faint, yet unignorable taste of durian.  When we learned that durian ice cream was not even available, we could only wonder what polluted the order.

The deep fried bread balls with condensed milk was quite tasty, but at over a dollar per bite-sized piece, it was no longer tasty enough to overlook the cost.

The prices for many of their appetizers and snacks could fetch meals at other restaurants.

excerpts: -Mango Madness: love the fact that this one has ice cream with it.
ice cream.author: Danielle G.
ice cream.review:
Hmm, I really wish we could rate with half stars because I want to say 3.5 stars. Unfortunately, it had to drop to 3 instead of up-ing it to 4. I like to joke and say that this is really my favorite cafe. Ok, well it is not, but it is a place I like to go for a late night dessert or snack. 

I've had a few things on the menu and I've always been pretty happy:
-Mango Delight: really yummy and a nice sweet treat. i am such a sucker for mango anything.
-Mango Madness: love the fact that this one has ice cream with it. i like this one more than the mango delight because it has mango chunks instead of just tapioca pudding.
-Rice Noodles: I forget what their called on the menu but they're steamed and kinda sticky. More of a dim sum like item, rather than a desert. I really like it though. It comes out piping hot and with a salty dipping sauce (hoisin i think).
-Egg Puff: One time I came here and the lady said she didn't have condensed milk. I don't think she understood us because the next time we got condensed milk with no questions asked. 

I'm sure I've tried other things, but I can't remember at the moment. They do give you complimentary hot tea. Parking sucks. Service can be okay, depending. I suggest trying it out.

excerpts: It was mango ice cream in a pool of mango puree which was the top layer to a mango pudding.
I thought everything was really good, until I hit the pudding.
It was a funny texture that I didn't really like with my ice cream and mango puree.
ice cream.author: Julia K.
ice cream.review:
Definitely not my favorite cafe, but it was ok. It's just another late-night dessert place, but I don't know if I'll come back.

The service wasn't bad like some people below have said - the main guy who was in charge took care of us pretty well. 

I ordered the mango madness, which was pretty good. It was mango ice cream in a pool of mango puree which was the top layer to a mango pudding. I thought everything was really good, until I hit the pudding. It was a funny texture that I didn't really like with my ice cream and mango puree. 

My friend saw a picture of one of their desserts that was a big flavored shaved ice with fruit toppings. She was really excited about it, but when it arrived at the table, it was a disappointment. the ice was supposed to be honeydew flavored, but it was really watered down and just tasted like ice. There was very minimal fruit on it as well. Overall, that dessert was not very good.

I still prefer late night dessert places like Creations and Crepe Temptations.

excerpts: My craving for ice cream changed to sago and then went back to ice cream.
My friend ordered the Mango Madness(?) which I believe was mangoo puree with pieces of mango and mango ice cream.
ice cream.author: Justine O.
ice cream.review:
My craving for ice cream changed to sago and then went back to ice cream. My friend ordered the Mango Madness(?) which I believe was mangoo puree with pieces of mango and mango ice cream. I ended up getting a banana split -- something I haven't had in a looong time. Then we split egg puffs. The banana split was pretty big and I was already full from dinner so I had trouble finishing it. The egg puffs were delicious. They were crispy on the edges which I love.

When we went, it was pretty empty. They had a TV turned to ABC so we ended up staying and watching Dancing with the Stars for a bit. My friend and I aren't really into the show, but we definitely were that night. Haha it felt like we were hanging out in my living room.

I went up to pay and I noticed there was a bowl of lollipops so I took one to enjoy as I left :).

excerpts: I tried one of their HK-style waffles with fresh fruit and strawberry & vanilla ice cream.
ice cream.author: Chris C.
ice cream.review:
Before I came here, I didn't know this place was actually called "My Favorite Cafe." My friend who we were staying with in the city kept saying "I want to take you guys to my favorite cafe!", so when we all got here and saw the sign we got a good laugh.

I tried one of their HK-style waffles with fresh fruit and strawberry & vanilla ice cream. It was pretty tasty, though the waffle was not quite what I was expecting. I prefer the liege-style waffles at Syrup in Los Angeles to this place, but this place does have a quite a bit of variety on their menu so I would definitely be open to coming back here to try something else. The service was a bit slow, but considering how busy it was when we came here I guess it was to be expected.

excerpts: This time I ordered the Mixed Fruits Mango Sundae and omg the mango ice cream was so good!
The fruit was alright, but what can you expect?
My friends order rice noodle soup and it smelled so good that I was suddenly craving salty food.
But I resisted.
I had some of my friend's fries and they were really good.
Crispy and potatoe-y.
The milkshakes are good too.
ice cream.author: Annie C.
ice cream.review:
There are quite a few Hong Kong style dessert places in San Francisco and this is probably one of the better ones. I've been to Creations, Kowloon Tong, that place on Taravel and that place on Noriega and My Favorite Cafe and Creations take the cake.

If you're looking for a spot to chill with friends late at night or want to grab a snack, this is the place to go (for Asian food that is).

The past few times I came here, the wait wasn't long. If you go on a weeknight, there isn't a wait. The last time I came here was a Tuesday night and we sat down right away. They have so many choices on their menu, it's ridiculous! Sure, it may be variations of the same thing, but dang, I want to order so much more than I can handle! This time I ordered the Mixed Fruits Mango Sundae and omg the mango ice cream was so good! The fruit was alright, but what can you expect? My friends order rice noodle soup and it smelled so good that I was suddenly craving salty food. But I resisted. I had some of my friend's fries and they were really good. Crispy and potatoe-y. The milkshakes are good too. This definitely isn't a place to go if you're watching your figure.

Besides the food, My Favorite Cafe is a great place to chill and talk with your friends. Or play cards. They have a TV and a bunch of magazines too. 

Overall, the food isn't fabulous but the atmosphere is great.

excerpts: The ones that we love to order are egg buffs (vanilla and chocolate are good) and ice cream (2 scopes that can feed 2 kids at $2.50).
ice cream.author: Roserrele W.
ice cream.review:
I like to bring my kids to this place because it is easy to grab a table. This place used to be always full especially after dinner time. I remember that I have always need to go somewhere else because the waiting line was just unbeliveably long some years ago. Now, this place is on the downslope because of the challenge of 100% Sweet which is only a few blocks away.

Honestly, not every item in My Favorite Cafe is good. Some are really suck such as the HK Style Waffle. Firstly, the waffle itself is so chewy like plastic. The original HK style waffle should be fluffy and light. Secondly, the waffle is round in shape while the original is square. Thirdly, the filling is not the same. It should be some condensed sweeten milk, peanut butter, shredded coconut and sugar.

The sweet soups are mostly okay, not great. I have tried red bean soup, tofu soup, sesame soup and they are just okay. I would expect more and am able to find better ones elsewhere.

The ones that we love to order are egg buffs (vanilla and chocolate are good) and ice cream (2 scopes that can feed 2 kids at $2.50). Chicken wings are fine and noodles are okay, not big in portion.

We come here because of convenience and the fact that no waiting is required. Parking is a bit difficult in the neighborhood. We always need to park a few blocks away. But, it is a good gathering place for friends and we would come back again.

excerpts: Tried the waffle with ice cream and fruit which was not bad.
The dish is served with various fruits and ice cream (Strawberry and mango) on top of a asian waffle with whipped cream.
Prices here are very cheap.
The dish is served with various fruits and ice cream (Strawberry and mango) on top of a asian waffle with whipped cream.
Prices here are very cheap.
Cost only $5.50 for the waffle!
Wouldn't mind returning in the future to try some other things.
Overall not bad
ice cream.author: Miss H K.
ice cream.review:
My friends suggested we go here for a late Saturday night dessert.
This place was definitely busy considering it was after midnight but we were seated promptly and served quickly.
Tried the waffle with ice cream and fruit which was not bad. The dish is served with various fruits and ice cream (Strawberry and mango) on top of a asian waffle with whipped cream. 
Prices here are very cheap. Cost only $5.50 for the waffle!
Wouldn't mind returning in the future to try some other things.
Overall not bad

excerpts: It was pretty much strawberry flavored jello topped with strawberry ice cream, fresh strawberries, and whipped cream.
Can't forget the cigar cookie too!
ice cream.author: Karen Y.
ice cream.review:
I used to live a block away from My Favorite Cafe and never stepped foot in there until after I moved away. How ironic! It's just a typical Hong Kong dessert place that sells blended fruit drinks, sago/tapioca/glutinous rice desserts, cold or hot HK style drinks, as well as various snacks and Chinese dishes. 

It was SO packed when me and the bf arrived around 11pm (yes, it's open late all the time) but we were able to snag the last free table in the room. Service was incredibly slow and the workers didn't attempt to move if we just made eye contact with them, we had to wave them down before we received any attention. I know they were busy but that still doesn't excuse the fact that they were negligent. 

Here's what we ordered:

hong kong style egg puffs - These were just OK. They were kinda cold when they came out and most of the egg puffs were hollow...I like them more doughy. At least they tasted pretty good with a hint of sweetness and crunch.

strawberry madness - I only sampled this one but I liked it because I normally love strawberries. It was pretty much strawberry flavored jello topped with strawberry ice cream, fresh strawberries, and whipped cream. Can't forget the cigar cookie too! It all went well together but nothing you can't make at home.

It came out to being around $7-8. Cash only of course and warning that it gets busy late night on the weekends. I'm willing to give it another shot when it's not so bustling though.

excerpts: But they do deliver with their fruit and ice cream over waffles, sesame paste, egg puffs, and my new favorite, milk custard.
ice cream.author: Vincent K.
ice cream.review:
Nothing more pleasant than four guys walking into a place called My Favorite Cafe in the middle of a Sunday Afternoon after Dim Sum making a ruckus at the place while watchin the AFC/NFC pro bowl and talking about girls and about their feet then sipping on our spoon of milk custard.

yes..that pretty much paints a picture.  this place is opened almost everyday all day and i'm glad for that.  because its establishments like these which I'm very happy for being so close to my house that I can count on to have these congregations with my boys and talk about whether we'd do Jessica Alba if she had herpes.  

Anyways, iv'e been coming here for years just probably every other month.  But they do deliver with their fruit and ice cream over waffles, sesame paste, egg puffs, and my new favorite, milk custard.  Egg custard is not so great.  

and yes.  I would.....

excerpts: I generally have a strawberry sago or ice cream sundae.
It's not the best and not the worst.
I come when friends suggest it.
I prefer other HK places in the neighborhood instead.
ice cream.author: Annie P.
ice cream.review: This is your typical Hong Kong style dessert/late night snack place. I have been here a few times. It nice as it close to where I live but there isn't a whole lot of parking in this area. I generally have a strawberry sago or ice cream sundae. It's not the best and not the worst. I come when friends suggest it. I prefer other HK places in the neighborhood instead.

excerpts: They had cold dessert selections such as ice cream and the regular watermelon juice with sago and mixed fruits.
Hot desserts such as hot red bean soup (which i got) and dun don.
They also have specialty desserts such as mango with flat rice noodles which I thought was kind of weird.
There was an atomic ice cream bowl or something and our guy friends HAD to order that for the girls.
It came with a scoop of green tea ice cream, chocolate, strawberry, mango, and I think the last was vanilla.
We totally couldn't finish that.
It was TOO big and too much.
Even the guys couldn't finish the rest.
Everything was pretty okay.
Nothing really to wow about
but then again I'm not really a big fan of Asian desserts.
Probably a good place to just sit and have dessert with a couple of friends.
ice cream.author: Tracy A.
ice cream.review:
I came in on a Tuesday night with a few friends around 10:30pm and the place was packed. I wanted to go to a new dessert place since we always go to Golden Island, Creations, or Kowloon Tong Dessert. 

Since it was a cold rainy night I wanted to get something hot. The menu was huge. They had cold dessert selections such as ice cream and the regular watermelon juice with sago and mixed fruits. Hot desserts such as hot red bean soup (which i got) and dun don. They also have specialty desserts such as mango with flat rice noodles which I thought was kind of weird. They also have milk tea pudding which sounded pretty good but I needed something HOT. Everything on the menu was mostly under $4-5. 

They also had cake choices and that night they had tiramisu and cheesecake. There was an atomic ice cream bowl or something and our guy friends HAD to order that for the girls. It came with a scoop of green tea ice cream, chocolate, strawberry, mango, and I think the last was vanilla. We totally couldn't finish that. It was TOO big and too much. Even the guys couldn't finish the rest. Everything was pretty okay. Nothing really to wow about but then again I'm not really a big fan of Asian desserts. Probably a good place to just sit and have dessert with a couple of friends. You know those kind of places where you can sit and have long conversations and catch up with one another. 

**Note: There's a sign near the register that says they charge 10 cents for a to-go box.**

excerpts: Mango Ice Cream with Rainbox Jelly & Mixed Fruit...
Not sure what the actual name of it was, but I'm sure it's easier to find.
Everything was pretty awesome.
And tasty.
Decent prices.
They also serve foods other than dessert, so it's pretty awesome.
Gotta go back and try their other food!
ice cream.author: Susan Y.
ice cream.review:
Came here on a Thursday night around 10:30p. Wasn't too packed. It was our 2nd choice since our first choice was full?!?! o__O" Anyway!
The server was really nice. :) Some of the stuff on the menu isn't there anymore.. So that knocked off a star. lol.
I got myself a hot milk tea and mixed fruit with mango pudding, since they didn't have coffee pudding. Food came pretty quickly! As did the food that my friends ordered. Fries. Egg Puffs. Milk tea pudding. Grass Jelly/Tapioca mixed fruit slush, thingy. Mango Ice Cream with Rainbox Jelly & Mixed Fruit... Not sure what the actual name of it was, but I'm sure it's easier to find. 
Everything was pretty awesome. And tasty. Decent prices. 
They also serve foods other than dessert, so it's pretty awesome. Gotta go back and try their other food!

excerpts: I ordered the waffles with ice cream and mixed fruit, which was super yummy!
The atmosphere is cozy and friendly.
ice cream.author: Kristina W.
ice cream.review:
I came here around 11PM with a few friends. I ordered the waffles with ice cream and mixed fruit, which was super yummy! The atmosphere is cozy and friendly. I would definitely recommend this place if you just want to have a good time chatting with friends over dessert. 

They also have a table full of board games and card games. My friends and I stayed here for hours playing Monopoly deal and we had a great time. I love the food and environment. Definitely recommend!

excerpts: Their eggettes, steam noodle, mango ice cream on papaya, mango grapefruit tapioca were all good
ice cream.author: Coco L.
ice cream.review:
They open for late night, what can I ask for more? 

Their eggettes, steam noodle, mango ice cream on papaya, mango grapefruit tapioca were all good 

The wait staff were very friendly too. We had a big group, and the number keep growing. She was very patience with us.

excerpts: We ordered the Nutella french toast, deep friend banana with ice cream, chicken sandwich, green tea milkshake, &this one mango sago drink.
The food was pretty good & was reasonably cheap.
We spent a little bit less than $25 on everything.
ice cream.author: BrendaJoy G.
ice cream.review:
Yesterday was the first time I came in here. A friend &I came here in the afternoon, so there weren't much customers. We ordered the Nutella french toast, deep friend banana with ice cream, chicken sandwich, green tea milkshake, &this one mango sago drink. The food was pretty good & was reasonably cheap. We spent a little bit less than $25 on everything. The service was a little slow, but really friendly.

I have yet to explore the rest of their menu &I am forsure coming back if I crave any Asian desserts.

excerpts: I was sick and couldn't try my friend's mango ice cream
but it looked awesome.
ice cream.author: Jared S.
ice cream.review:
My Favorite Cafe will not be included in my series of reviews entitled "Places That Are Completely Empty on Friday Nights" because this place was jam packed around 9pm on Friday a few weeks ago. We were seeking some sweet goods after sushi and I remember hearing that this place was quite popular with the kids. Thinking it was similar to Quicklys where we could walk up to a counter and order our drink/snack, we were taken back when they kept asking us "how many?" implying that we needed to sit down. We checked out the menu and felt comfortable with the 200 choices so we took the only table left, in the back corner against the mirror. 

I was sick and couldn't try my friend's mango ice cream but it looked awesome. I had some kind of rainbow milk tea with hundreds of little pearls of different colors and tastes. The small size and texture made me feel like I was the egg and millions of sperms were trying to penetrate me to create the most beautiful baby that will be graced with my thick weave of dark curly hair. Although the thought of children was fun, feeling it going down my throat was not. 

The place takes cash only. If it was an awesome experience, I wouldn't have minded. But when it's only so-so, it pisses me off that they haven't joined the 21st century. I'm hypocritical and I don't care. 

I'd come back to try something else... perhaps during a less busy time. Until then, this is only My Favorite Cafe that's located between 22nd and 23rd Ave. Hopefully that title will expand to the Outer Richmond in the future.

excerpts: oreo ice cream is my favorite flavor.
ice cream.author: Gerard Y.
ice cream.review: Best Oreo Milkshake evar!!!!  mmmm large oreo chunks and excellent milkshake texture. Its so noisy in here though when its busy. oh yeah... they sell food like sandwiches and udon. I just want my shake =) p.s. oreo ice cream is my favorite flavor.

excerpts: +My first time here, I unknowingly ordered an ice cream basket, which for most asian dessert places would be a tiny serving; however when it come out... it was a HUGE.
I was really like a basket full of ice cream.
4 large scoops of 4 flavors of ice cream with fruit and whipped cream.
ice cream.author: Angel L.
ice cream.review:
I like the fact that this place is not JAM packed all the time, so that when I want my Asian Dessert fix with some friends, I don't settle for sitting uncomfortably squished, trying to share a corner of a table.

Yes, the menu is extensive, but beware, some items my not be available if the kitchen is closed. 

+My first time here, I unknowingly ordered an ice cream basket, which for most asian dessert places would be a tiny serving; however when it come out... it was a HUGE. I was really like a basket full of ice cream. 4 large scoops of 4 flavors of ice cream with fruit and whipped cream. My jaw dropped, and I ordered my friend to help a sister out because it was too big. 

+I'm all about getting a bang for your buck, so that a great first impression for me.

-Pass on the egg puffs, they're not very good here.
-The servers are not always very attentive, so if you want something, be proactive.

excerpts: It's cheap and has great desserts--the waffles covered with ice cream and fruits looked delectable and certainly mouth-watering.
Be sure to check it out if you're in the area.
ice cream.author: Brent A.
ice cream.review:
My friend and I were driving around the area looking for a HK bistro of some sort and somehow discovered this place.  It looked really clean and bright from the outside as we drove by Sunday night at 11.

We parked and headed inside.  The menu is large, yet seemingly lacking in the tofu department.  We decided to try a handful of items: deep fried sweet breads, beef stew with lettuce, curry fish balls, and green tea shake.  The service was fairly spot on with tea brought by with regularity and tables being cleared immediately after patrons left the cafe.

The green tea shake was a little strange.  The wafer cookie inside was good, yet the taste of the drink overall had a strange green tea and matcha flavor with cardboard-esque aftertaste.  It wasn't what we expected, but it was fine by any means.

The sweet breads are delectable.  If you love condensed milk, then this little piece of dough will not let you down as it comes with a condensed milk as a dipping sauce.  

The curry fish balls had a ton of cumin and packed a small punch.  

As for the beef stew with lettuce, my first impression was why would you order this?  It smelled like an Asian Big Mac.  I kid you not.  The wilted lettuce and random beef bits in the sauce seemed like a scaled back stew and smelled just like secret sauce.  Strange...  It was fairly tasty though.

If you come here after 8, make sure you plan on ordering something at least $2.50 in value.  Also, make sure you bring cash as that is all they accept.

I would certainly hit this place up if I lived in the area.  It's cheap and has great desserts--the waffles covered with ice cream and fruits looked delectable and certainly mouth-watering.  Be sure to check it out if you're in the area.

excerpts: The batter has to be just right, chocolate sauce, some powdered sugar sprinkled on top, and there better be some ice cream on the side (preferably green tea).
I got the waffles with ice cream and fresh fruit.
And perhaps I should have specified that I um, don't like my waffles well done.
I could hardly cut through them!
I was quite tempted to ask for a steak knife.
Could have just been a one time thing on their part, leaving the waffles cooking for too long or something.
The vanilla ice cream they served with it was nice though, and eventually got the waffles soft enough for me to cut through.
ice cream.author: Mary O.
ice cream.review:
My friend is absolutely obsessed with fried bananas.  Definitely in her top 5 foods, if not part of her Last Meal on Earth.

This wonderful cafe has them just the way she likes them, which she has explained to me in detail.  The batter has to be just right, chocolate sauce, some powdered sugar sprinkled on top, and there better be some ice cream on the side (preferably green tea).  This place fit the bill.

I got the waffles with ice cream and fresh fruit.  And perhaps I should have specified that I um, don't like my waffles well done.  I could hardly cut through them!  I was quite tempted to ask for a steak knife.  Could have just been a one time thing on their part, leaving the waffles cooking for too long or something.  The vanilla ice cream they served with it was nice though, and eventually got the waffles soft enough for me to cut through.  After about ten minutes.  

Yet still, I will go back to sample some more of their unique desserts.

excerpts:
..
Love the ice cream, just like everywhere else with ice cream.
Cute baby too!
I was talking about Eggettes with my friend, and some person just intruded.
And started a conversation on their own about eggettes.
Kinda uncomfortable...
but it was alrighty.
I feel lame, after eatting all these deserts!
I like creations (:
ice cream.author: Carolyn Y.
ice cream.review:
It's not all great. But it's not all bad.
1 star for the CRAZY mangoness. I love most.
+1 star for showing the Bee movie!
+2 for the right in front of the store parking.
Mango Madness; MADNESS REALLY?! I didn't see what I wanted.
But I like the mango..
Love the ice cream, just like everywhere else with ice cream.
Cute baby too! 
I was talking about Eggettes with my friend, and some person just intruded.
And started a conversation on their own about eggettes.
Kinda uncomfortable... but it was alrighty. I feel lame, after eatting all these deserts!  I like creations (:

excerpts: It may have been too sweet or the mango ice cream they used was not good.
It had fresh strawberries, strawberry ice cream, and it all sits on top of strawberry jello.
It tasted good, but it was hard to eat because everything sat on top of the jello.
ice cream.author: Joseph F.
ice cream.review:
I ordered the:

Mango Milkshake-$3.99

Egg Puffs- I do not remember how much they cost. 

The mango milkshake tasted weird and I cannot really describe the taste. It may have been too sweet or the mango ice cream they used was not good. The fresh mangos and the whipcream they put in was good though.

The egg puffs were good, crispy on the outside and soft and chewy on the inside. 

I also tried some of the Strawberry Madness. It had fresh strawberries, strawberry ice cream, and it all sits on top of strawberry jello. It tasted good, but it was hard to eat because everything sat on top of the jello.

excerpts: There's was the black sticky rice with coconut milk which was not too sweet at all and the best waffle and ice cream I've ever laid eyes on.
Overall I thought the desserts were good.
ice cream.author: Jeanne L.
ice cream.review: Its just like any other Asian dessert spot.  I came with a huge group after a wedding banquet so I got to try a few other items. There's was the black sticky rice with coconut milk which was not too sweet at all and the best waffle and ice cream I've ever laid eyes on.  Overall I thought the desserts were good. I had the coconut milk with white fungus and tapioca. It was really good and don't let the name fool you.They also have chocolate chip egg puffs! How weird is that?! Gotta try it yourself.

excerpts: Had the waffles with ice cream and fruit and a mango pudding.
Although it is not super expensive, I would say it wasn't all too great.
The waffle was like chewing on cardboard, the fruit wasn't fresh at all, and they gave us the wrong ice cream flavors =(.
I guess you pay for what you get.
ice cream.author: Clifford C.
ice cream.review: Had the waffles with ice cream and fruit and a mango pudding.  Although it is not super expensive, I would say it wasn't all too great.
