The waffle was like chewing on cardboard, the fruit wasn't fresh at all, and they gave us the wrong ice cream flavors =(.  I guess you pay for what you get.

excerpts: The friend ordered 2 scoops of ice cream.
Now - my advice to you - when you go to a HK-style cafe, you don't order ice cream!
You know that they get their ice cream from those 2 gallon buckets at
Foods Co. Its like going to Baskin Robbins and ordering **gasp
* Vanilla!
No offense, but you can buy a half-gallon of Dreyers at Safeway for wayyy less.
Ok, back to topic.
So the friend gets her 2 scoops of green tea ice cream and it was horrid.
It was bitter, had no green tea flavor whatsoever, and had that ice burn smell.
Nasty.
So we asked the server if we can get another flavor instead.
The server was very nice and promptly exchanged it to Mango for us.
Once again, nothing spectacular.
It was sweet and had that artificial flavoring color.
Note to My Favorite Cafe: please do your customers
a favor order your ice cream from Magnolia or Polly-Anns.. or at least get the real stuff with no artificial flavoring!
ice cream.author: Nancie T.
ice cream.review:
After dinner at Genki Ramen...

Me: Lets go to My Favorite Cafe, I haven't been there in a while.
Friend: ok, where is your favorite cafe? 
Me: No, its not MY favorite cafe. Its their name, which sucks, because it isn't really MY favorite cafe. But I don't feel like the crappy customer service at Kowloon Tong.

which leads to a meager 3-stars at Kowloon Tong. I had the mango delight (yeung gee gum lo) which is mango + pomelo + small tapioca. It was sickening sweet and lacked the fruity flavors. The friend ordered 2 scoops of ice cream. Now - my advice to you - when you go to a HK-style cafe, you don't order ice cream! You know that they get their ice cream from those 2 gallon buckets at Foods Co. Its like going to Baskin Robbins and ordering **gasp** Vanilla! No offense, but you can buy a half-gallon of Dreyers at Safeway for wayyy less. Ok, back to topic. So the friend gets her 2 scoops of green tea ice cream and it was horrid. It was bitter, had no green tea flavor whatsoever, and had that ice burn smell. Nasty. So we asked the server if we can get another flavor instead. The server was very nice and promptly exchanged it to Mango for us. Once again, nothing spectacular. It was sweet and had that artificial flavoring color. Note to My Favorite Cafe: please do your customers a favor order your ice cream from Magnolia or Polly-Anns.. or at least get the real stuff with no artificial flavoring!

excerpts: I LOVE THE nutella french toast with a side of ice cream.
Its also very cheap.
The only thing that sucks about this place is that they dont take CARD!!
BUT ITS still a great kick it spot ususally at night when there is nothing to do.
ice cream.author: reyahliza b.
ice cream.review: This is the place for desert. I LOVE THE nutella french toast with a side of ice cream. Its also very cheap. The only thing that sucks about this place is that they dont take CARD!! BUT ITS still a great kick it spot ususally at night when there is nothing to do.

excerpts: - the waffle with ice cream and fruit: the waffle was crispy.
and the fruit was decent.
the ice cream was.. meh.
more icy than creamy.
ice cream.author: geneive j.
ice cream.review:
i'm always down for a place that you can roll hella late, sit there forever playing your cards, and nosh on a gigantic menu of treats.. yay.

i went here cuz it was past twelve and my bf and i had a serious case of the munchies.. so we ordered: 
- the eggettes: pretty good. but not as crispy as i would have wanted it.
- the waffle with ice cream and fruit: the waffle was crispy. and the fruit was decent. the ice cream was.. meh. more icy than creamy.
- the taro with tapioca: i thought it was a drink. it wasn't. it was a bowl with warm taro and tapioca. i was pleasantly surprised.
- the peanut butter thick toast: f-ing awesome. nuff said.
- and this "speacial tofu dish with red bean and sesame paste" that didn't have any tofu in it: wtf? minus one star. boooo. i wanted tofu.

other than that.. it was chill. i'd go back and try some more stuff.. maybe this time i'll bring board games and sit in the comfy chairs by the window..

excerpts: I've tried the mango delight, the waffles with ice cream, and the fried banana which were all good.
But I cant figure out their ice cream...
their strawberry taste too strawberry almost fake and their coconut is a bit to coconutty for me, but it tastes fine eaten with whatever its served.
ice cream.author: Maritess N.
ice cream.review: This is the place I go to when I get a weird Asian dessert craving. Its the first Asian dessert place I have been to & I don't mind it (I'm still trying out other places). The best part is that their open super late! Easy to get to with lots of parking. I've tried the mango delight, the waffles with ice cream, and the fried banana which were all good. But I cant figure out their ice cream... their strawberry taste too strawberry almost fake and their coconut is a bit to coconutty for me, but it tastes fine eaten with whatever its served.

excerpts: Ya got to try the waffle ice cream sandwich!!
lovin it.....the sandwich.
They got tons of great desserts.
and i know people that love their curry balls...
fish.
So go there now.
and tell Philip I need more watermelon or ill hold the RiceRolls for ransome.
ice cream.author: Mark F.
ice cream.review: Great place to hang out. friendly customer service. They GOT EGG PUFF!! always crispy. and i love those Peek A Pooh machines!!!  Ya got to try the waffle ice cream sandwich!! lovin it.....the sandwich. They got tons of great desserts. and i know people that love their curry balls...fish. So go there now. and tell Philip I need more watermelon or ill hold the RiceRolls for ransome.

excerpts: My favorites are sago w/ coconut milk, waffle with fresh fruit and ice cream and the coffee tea.
ice cream.author: Jennie N.
ice cream.review: My Favorite Cafe is absloutely my favorite cafe for Chinese desserts. They have  a large selection of both savory and sweet foods. My favorites are sago w/ coconut milk, waffle with fresh fruit and ice cream and the coffee tea.

excerpts: The majority of us ordered the waffles with mixed fruit and ice cream.
We didn't know it takes FOREVER just to make one order.
ice cream.author: Jade V.
ice cream.review: We came here last night for a friend's birthday. She wanted dessert, so one of our friends recommended this cafe. We got here around 7:30PM, but everyone lagged and we didn't start ordering until about 9:00PM. The majority of us ordered the waffles with mixed fruit and ice cream. We didn't know it takes FOREVER just to make one order. They probably had only one waffle maker or something. Everyone was almost already finished eating, but about three of us hadn't even got our orders yet. The service was extremely slow, but the food was pretty good.

excerpts: Our favorites include ramen/udon noodles with spam and egg (it's hard to explain the phenomenon on why it's better when you buy ramen noodles instead of making it at home yourself), chow mein noodles, egg puffs, watermelon juice with tapioca, bread puffs with sweet sauce, and mango with ice cream and pudding.
ice cream.author: Kathy L.
ice cream.review:
I haven't found a better dessert cafe yet. They open until 2AM on Friday and Saturdays which helps when my friends and I aren't yet ready to turn in. Our favorites include ramen/udon noodles with spam and egg (it's hard to explain the phenomenon on why it's better when you buy ramen noodles instead of making it at home yourself), chow mein noodles, egg puffs, watermelon juice with tapioca, bread puffs with sweet sauce, and mango with ice cream and pudding. 

The servers are inarticulate and get confused some of the times, but the owner of the place is very gracious and nice. This place continues to cater to our habitual late night hang outs, hilarious conversations, obnoxious laughs, and such.

excerpts: The mango Ice Cream pudding is well worth with how much you get.
The mixed fruits
ice cream.author: Sean E.
ice cream.review: This place is pretty good and has it's desserts but I still prefer Kowloon Tong along 7th and Geary anyday. I'll go here once in awhile for their desserts though since they have different ways in serving from what I get in Kowloon and their Sesame paste with Milk custard which is delicious! The mango Ice Cream pudding is well worth with how much you get. The mixed fruits w/ Mango juice and sago which is one of my primary dishes isn't as good as the one I get at Kowloon. They over do it with the sago/tapioca, whatever you prefer to call it and my last visit, our tea's tasted straight outta the faucet tap water status...it was disgusting. Service is nice though and only reason it's staying at a 4 stars for me is cause of service and the desserts I like there.

excerpts: ordered the waffle with fresh fruit and ice cream.
i ended up with a partly burnt waffle with bitter ice cream and some can fruits.
my friend ordered black sticky rice with fresh fruits to give it a try, since the worker said it was good and sweet.
the black sticky rice was bitter and it didn't even taste cooked.
the rice was still hard and the only good thing about the it was the "fresh" fruits.
i ended up with a partly burnt waffle with bitter ice cream and some can fruits.
my friend ordered black sticky rice with fresh fruits to give it a try, since the worker said it was good and sweet.
the black sticky rice was bitter and it didn't even taste cooked.
the rice was still hard and the only good thing about the it was the "fresh" fruits.
ice cream.author: Jessica T.
ice cream.review: ordered the waffle with fresh fruit and ice cream. i ended up with a partly burnt waffle with bitter ice cream and some can fruits. my friend ordered black sticky rice with fresh fruits to give it a try, since the worker said it was good and sweet. the black sticky rice was bitter and it didn't even taste cooked. the rice was still hard and the only good thing about the it was the "fresh" fruits.

excerpts: i usually get fried bananas with ice cream on the side
= delicious!
service is usually very good and the wait is usually not that long unless it is a weekend.
on the nights when it is not as busy, this is a great place to get a bite to eat and just sit and hang out.
ice cream.author: Vivian D.
ice cream.review: great late night cafe with tons to choose from. i usually get fried bananas with ice cream on the side = delicious! service is usually very good and the wait is usually not that long unless it is a weekend. on the nights when it is not as busy, this is a great place to get a bite to eat and just sit and hang out.

excerpts: The mango madness was yummy goodness (lots of mango, mango jelly, mango ice cream, real mango chunks).
Now I only have to head back to try out all the other stuff on their rmenu.
ice cream.author: Lily L.
ice cream.review: My friend recommended this as opposed to 100% healthy desserts. The first time we went, we couldn't get any seats and was on the waiting list, but being impatient decided to skip. This weekend we returned, we didn't have to wait for a table, fantastic! The waitress was nice and friendly giving good suggestions for alternatives since they didn't have any of the milkshakes until 20 minutes later (20 minutes for a milkshake? that's ridiculous). I had the black sesame paste (delicious, not the best i've had, but it was good). My sister had the sesame rice noodles (peanut butter sauce?) was actually really tasty, wish the portion was bigger. The mango madness was yummy goodness (lots of mango, mango jelly, mango ice cream, real mango chunks). Now I only have to head back to try out all the other stuff on their rmenu.

excerpts: I ended up getting a banana split -- something I haven't had in a looong time.
Then we split egg puffs.
The banana split was pretty big
and I was already full from dinner
so I had trouble finishing it.
The egg puffs were delicious.
banana split.author: Justine O.
banana split.review:
My craving for ice cream changed to sago and then went back to ice cream. My friend ordered the Mango Madness(?) which I believe was mangoo puree with pieces of mango and mango ice cream. I ended up getting a banana split -- something I haven't had in a looong time. Then we split egg puffs. The banana split was pretty big and I was already full from dinner so I had trouble finishing it. The egg puffs were delicious. They were crispy on the edges which I love.

When we went, it was pretty empty. They had a TV turned to ABC so we ended up staying and watching Dancing with the Stars for a bit. My friend and I aren't really into the show, but we definitely were that night. Haha it felt like we were hanging out in my living room.

I went up to pay and I noticed there was a bowl of lollipops so I took one to enjoy as I left :).

excerpts: We ordered honeydew juice with mixed fruit and tapioca.
I guess I imagined my tapioca to be like boba and was a little bit disappointed that they were the small sago balls (yeah, I know it's tapioca
but I guess I had something else in mind).
You can also switch it out for grass jelly.
It was pretty good and nicely filled with fruit and not skimpy on it.
For $5 I have no complaints and was very happy with it.
We also ordered the chicken wings with fries and thought it was good too.
It came with like 4-5 pieces of chicken.
Besides being served hot tea, we also ordered iced lemon tea  that was delicious.
I smooshed too much of the lemon in so it was tasting a bit sour and bitter
honeydew juice.author: Lauren K.
honeydew juice.review:
Just an Okay. I guess we were a little surprised that it wasn't packed but an hour before closing on a Saturday night there were about 3 tables filled with people.

Even though we were seated all the way in the back, I was a little annoyed that they had both the front doors propped open and filling the place with second hand smoke. The tables already have laminated menus that are showing wear by curling up on the corners and stained from use. 

We ordered honeydew juice with mixed fruit and tapioca. I guess I imagined my tapioca to be like boba and was a little bit disappointed that they were the small sago balls (yeah, I know it's tapioca but I guess I had something else in mind). You can also switch it out for grass jelly. It was pretty good and nicely filled with fruit and not skimpy on it. For $5 I have no complaints and was very happy with it. We also ordered the chicken wings with fries and thought it was good too. It came with like 4-5 pieces of chicken. Besides being served hot tea, we also ordered iced lemon tea  that was delicious. I smooshed too much of the lemon in so it was tasting a bit sour and bitter but that's all on me.

Service was better than most dessert places I've been to. Unlike 100% a couple blocks away, I didn't feel like I was being given attitude or being ignored.

This place felt more like a hangout spot than a cute dessert place (like 100%). There's an old TV in the back, card games (like monopoly deal), and connect 4 game (we played it!). We only checked this place out just because we wanted to try a new dessert place but among my favorite dessert place lists, this just doesn't cut it for me.

excerpts: My friend ordered; My Favorite Cafe Jellygrass Special, $6.95, and I got the Mixed Fruit w/Honeydew Juice $4.25.
Our friend hooked us up with free Eggettes!
The fruits & jellygrass blended pretty well with the eggettes.
honeydew juice.author: Tom Y.
honeydew juice.review:
I came here last week with a good friend of mine.  As it turns out one of our old middle school buddies is the owner.  WOOT! Hook it up s0n!

This is a pretty chill place for hanging out with some friends.  It's fairly spacious with plenty of tables, but it can fill up pretty quickly and soon everyone is chatting away at full volume.  The menu boasts an eclectic mix of over 120+ combos of drinks, fruits, desserts, snacks, noodle bowls as well as variety of hot dishes to please just about anyone's taste.

My friend ordered; My Favorite Cafe Jellygrass Special, $6.95, and I got the Mixed Fruit w/Honeydew Juice $4.25.  Our friend hooked us up with free Eggettes!  The fruits & jellygrass blended pretty well with the eggettes.

excerpts: honeydew juice with tapioca
is really good.
honey w/ lemon is nice when you're already desserted out.
and oh!
the egg puffs!
so good.
service is decent too.
you definitely never feel rushed to clear your table.
i'm pretty sure you could stay there from 8pm to 2
am straight
and they'd never "rush" you by putting your check on the table.
honeydew juice.author: spiff e.
honeydew juice.review: let's go to my favorite cafe!  that never gets old.  anyway, desserts here are great when i can drag my friends away from the bars.  mango pudding is good.  honeydew juice with tapioca is really good.  honey w/ lemon is nice when you're already desserted out.  and oh!  the egg puffs!  so good.  service is decent too.  you definitely never feel rushed to clear your table.  i'm pretty sure you could stay there from 8pm to 2am straight and they'd never "rush" you by putting your check on the table.

excerpts: I also ordered a cup of Watermelon juice.
For $3.50, the watermelon chunks is pureed into a juice.
Eh...
okay,
but bland.
The drink wasn't too exciting.
My drink: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VxT3LXwPdHEz1qpXeI5hig?select=FoOrNTlZ36XAjhoqWZWyuwexciting but did the job.
watermelon juice.author: Matt G.
watermelon juice.review:
I'm not a big fan of most Hong Kong-style cafés and restaurants. Some of the places can be a haphazard. 

But this place is okay. The café serve appetizers, noodle and rice dishes, blended beverages and other sweet and savory treats made from fresh ingredients. 

I do like the late closing hours, which conveniently fit my frequent graveyard schedule. I was here last night (Tuesday night) for my lunch at 11:30pm and ordered #33: the Club Sandwich. For $5.95, the café's version had turkey, ham, eggs, lettuce, tomato, and bacon in three-toasted bread. I also get a pile of fries with the sandwich. This is not a http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VxT3LXwPdHEz1qpXeI5hig?select=_BbmMSXgtyPln_6H3Yh77gbad sandwich and the price isn't bad either. Club sandwich: 

I also ordered a cup of Watermelon juice. For $3.50, the watermelon chunks is pureed into a juice. Eh...okay, but bland. The drink wasn't too exciting. My drink: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VxT3LXwPdHEz1qpXeI5hig?select=FoOrNTlZ36XAjhoqWZWyuwexciting but did the job. Drink: 

The workers were very nice. Many of the younger patrons were having fun in the café. 

Despite being twice the age of many of the younger crowds, I do enjoy my time here.

excerpts: Their watermelon juice is really refreshing.
But if you get a mixed fruit concoction - I advise to ask for less ice.
watermelon juice.author: Jenna L.
watermelon juice.review:
I thought the french toast w/ ham and cheese was just okay. I do like their sweet dinner rolls w/ condense milk :D

Their watermelon juice is really refreshing. But if you get a mixed fruit concoction - I advise to ask for less ice. It's mainly ice and very little fruit. 

Milk tea is not that sweet, so maybe ask for sugar on the side ;)

excerpts: They had cold dessert selections such as ice cream and the regular watermelon juice with sago and mixed fruits.
Hot desserts such as hot red bean soup (which i got) and dun don.
They also have specialty desserts such as mango with flat rice noodles which I thought was kind of weird.
There was an atomic ice cream bowl or something and our guy friends HAD to order that for the girls.
It came with a scoop of green tea ice cream, chocolate, strawberry, mango, and I think the last was vanilla.
We totally couldn't finish that.
It was TOO big and too much.
Even the guys couldn't finish the rest.
Everything was pretty okay.
Nothing really to wow about
but then again I'm not really a big fan of Asian desserts.
Probably a good place to just sit and have dessert with a couple of friends.
watermelon juice.author: Tracy A.
watermelon juice.review:
I came in on a Tuesday night with a few friends around 10:30pm and the place was packed. I wanted to go to a new dessert place since we always go to Golden Island, Creations, or Kowloon Tong Dessert. 

Since it was a cold rainy night I wanted to get something hot. The menu was huge. They had cold dessert selections such as ice cream and the regular watermelon juice with sago and mixed fruits. Hot desserts such as hot red bean soup (which i got) and dun don. They also have specialty desserts such as mango with flat rice noodles which I thought was kind of weird. They also have milk tea pudding which sounded pretty good but I needed something HOT. Everything on the menu was mostly under $4-5. 

They also had cake choices and that night they had tiramisu and cheesecake. There was an atomic ice cream bowl or something and our guy friends HAD to order that for the girls. It came with a scoop of green tea ice cream, chocolate, strawberry, mango, and I think the last was vanilla. We totally couldn't finish that. It was TOO big and too much. Even the guys couldn't finish the rest. Everything was pretty okay. Nothing really to wow about but then again I'm not really a big fan of Asian desserts. Probably a good place to just sit and have dessert with a couple of friends. You know those kind of places where you can sit and have long conversations and catch up with one another. 

**Note: There's a sign near the register that says they charge 10 cents for a to-go box.**

excerpts: Our favorites include ramen/udon noodles with spam and egg (it's hard to explain the phenomenon on why it's better when you buy ramen noodles instead of making it at home yourself), chow mein noodles, egg puffs, watermelon juice with tapioca, bread puffs with sweet sauce, and mango with ice cream and pudding.
watermelon juice.author: Kathy L.
watermelon juice.review:
I haven't found a better dessert cafe yet. They open until 2AM on Friday and Saturdays which helps when my friends and I aren't yet ready to turn in. Our favorites include ramen/udon noodles with spam and egg (it's hard to explain the phenomenon on why it's better when you buy ramen noodles instead of making it at home yourself), chow mein noodles, egg puffs, watermelon juice with tapioca, bread puffs with sweet sauce, and mango with ice cream and pudding. 

The servers are inarticulate and get confused some of the times, but the owner of the place is very gracious and nice. This place continues to cater to our habitual late night hang outs, hilarious conversations, obnoxious laughs, and such.

excerpts: #86 Mango Delight is just another, simpler & similar version of #110 Mixed Fruit w/ Mango Juice.
The only difference is #86 is $0.25 more, doesn't have extra fruit, and is a bit sour due to some citrus pulps mixed into it.
Go for #110 instead; it's more worth it and is more colorful too!
mango juice.author: Priscilla W.
mango juice.review:
My friends and I came here around 3PM, and there was only about four other people inside. There was only one waitress, and she was pretty nice. Our orders didn't take too long, but it didn't come in a flash either. My Favorite Cafe has a huge menu with over 150 different selections but with only few pictures to catch my eye. The good thing is that those pictures are really what you see, unlike those on the TV dinner boxes.

#86 Mango Delight is just another, simpler & similar version of #110 Mixed Fruit w/ Mango Juice. The only difference is #86 is $0.25 more, doesn't have extra fruit, and is a bit sour due to some citrus pulps mixed into it. Go for #110 instead; it's more worth it and is more colorful too! I should have tried the Milk Tea Pudding instead... maybe next time. They give you complimentary tea too, in a plastic cup that shouldn't be used to serve hot drinks.

excerpts: "Can I try the coconut milk and mango juice w/aloe, please?"
Who would have thought mango juice and coconut milk would taste soooo good together!
Every sip I took, chunks of aloe and fresh mango traveled up my straw and went inside my mouth.
Man, oh man, that drink was delicious!
mango juice.author: B B.
mango juice.review:
You are NOT my favorite cafe.  

As I'm looking at the "cold drink" menu, I ask the worker....

Me:  "Do you have any cold taro drinks?"

Worker: "No. But we have this....."
 *points to milk tea, ovaltine and some other drinks that don't interest me..*

*I'm thinking "WTF?! I don't want that sh*t! I asked for taro!"*

Me: "Can I try the coconut milk and mango juice w/aloe, please?"

He takes my order and starts making my drink. As I'm waiting, guess what I noticed on their "Hot Dessert" menu? Taro with tapioca for $3.50. Dammit. It was already too late to change my order! Maybe next time...

Even though they didn't have taro tea w/boba, the drink I ordered filled my heart with joy. Didn't have my camera but I believe this is the same drink: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VxT3LXwPdHEz1qpXeI5hig?select=CgpsYx1dwOp-YuZ9yavKYg Who would have thought mango juice and coconut milk would taste soooo good together! Every sip I took, chunks of aloe and fresh mango traveled up my straw and went inside my mouth. Man, oh man, that drink was delicious! Totally worth the $3.95!    

I've passed this place 10 billions times. Today was the first time I actually went inside. I'm glad I did because they actually have some tasty looking desserts here! They also have food! Btw, they're open til 2am on Fri-Sat. Guess where I'll be going after a night of drinking. Yup, that's right... "My Favorite Cafe" which is NOT my favorite cafe. But I'll definitely be back. =P

excerpts: Mixed Fruit with Tapicoa and Mango Juice -
This was much better.
The mango juice was very sugary but had a nice, thick mango puree consistency.
mango juice.author: Julia T.
mango juice.review:
I love late night dining, especially if it's sweets! I had a huge craving for desserts last Saturday night and off we went to My Favorite Cafe! I thought this name was pretty conceited and I was ready to prove them wrong (or right). We walked in and it wasn't crowded, just two other groups of people. Immediately I noticed the awkward dim lighting and messy tables. I would think since it's not that crowded, they would try to clean up a bit. We sat down at the least dirtiest table since no one told us where to sit. A server girl came to wipe it down and got crumbs on me. =/ All I thought was, food better be good! 

Milk Tea Pudding - I saw a delicious looking picture of this on yelp so I already knew I was going to order this. I love milk tea! And I love pudding. But I barely even liked this dish. It was very bland, tasted like no flavor jello but with the slightest hint of tea. The condensed milk and chocolate shavings on top was a good effort but that ran out quick. 

Mixed Fruit with Tapicoa and Mango Juice - This was much better. The mango juice was very sugary but had a nice, thick mango puree consistency. Tapioca and fruit is usually a good combo. 

Onion Rings - This was run of the mill and was a small portion served on a tiny plate. I'd say maybe seven rings? They didn't even offer us ketchup. 

There are a lot of other places I want to try so I doubt I'll be back here again. I do recommend coming here or to any dessert cafes with a bigger group so you can try more things without looking like a total fatty.

excerpts: w/ Mango juice and sago which is one of my primary dishes isn't as good as the one I get at Kowloon.
They over do it with the sago/tapioca, whatever you prefer to call it and my last visit, our tea's tasted straight outta the faucet tap water status...it was disgusting.
Service is nice though and only reason it's staying at a 4 stars for me is cause of service and the desserts I like there.
mango juice.author: Sean E.
mango juice.review: This place is pretty good and has it's desserts but I still prefer Kowloon Tong along 7th and Geary anyday. I'll go here once in awhile for their desserts though since they have different ways in serving from what I get in Kowloon and their Sesame paste with Milk custard which is delicious! The mango Ice Cream pudding is well worth with how much you get. The mixed fruits w/ Mango juice and sago which is one of my primary dishes isn't as good as the one I get at Kowloon. They over do it with the sago/tapioca, whatever you prefer to call it and my last visit, our tea's tasted straight outta the faucet tap water status...it was disgusting. Service is nice though and only reason it's staying at a 4 stars for me is cause of service and the desserts I like there.

excerpts: Half a Papaya, and Fresh Strawberry Juice.
strawberry juice.author: Eleanor E.
strawberry juice.review:
My best friend and I decided to go to a dessert cafe after our shift at work.  Our first choice was so packed and busy that we decided to find a different spot and stumbled upon this cafe.

The place looked a little bigger than our primary choice and it wasn't as busy.  The menus were laid down nicely on the tables and the women working seemed nice.

A lot of the food on the menu sounded REALLY GOOD.  I wanted to order just about everything but I resorted to the Steamed Rice Noodles, Snow Frog w/ Half a Papaya, and Fresh Strawberry Juice.

The juice was fantastic, I love strawberries and I loved that they even carry such a thing on their menu.  Steamed rice noodles always taste delicious, I love that it's served with sriracha.  And the Snow Frog w/Half Papaya was pretty good... The ice cream melts pretty fast but it's super fulfilling.

It's definitely a place we both would come back to to try out more food :D

excerpts: gotta try the nutella french toast... love the milk tea pudding... love the black sticky rice with coconut milk.. love the strawberry madness... love the oreo milkshake.. love the strawberry juice...
I like everything...
strawberry juice.author: s d.
strawberry juice.review:
I think I've tried everything on the menu... seriously they should give me a membership card....

No.44 (dry noodles with chicken wings, beef and soup) is my favorite.
gotta try the nutella french toast... love the milk tea pudding... love the black sticky rice with coconut milk.. love the strawberry madness... love the oreo milkshake.. love the strawberry juice... I like everything... it's definitely my favorite cafe.

the only thing I don't like... parking is a pain in da butt.

excerpts: I ordered mixed fruits sago w/ strawberry juice.
The juice part of it tasted good.
I think there's some sugar  or syrup in the 'strawberry juice' b/c not all strawberries are sweet.
The papaya and some mango pieces tasted funny..
It tasted bitter!
like the bad rotten kind...
but I ate it anyway?
Some of the sago was gooey..
strawberry juice.author: Jay Z.
strawberry juice.review:
I ordered mixed fruits sago w/ strawberry juice. The juice part of it tasted good. I think there's some sugar  or syrup in the 'strawberry juice' b/c not all strawberries are sweet. The papaya and some mango pieces tasted funny.. It tasted bitter! like the bad rotten kind...but I ate it anyway? Some of the sago was gooey.. Not enough juice with the sago dessert.

The seasame eggettes are good! I'd prefer eggettes to be a bit soft, not crunchy.

They have lots of interesting desserts & snacks.

Free tea..free lollipops.

excerpts: I ordered the Fish Balls with Radish and Pigskin but minus the pigskin and a Papaya Milk.
The Fish Balls took almost 10 minutes for it come out.
And when I tasted it, felt like something was definitely missing from the soup base.
I couldn't put my finger on it but definitely could've been better.
The Papaya Milk?
Way
TOO much milk and not enough papaya.
It was so creamy looking and not even orange-ish looking in color.
It was horrible and tasted mostly of milk and barely a hint of papaya.
YUCK!
Mind you
I was still semi-hungry, having just gotten out of night class.
papaya milk.author: Linda X.
papaya milk.review:
I use to come here a lot about 2 years ago? I haven't been back since. So it's been awhile ...

First off the girls don't really pay much attention to you unless you own a freaking penis! And mind you I was with 4 guys and still crap service..geez.

I ordered the Fish Balls with Radish and Pigskin but minus the pigskin and a Papaya Milk. The Fish Balls took almost 10 minutes for it come out. And when I tasted it, felt like something was definitely missing from the soup base. I couldn't put my finger on it but definitely could've been better. The Papaya Milk? Way TOO much milk and not enough papaya. It was so creamy looking and not even orange-ish looking in color. It was horrible and tasted mostly of milk and barely a hint of papaya. YUCK! Mind you I was still semi-hungry, having just gotten out of night class. So I ordered a Luncheon Meat and Egg sandwich. That was the only reason I gave this place 3 stars. It was great *smiles*. Soft bread crispy spam and eggs prepared just the way I like it. *thumbs up*

excerpts: My strawberry milkshake came back a mango milkshake..
I wondered why it was orange...
Oh well, I let it go and drank it,
strawberry milkshake.author: Diana R.
strawberry milkshake.review:
I remember this place when it was an Asian bakery. And then chinese takeout. and then empty. And before that it was another bakery. Umm thats what happens when you live across the street.. This has been one of the longest opened spots in that physical location for a LONG time..  

I decided to play it safe and didn't get any fancy looking drink or dessert. I'm adventurous but not crazy and without my asian besties with me, I had no guidance. 

My strawberry milkshake came back a mango milkshake.. I wondered why it was orange... Oh well, I let it go and drank it, really good and cold but uhh super sugary and not strawberry..

My friend had a bowl of some snacky noodles covered in sesame seeds. Looked good, and tasted great! Til you get to the surprise flavoring at the end. Not quite sure how to put it but it's almost like when you have a diet soda and don't realize it til you have the chemical- like aftertaste. yay? umm nay. I liked the noodles til the last bite. Seeing as how nothing else is really open in the neighborhood anymore and we're both lazy and this place was literally 20 feet away from us both, it was a good late night choice. I'll go back if i have to, service was fine, lots of people and there was a sports recap going on but... we'll see.

excerpts: My strawberry milkshake came back a mango milkshake..
I wondered why it was orange...
Oh well, I let it go and drank it,
mango milkshake.author: Diana R.
mango milkshake.review:
I remember this place when it was an Asian bakery. And then chinese takeout. and then empty. And before that it was another bakery. Umm thats what happens when you live across the street.. This has been one of the longest opened spots in that physical location for a LONG time..  

I decided to play it safe and didn't get any fancy looking drink or dessert. I'm adventurous but not crazy and without my asian besties with me, I had no guidance. 

My strawberry milkshake came back a mango milkshake.. I wondered why it was orange... Oh well, I let it go and drank it, really good and cold but uhh super sugary and not strawberry..

My friend had a bowl of some snacky noodles covered in sesame seeds. Looked good, and tasted great! Til you get to the surprise flavoring at the end. Not quite sure how to put it but it's almost like when you have a diet soda and don't realize it til you have the chemical- like aftertaste. yay? umm nay. I liked the noodles til the last bite. Seeing as how nothing else is really open in the neighborhood anymore and we're both lazy and this place was literally 20 feet away from us both, it was a good late night choice. I'll go back if i have to, service was fine, lots of people and there was a sports recap going on but... we'll see.

excerpts: The mango milkshake tasted weird
and I cannot really describe the taste.
mango milkshake.author: Joseph F.
mango milkshake.review:
I ordered the:

Mango Milkshake-$3.99

Egg Puffs- I do not remember how much they cost. 

The mango milkshake tasted weird and I cannot really describe the taste. It may have been too sweet or the mango ice cream they used was not good. The fresh mangos and the whipcream they put in was good though.

The egg puffs were good, crispy on the outside and soft and chewy on the inside. 

I also tried some of the Strawberry Madness. It had fresh strawberries, strawberry ice cream, and it all sits on top of strawberry jello. It tasted good, but it was hard to eat because everything sat on top of the jello.

excerpts: We ordered the Nutella french toast, deep friend banana with ice cream, chicken sandwich, green tea milkshake, &this one mango sago drink.
The food was pretty good & was reasonably cheap.
We spent a little bit less than $25 on everything.
green tea milkshake.author: BrendaJoy G.
green tea milkshake.review:
Yesterday was the first time I came in here. A friend &I came here in the afternoon, so there weren't much customers. We ordered the Nutella french toast, deep friend banana with ice cream, chicken sandwich, green tea milkshake, &this one mango sago drink. The food was pretty good & was reasonably cheap. We spent a little bit less than $25 on everything. The service was a little slow, but really friendly.

I have yet to explore the rest of their menu &I am forsure coming back if I crave any Asian desserts.

excerpts: Oh, and their oreo cookie milkshake here is yum!!
Quite a while back when I was still in school
(feeling old...), my classmate met me here for a snack and study session.

I recommended the shake and my friend did not concentrate on anything I was trying to teach him until he was done - like, it had to be in his stomach or he'd be constantly reaching for (or eyeing) it.
Lol.

Oh, and maybe it was because they were not busy at the time, but they never rushed us off - pretty sure the two of us stayed for around two hours because we had a big test to study for and all we really ordered was a meal (I was starving) and a shake
oreo cookie milkshake.author: Christina L.
oreo cookie milkshake.review:
I feel like this place doesn't get enough recognition. Sure, it isn't the BEST food around town, but it's fairly decent as far as Asian desserts/munchies go. 

This is MY go-to place for a good club sandwich with fries on my lazy days. Who wants to go home from a bad day to have no food around and/or you have to cook?! 

Oh, and their oreo cookie milkshake here is yum!! Quite a while back when I was still in school (feeling old...), my classmate met me here for a snack and study session. I recommended the shake and my friend did not concentrate on anything I was trying to teach him until he was done - like, it had to be in his stomach or he'd be constantly reaching for (or eyeing) it. Lol. Oh, and maybe it was because they were not busy at the time, but they never rushed us off - pretty sure the two of us stayed for around two hours because we had a big test to study for and all we really ordered was a meal (I was starving) and a shake (he was trying it and loved it).

Yeah, yeah. Nothing stands out here THAT much, but it is pretty good in my opinion and they have ALWAYS been friendly to me - whether I was there, ordering to-go in-person or over the phone (there is now an extra $0.15 charge, but they give you a bag & napkins/utensils without even asking you), or just plain walking by. 

I live nearby and I hate how people brush them off just because nothing stands out with their food and whatnot. They are good people with pretty good food and a pleasant environment. That's all there is to it. ^-^

excerpts: Half a Papaya, and Fresh Strawberry Juice.
fresh strawberry juice.author: Eleanor E.
fresh strawberry juice.review:
My best friend and I decided to go to a dessert cafe after our shift at work.  Our first choice was so packed and busy that we decided to find a different spot and stumbled upon this cafe.

The place looked a little bigger than our primary choice and it wasn't as busy.  The menus were laid down nicely on the tables and the women working seemed nice.

A lot of the food on the menu sounded REALLY GOOD.  I wanted to order just about everything but I resorted to the Steamed Rice Noodles, Snow Frog w/ Half a Papaya, and Fresh Strawberry Juice.

The juice was fantastic, I love strawberries and I loved that they even carry such a thing on their menu.  Steamed rice noodles always taste delicious, I love that it's served with sriracha.  And the Snow Frog w/Half Papaya was pretty good... The ice cream melts pretty fast but it's super fulfilling.

It's definitely a place we both would come back to to try out more food :D

excerpts:
"
 *points to milk tea, ovaltine and some other drinks that don't interest me..
ovaltine.author: B B.
ovaltine.review:
You are NOT my favorite cafe.  

As I'm looking at the "cold drink" menu, I ask the worker....

Me:  "Do you have any cold taro drinks?"

Worker: "No. But we have this....."
 *points to milk tea, ovaltine and some other drinks that don't interest me..*

*I'm thinking "WTF?! I don't want that sh*t! I asked for taro!"*

Me: "Can I try the coconut milk and mango juice w/aloe, please?"

He takes my order and starts making my drink. As I'm waiting, guess what I noticed on their "Hot Dessert" menu? Taro with tapioca for $3.50. Dammit. It was already too late to change my order! Maybe next time...

Even though they didn't have taro tea w/boba, the drink I ordered filled my heart with joy. Didn't have my camera but I believe this is the same drink: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VxT3LXwPdHEz1qpXeI5hig?select=CgpsYx1dwOp-YuZ9yavKYg Who would have thought mango juice and coconut milk would taste soooo good together! Every sip I took, chunks of aloe and fresh mango traveled up my straw and went inside my mouth. Man, oh man, that drink was delicious! Totally worth the $3.95!    

I've passed this place 10 billions times. Today was the first time I actually went inside. I'm glad I did because they actually have some tasty looking desserts here! They also have food! Btw, they're open til 2am on Fri-Sat. Guess where I'll be going after a night of drinking. Yup, that's right... "My Favorite Cafe" which is NOT my favorite cafe. But I'll definitely be back. =P

excerpts: cream(you can choose vanilla, chocolate, green tea(?) and strawberry(?)) and it came with a mix of cantaloupe, honey dew and watermelon fruit balls.
chocolate.author: Grace Anne D.
chocolate.review:
After getting some sushi, I immediately started craving for some fruit so I yelped on what was nearby and I found this place. 

This area in San Francisco is filled with little mom and pop shops, hidden hole-in-the-wall's, just overall great foodie places that I've seen so far. This place wasn't amazing looking inside but the dessert we received made up for it.

I ordered their fried banana ice cream with a side of fruit. They have tons of items to choose from and traditional Chinese desserts. There weren't many people inside at the time,(probably due to the windy weather), so it didn't take too long to get our food. They have a TV planted on the wall so we watched some wrestling in Spanish. The fried banana and ice cream comes with 2 scoops of ice cream(you can choose vanilla, chocolate, green tea(?) and strawberry(?)) and it came with a mix of cantaloupe, honey dew and watermelon fruit balls. The fried bananas were delicious and not doused in heavy batter which other places tend to do. 

The service was good too. The guy who helped us out was very friendly and welcoming. :) definitely coming back for more desserts !

excerpts: My group saw the egg puffs on the menu so we decided to order the original and the chocolate flavored one.
Overall, at My Favorite Cafe, I like their drinks and desserts.
The food menu could be a bit better.
chocolate.author: Amy H.
chocolate.review: Reasonable prices. The noodle soup was ok, a bit bland. The matcha/green tea shake and hoikaddo milk tea was really good. My group saw the egg puffs on the menu so we decided to order the original and the chocolate flavored one. Overall, at My Favorite Cafe, I like their drinks and desserts. The food menu could be a bit better.

excerpts: But did you know they serve CHOCOLATE EGGPUFFS?
It's original eggpuffs, but with a chocolate chip in each puff!
chocolate.author: Kennie D.
chocolate.review:
Because I love you yelp dwellers so much.. Let me let you in on a little secret. You may already know that My Favorite Cafe serves original eggpuffs.. But did you know they serve CHOCOLATE EGGPUFFS? (I no longer saw it on the menu when I visited, but they still make it!)

No.. It's not that flavored batter thing every other place does. It's original eggpuffs, but with a chocolate chip in each puff! 

That's not your thing? Don't worry they have a menu almost as extensive as Quickly's for you to choose from! (For those unfamiliar with Quickly's, that means over a hundred items!) 

If that didn't immediately have you running to your car to check this place out.. Don't worry, take your time cause this place is opened till 2am on Fridays and Saturdays!

excerpts: and it bothers me when I see fondue spelled out as fundue, chocolate as chocalate, won-ton spelled as wan-ton...
and yet, they spelled marshmallow correctly.
chocolate.author: Carol L.
chocolate.review:
When I'm feeling blue, 
All I have to do, 
Is take a look at...

the menu at this restaurant and I'm good to go. My boyfriend and I make frequent visits when we're either wanting to have a snack or when I'm sad and need a pick-me-up. I'm a fan of the preserved veggie & pork rice noodle and the mixed fruit with coconut juice sago. Prices are reasonable, there's a large selection from savory to sweet snacks and I'm happy with the service too.

 I'm just not a fan of all the typos everywhere. I'm a stickler when it comes to spelling sometimes and it bothers me when I see fondue spelled out as fundue, chocolate as chocalate, won-ton spelled as wan-ton...and yet, they spelled marshmallow correctly. It's quite puzzling. 

Nevertheless, I like coming here and that's all I can say.

excerpts: And not to mention their Nutella french toast with a scoop of butter(score!), chocolate drizzle and powdered sugar on top hits the spot!!!
Their sesame paste balls are my favorite!!(make sure to drink water before you smile though.
chocolate.author: Gail M.
chocolate.review:
"You should go to my favorite cafe" Ok, where is it? "My favorite cafe" I know! But where?!"  That was my reaction when my friend told me about this place.
Hmm, where should I start? I would say this place was surprisingly good a.k.a  better than I expected! :) 
We got the mango delight which has the perfect dense and sweetness...oohh yess! You heard me! Puuurrffect sweetness!! (Yupp.. I'm talking about the mangoes too!!), egg puff-- which wasn't bad at all. Soft, moist, and has the perfect crisp on the edges. Oh! And not to mention their Nutella french toast with a scoop of butter(score!), chocolate drizzle and powdered sugar on top hits the spot!!!
Their sesame paste balls are my favorite!!(make sure to drink water before you smile though. Sesame paste and your teeth are BFFs..lol) and since mozzarella sticks were phased out at Jack in the Box and McDonald's is nowhere to be found in  the area, this place actually serves good fries and mozzarella sticks. :)

However, on the negative side,  you (most of the time ) have to waive your hand to get the server's attention.  Other than that,  it's worth a try! :)

excerpts:
Strawberry
Vanilla
Chocolate
Green Tea
Mango
Coconut Pineapple
chocolate.author: Jason H.
chocolate.review:
3.0 Stars

Once you get seated at My Favorite Cafe you have a nice, hot cut of tea waiting for you. It's a great place to catch up with friends in a cozy, non-rushed environment. I find this placed fully packed especially on Friday and Saturday nights. My advice is to come in a little earlier to secure a seat.

My Favorite Cafe offers a wide array of HK style desserts, HK style drinks, tapioca, noodles, and sandwiches. In terms of HK style desserts you can expect to find the Steamed Egg Custard and the HK Style Egg Puff amongst other popular desserts.

The night I went I wasn't in the mood for any HK style dessert so I went with #96) Ice Cream ($2.50). I know, it's very original. It comes with two scoops and you can pick from the following flavors below. There could have been more, but these are the ones I do remember.

Strawberry
Vanilla
Chocolate
Green Tea
Mango
Coconut Pineapple

I picked Coconut Pineapple and Strawberry and the Strawberry was way better. The Coconut Pineapple had an interesting flavor that was a little tart. This could have been from the pineapple flavoring. I would have enjoyed it more if it was strictly coconut.

The service was pretty decent and the servers made sure to refill our tea cups when they were empty.

Bring that hard earned green paper, because this place is CASH only.

excerpts:
Many come here in hopes of satisfying a sweet tooth but will find the menu is copious in options and a light savory meal can come before the sweet stuff

Half the menu showcases a range of delicious pudding and icecream combinations of various fruit flavors as well as traditional chocolate & vanilla, or vanilla bean ;)
chocolate.author: Myrtle M.
chocolate.review:
Me: Where are we going?
Friend: My Favorite Cafe!

Curious to see my friends favorite cafe we get there and I go "Ohhhh it's called My Favorite Cafe"  Yeah, Yeah, I'm sure there's ten other reviews that say the same thing but what's funny is after a frequenting the place it's literally become my favorite cafe :p

Perfect place to go when seeking a humble bite to eat at unreasonable hours. Many come here in hopes of satisfying a sweet tooth but will find the menu is copious in options and a light savory meal can come before the sweet stuff

Half the menu showcases a range of delicious pudding and icecream combinations of various fruit flavors as well as traditional chocolate & vanilla, or vanilla bean ;)

The prices are so cheap you can order 5 desserts and dry ramen with friend chicken for under $20.00 

Parking is abundant and service is swift and friendly, the owner has a big heart as you may find that he gives extra or more than the standard portion

excerpts: The ones that we love to order are egg buffs (vanilla and chocolate are good) and ice cream (2 scopes that can feed 2 kids at $2.50).
chocolate.author: Roserrele W.
chocolate.review:
I like to bring my kids to this place because it is easy to grab a table. This place used to be always full especially after dinner time. I remember that I have always need to go somewhere else because the waiting line was just unbeliveably long some years ago. Now, this place is on the downslope because of the challenge of 100% Sweet which is only a few blocks away.

Honestly, not every item in My Favorite Cafe is good. Some are really suck such as the HK Style Waffle. Firstly, the waffle itself is so chewy like plastic. The original HK style waffle should be fluffy and light. Secondly, the waffle is round in shape while the original is square. Thirdly, the filling is not the same. It should be some condensed sweeten milk, peanut butter, shredded coconut and sugar.

The sweet soups are mostly okay, not great. I have tried red bean soup, tofu soup, sesame soup and they are just okay. I would expect more and am able to find better ones elsewhere.

The ones that we love to order are egg buffs (vanilla and chocolate are good) and ice cream (2 scopes that can feed 2 kids at $2.50). Chicken wings are fine and noodles are okay, not big in portion.

We come here because of convenience and the fact that no waiting is required. Parking is a bit difficult in the neighborhood. We always need to park a few blocks away. But, it is a good gathering place for friends and we would come back again.

excerpts: The condensed milk and chocolate shavings on top was a good effort but that ran out quick.
chocolate.author: Julia T.
chocolate.review:
I love late night dining, especially if it's sweets! I had a huge craving for desserts last Saturday night and off we went to My Favorite Cafe! I thought this name was pretty conceited and I was ready to prove them wrong (or right). We walked in and it wasn't crowded, just two other groups of people. Immediately I noticed the awkward dim lighting and messy tables. I would think since it's not that crowded, they would try to clean up a bit. We sat down at the least dirtiest table since no one told us where to sit. A server girl came to wipe it down and got crumbs on me. =/ All I thought was, food better be good! 

Milk Tea Pudding - I saw a delicious looking picture of this on yelp so I already knew I was going to order this. I love milk tea! And I love pudding. But I barely even liked this dish. It was very bland, tasted like no flavor jello but with the slightest hint of tea. The condensed milk and chocolate shavings on top was a good effort but that ran out quick. 

Mixed Fruit with Tapicoa and Mango Juice - This was much better. The mango juice was very sugary but had a nice, thick mango puree consistency. Tapioca and fruit is usually a good combo. 

Onion Rings - This was run of the mill and was a small portion served on a tiny plate. I'd say maybe seven rings? They didn't even offer us ketchup. 

There are a lot of other places I want to try so I doubt I'll be back here again. I do recommend coming here or to any dessert cafes with a bigger group so you can try more things without looking like a total fatty.

excerpts: It came with a scoop of green tea ice cream, chocolate, strawberry, mango, and I think the last was vanilla.
We totally couldn't finish that.
It was TOO big and too much.
Even the guys couldn't finish the rest.
Everything was pretty okay.
Nothing really to wow about
but then again I'm not really a big fan of Asian desserts.
Probably a good place to just sit and have dessert with a couple of friends.
chocolate.author: Tracy A.
chocolate.review:
I came in on a Tuesday night with a few friends around 10:30pm and the place was packed. I wanted to go to a new dessert place since we always go to Golden Island, Creations, or Kowloon Tong Dessert. 

Since it was a cold rainy night I wanted to get something hot. The menu was huge. They had cold dessert selections such as ice cream and the regular watermelon juice with sago and mixed fruits. Hot desserts such as hot red bean soup (which i got) and dun don. They also have specialty desserts such as mango with flat rice noodles which I thought was kind of weird. They also have milk tea pudding which sounded pretty good but I needed something HOT. Everything on the menu was mostly under $4-5. 

They also had cake choices and that night they had tiramisu and cheesecake. There was an atomic ice cream bowl or something and our guy friends HAD to order that for the girls. It came with a scoop of green tea ice cream, chocolate, strawberry, mango, and I think the last was vanilla. We totally couldn't finish that. It was TOO big and too much. Even the guys couldn't finish the rest. Everything was pretty okay. Nothing really to wow about but then again I'm not really a big fan of Asian desserts. Probably a good place to just sit and have dessert with a couple of friends. You know those kind of places where you can sit and have long conversations and catch up with one another. 

**Note: There's a sign near the register that says they charge 10 cents for a to-go box.**

excerpts: I told her I had lived in HK for 3.5 years, and never heard of this dish; but I'd be willing to try it, if only they had chocolate filling.
She said of course they have chocolate, so I said, "good, give me a chocolate".
Very disappointing to discover, at home, that it was NOT chocolate, but some gooey, tasteless yellowish paste filling.
I reminded her that I was the guy here, late last night, ordering a chocolate waffle - but she gave me the standard item, instead.
Her response: you ordered the standard.
I figured I could handle that, in the future, so I said, give me a chocolate, now.
I figured they would at least discount it.
But she charged me full price.
As she came back from the kitchen, I saw a sign, flat on the counter: "To-go" orders, $0.15 extra charge.
I thought,  they have to be kidding; to-go is cheaper for them.
How can they charge extra for it?
So I asked her if she was charging me extra.
chocolate.author: Ken M.
chocolate.review:
Great, I thought: a good place that's open late, for desserts, within walking distance of my home.  I'll come here, often. Was I wrong!

The girl showed me a photo of a "Hong Kong waffle". It had little puffs, with different fillings in it. I told her I had lived in HK for 3.5 years, and never heard of this dish; but I'd be willing to try it, if only they had chocolate filling. She said of course they have chocolate, so I said, "good, give me a chocolate".

Very disappointing to discover, at home, that it was NOT chocolate, but some gooey, tasteless yellowish paste filling. I saved it, to take it back.

Next day, I was walking by, and went in to see the same girl. I reminded her that I was the guy here, late last night, ordering a chocolate waffle - but she gave me the standard item, instead. Her response: you ordered the standard. I reminded her of the conversation, but she was adamant. 

I figured I could handle that, in the future, so I said, give me a chocolate, now. I figured they would at least discount it. But she charged me full price. As she came back from the kitchen, I saw a sign, flat on the counter: "To-go" orders, $0.15 extra charge. I thought,  they have to be kidding; to-go is cheaper for them. How can they charge extra for it? So I asked her if she was charging me extra. She said, "of course".

At which point I told her to keep the food I had already paid for, that she was a thief, and that I won't ever be back, and that I'll tell a lot of people, on Yelp, about that place.

It's not MY favorite anything!

excerpts: The batter has to be just right, chocolate sauce, some powdered sugar sprinkled on top, and there better be some ice cream on the side (preferably green tea).
I got the waffles with ice cream and fresh fruit.
And perhaps I should have specified that I um, don't like my waffles well done.
I could hardly cut through them!
I was quite tempted to ask for a steak knife.
Could have just been a one time thing on their part, leaving the waffles cooking for too long or something.
The vanilla ice cream they served with it was nice though, and eventually got the waffles soft enough for me to cut through.
chocolate.author: Mary O.
chocolate.review:
My friend is absolutely obsessed with fried bananas.  Definitely in her top 5 foods, if not part of her Last Meal on Earth.

This wonderful cafe has them just the way she likes them, which she has explained to me in detail.  The batter has to be just right, chocolate sauce, some powdered sugar sprinkled on top, and there better be some ice cream on the side (preferably green tea).  This place fit the bill.

I got the waffles with ice cream and fresh fruit.  And perhaps I should have specified that I um, don't like my waffles well done.  I could hardly cut through them!  I was quite tempted to ask for a steak knife.  Could have just been a one time thing on their part, leaving the waffles cooking for too long or something.  The vanilla ice cream they served with it was nice though, and eventually got the waffles soft enough for me to cut through.  After about ten minutes.  

Yet still, I will go back to sample some more of their unique desserts.

excerpts: They also have chocolate chip egg puffs!
How weird is that?!
Gotta try it yourself.
chocolate.author: Jeanne L.
chocolate.review: Its just like any other Asian dessert spot.  I came with a huge group after a wedding banquet so I got to try a few other items. There's was the black sticky rice with coconut milk which was not too sweet at all and the best waffle and ice cream I've ever laid eyes on.  Overall I thought the desserts were good. I had the coconut milk with white fungus and tapioca. It was really good and don't let the name fool you.They also have chocolate chip egg puffs! How weird is that?! Gotta try it yourself.

excerpts: Food is fairly priced and has good flavor, the HK milk tea was on point and open late.
My kind of place!
milk tea.author: Hedilyn G.
milk tea.review: Food is fairly priced and has good flavor, the HK milk tea was on point and open late. My kind of place!

excerpts: The matcha/green tea shake and hoikaddo milk tea was really good.
milk tea.author: Amy H.
milk tea.review: Reasonable prices. The noodle soup was ok, a bit bland. The matcha/green tea shake and hoikaddo milk tea was really good. My group saw the egg puffs on the menu so we decided to order the original and the chocolate flavored one. Overall, at My Favorite Cafe, I like their drinks and desserts. The food menu could be a bit better.

excerpts: I wanted to try their milk tea pudding, but they were out.
Boo.
My mom wanted to try their black sesame paste, but they were also all out of that.
milk tea.author: Yvonne K.
milk tea.review:
The food is decent, but the ambience and service have a lot to be desired.

We came in around 4PM on a Saturday afternoon, looking for an afternoon delight/pick-me-up in the form of some tasty HK-style desserts. There were 6 of us, so they put us at a big table in the front next to the window. As soon as we sat down, everything felt... sticky. The table, the chairs, probably even the walls if we dared to touch them. After the worker placed the menus on the table, we literally had to peel them off.

We glanced through the menu and saw an assortment of delicious-sounding desserts. Steamed egg custard, steamed milk custard, sesame paste, egg puffs, blended fruit drinks. I wanted to try their milk tea pudding, but they were out. Boo. My mom wanted to try their black sesame paste, but they were also all out of that. But they had enough to make two servings of the steamed egg custard with sesame paste... wait, what? (They're also supposed to be open until midnight or so? And they're out of these staples already?) We shrugged and just let it go and ended up ordering two steamed egg custards with sesame paste, a mango smoothie, sesame egg puffs, and momo chacha (a dessert with taro chunks, yams, sago, and coconut milk).

As we waited, we began regretting the fact that we ordered pretty much all hot desserts. Even though the front door was open, there was zero air flow at the table we were seated at. And it was next to a window, so the sunshine that filtered in was magnified. It was like sitting in a greenhouse. We thought about asking to move, but that was their only large table, so we would all have to split up. It was a family outing, so... no dice on that.

The desserts came, and yeah, they were pretty good. (Except the mango smoothie... can someone say syrup overload?) We tried to eat as fast as we could so we wouldn't melt, but we also didn't want to burn our tongues on the hot food. Dilemmaaaaa. We eventually made it through, paid our bill, and rolled out. We interacted with the worker a total of six times: when she told us where to sit, when she set the menus down, when she took our order, when she gave us our bill, when she returned for the bill, and when she returned to give us the receipt. No friendly service here.

So, My Favorite Cafe? Not really. I would much rather go to one of the many other HK dessert shops in the Richmond area. The food here is decent, so I'm bumping them up to three stars, but the shoddy environment kills the good taste.

excerpts: My cousin got the mixed fruit with milk tea pudding.
We were both unsatisfied with the food.
My mango drink had a slushie consistency with very little coconut milk.
The aloe didn't mix well with the drink at all.
My cousin's milk tea pudding tasted really bland.
I've had their chow fun before and it was alright.
Suitable for a stomach filler but not too stimulating for the taste buds.
Service was slow even though the place was more than half empty.
Cash only!
Come here only if the other dessert places in the area are full or if you want to hang out at a more quiet Asian dessert place.
My cousin's milk tea pudding tasted really bland.
I've had their chow fun before and it was alright.
Suitable for a stomach filler but not too stimulating for the taste buds.
Service was slow even though the place was more than half empty.
Cash only!
Come here only if the other dessert places in the area are full or if you want to hang out at a more quiet Asian dessert place.
milk tea.author: Jennifer Z.
milk tea.review:
My Favorite Cafe doesn't fully live up to its name. Yes, it's a great place to hang out and catch up because of it's spacious seatings and large menu but the food isn't so great at all. 
I came here on a Friday night with my cousin and ordered the coconut milk and mango drink with aloe. My cousin got the mixed fruit with milk tea pudding. We were both unsatisfied with the food. My mango drink had a slushie consistency with very little coconut milk. The aloe didn't mix well with the drink at all. My cousin's milk tea pudding tasted really bland. I've had their chow fun before and it was alright. Suitable for a stomach filler but not too stimulating for the taste buds. 
Service was slow even though the place was more than half empty. 
Cash only! 
Come here only if the other dessert places in the area are full or if you want to hang out at a more quiet Asian dessert place.

excerpts: sat down and ordered hot milk tea.
no expression.
10 mins go by, nothing, more people came in.
she walks back and forth.
15 mins, nothing.
we ask and she said "making it".
uh ok, it's just milk tea.
we were going to order more stuff but scared that we will be there for hours without food and having to watch the horrible reality tv dating show.
after 25 mins, we finally got up and said, milk tea to go.
she finally then went into the kitchen, grads the old looking milk tea pot and starts to make our tea.
$2.60 for watery milk tea and 25 mins of our life that we will never get back.
we should have just left.
she really hates being there.
needless to say, no way we are going back.
milk tea.author: Silver C.
milk tea.review: i am surprised this place opened up again, but the owners are never happy. we came at dinner time, no one was there. sat down and ordered hot milk tea. no expression. 10 mins go by, nothing, more people came in.  she walks back and forth. 15 mins, nothing. we ask and she said "making it".  uh ok, it's just milk tea.  we were going to order more stuff but scared that we will be there for hours without food and having to watch the horrible reality tv dating show.  after 25 mins, we finally got up and said, milk tea to go.  she finally then went into the kitchen, grads the old looking milk tea pot and starts to make our tea. $2.60 for watery milk tea and 25 mins of our life that we will never get back. we should have just left.  she really hates being there.  needless to say, no way we are going back.

excerpts: The bf got milk tea, and it tasted a little off.
milk tea.author: Nari C.
milk tea.review:
More like my LEAST favorite cafe. I came at around 11pm with the bf and his sister. Service was slow, even though the place wasn't even that crowded. 

I tried #44 (instant noodle dish), and oh my gosh. Way. Too. Salty. The broth is so oily too. It's a heart attack in a plate.

The bf got milk tea, and it tasted a little off. But he loved it and said it's as authentic as it gets.

I would come back though to try their other menu items. I still have hope! :)

excerpts: Milk Tea w/boba:
Bc being a boba lover, you can't see boba on a menu and not have a try.
I still prefer Belly Good Cafe and Crepes' milk tea located in Japantown
bc
it's sweeter and creamier.
milk tea.author: Anonymous P.
milk tea.review:
This cafe has become to be a favorite for my sister, myself and even my kiddies. 

I love that this place stays open late, that their affordable (cheap, delicious eats in SF) and they even have HH tea time menu (everyday from 230pm-530pm). A bit of a drive if you're coming from the other side of town *we're from the Bayview District* but gas and money well spent when you're done. 

So far we're tried.. 

- Beef Stew Noodle Soup: Rice noodles, flavorful beef stew, cabbage in a plain broth. *Definitely needs a little see yao (soy sauce) than you're ready to dive in. 

- Soy Sauce Chicken Wings: Oh man those chicken wangs are tasty!! If you're a chicken wang person like myself and kiddies than be sure to grab an order or two!!

- French Fries: Bc they're simple to snack on and keeps my kiddies quiet for the time being while I'm trying to yelp!!

- Egg Puffs: Seems everyone has come here for their egg puffs and they don't disappoint either. They're fresh and piping hot.

- Warm Cola with Lemon: If you're a super Asian person, you know what I'm talking about. Yes folks, warm cola with a hint of lemon. 

- Milk Tea w/boba: Bc being a boba lover, you can't see boba on a menu and not have a try. *I still prefer Belly Good Cafe and Crepes' milk tea located in Japantown bc it's sweeter and creamier.* 

- Steamed Rice Rolls: Bc I LOVE my noodle dishes. Plain, tiny rice rolls, steamed of course accompanied with hoisin dipping sauce. Simple and yet satisfying. 

A absolute great place for late night cravings, whether you're craving a snack or dessert!

excerpts: I should have tried the Milk Tea Pudding instead... maybe next time.
They give you complimentary tea too, in a plastic cup that shouldn't be used to serve hot drinks.
milk tea.author: Priscilla W.
milk tea.review:
My friends and I came here around 3PM, and there was only about four other people inside. There was only one waitress, and she was pretty nice. Our orders didn't take too long, but it didn't come in a flash either. My Favorite Cafe has a huge menu with over 150 different selections but with only few pictures to catch my eye. The good thing is that those pictures are really what you see, unlike those on the TV dinner boxes.

#86 Mango Delight is just another, simpler & similar version of #110 Mixed Fruit w/ Mango Juice. The only difference is #86 is $0.25 more, doesn't have extra fruit, and is a bit sour due to some citrus pulps mixed into it. Go for #110 instead; it's more worth it and is more colorful too! I should have tried the Milk Tea Pudding instead... maybe next time. They give you complimentary tea too, in a plastic cup that shouldn't be used to serve hot drinks.

excerpts: The milk tea pudding was super bland and not sweet at all!
It did not taste anything like milk tea, and maybe had a faint tea flavour.
It comes with a tiny pot of sweet milk that you can add to it, but it really did not help.
milk tea.author: Stephanie W.
milk tea.review:
Definitely wanted to like this place, but I was pretty disappointed with the pudding I ordered. The milk tea pudding was super bland and not sweet at all! It did not taste anything like milk tea, and maybe had a faint tea flavour. It comes with a tiny pot of sweet milk that you can add to it, but it really did not help. Do not recommend this!! 

I also tried the egg puffs, which were good, and the cherng fun (rice noodles?) which were super yummy! I liked that they didn't have any of the dried shrimp in it, and it comes with a peanut butter dipping sauce. Yum yum. One of my friends also got a strawberry icecream/sundae dessert, which was pretty standard and really sweet. Someone else ordered ramen & wings, which were super greasy. I would probably stick with their desserts.

The service is pretty slow but it's open late!

excerpts: Milk tea is not that sweet, so maybe ask for sugar on the side ;)
milk tea.author: Jenna L.
milk tea.review:
I thought the french toast w/ ham and cheese was just okay. I do like their sweet dinner rolls w/ condense milk :D

Their watermelon juice is really refreshing. But if you get a mixed fruit concoction - I advise to ask for less ice. It's mainly ice and very little fruit. 

Milk tea is not that sweet, so maybe ask for sugar on the side ;)

excerpts: Best Hong Kong Style Coffee Tea & Milk Tea
milk tea.author: Chad M.
milk tea.review:
Best Hong Kong Style Coffee Tea & Milk Tea I've had in San Francisco so far...

We stopped by in the middle of the day to grab something to drink on our walk to Golden Gate Park.  The restaurant was empty when we popped in and owner made us some fresh hot drinks... They were great.

We didn't get any food but the menu definitely hooked us for a return visit.
