excerpts: I had hot milk tea.
It looked homogenous, but then turned out to be really bland.
When I got to the bottom, it was really sweet.
Why didn't they tell me to mix it?
It's not the sort of thing that you generally  have to mix.
milk tea.author: Aly A.
milk tea.review:
I came here last night in a group of people, and overall, I was disappointed.  It's definitely not my favorite cafe, and there are plenty more in the area that are much better.  That being said, I came when I was not very hungry and there were so items that I would like to try. 

I had hot milk tea.  It looked homogenous, but then turned out to be really bland.  When I got to the bottom, it was really sweet.  Why didn't they tell me to mix it?  It's not the sort of thing that you generally  have to mix.  My bf had mango pudding and fried chicken wings.  The mango pudding was good--better actually than the mango pudding at ETC, which was a disappointment.  The condensed milk on top, however, tasted a little off--like it was an old can that was in the fridge a little too long.  The chicken wings came with fries.  Fries were good, the wings were really bland, and not crispy enough.

If I came back, maybe I would try their beef noddle soup or their waffles, but definitely not my GO TO place.  Maybe I was just grumpy because I was cold...

excerpts: One of us ordered the regular, iced milk tea and thought it was the worst milk tea he had ever had.
milk tea.author: Andrew M.
milk tea.review:
Summary: Come to My Favorite Cafe if you are desperate for table space with a medium-sized group, and some members in your group are willing to sacrifice money for a meal to order unsatisfying desserts or appetizers.

Maybe we ordered the wrong items or came on a bad day, but neither of these possibilities would put My Favorite Cafe into consideration for future trips.

One of us ordered the regular, iced milk tea and thought it was the worst milk tea he had ever had.  Even the additional sweetening did not change his opinion.

The strawberry and yellow-colored vanilla ice cream that we ordered had a faint, yet unignorable taste of durian.  When we learned that durian ice cream was not even available, we could only wonder what polluted the order.

The deep fried bread balls with condensed milk was quite tasty, but at over a dollar per bite-sized piece, it was no longer tasty enough to overlook the cost.

The prices for many of their appetizers and snacks could fetch meals at other restaurants.

excerpts:
"
 *points to milk tea, ovaltine and some other drinks that don't interest me..
milk tea.author: B B.
milk tea.review:
You are NOT my favorite cafe.  

As I'm looking at the "cold drink" menu, I ask the worker....

Me:  "Do you have any cold taro drinks?"

Worker: "No. But we have this....."
 *points to milk tea, ovaltine and some other drinks that don't interest me..*

*I'm thinking "WTF?! I don't want that sh*t! I asked for taro!"*

Me: "Can I try the coconut milk and mango juice w/aloe, please?"

He takes my order and starts making my drink. As I'm waiting, guess what I noticed on their "Hot Dessert" menu? Taro with tapioca for $3.50. Dammit. It was already too late to change my order! Maybe next time...

Even though they didn't have taro tea w/boba, the drink I ordered filled my heart with joy. Didn't have my camera but I believe this is the same drink: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VxT3LXwPdHEz1qpXeI5hig?select=CgpsYx1dwOp-YuZ9yavKYg Who would have thought mango juice and coconut milk would taste soooo good together! Every sip I took, chunks of aloe and fresh mango traveled up my straw and went inside my mouth. Man, oh man, that drink was delicious! Totally worth the $3.95!    

I've passed this place 10 billions times. Today was the first time I actually went inside. I'm glad I did because they actually have some tasty looking desserts here! They also have food! Btw, they're open til 2am on Fri-Sat. Guess where I'll be going after a night of drinking. Yup, that's right... "My Favorite Cafe" which is NOT my favorite cafe. But I'll definitely be back. =P

excerpts: I liked the milk tea, but the boba was a bit too firm for my liking.
They put a good amount in the drink though.
I also tried the milk tea pudding.
The presentation was nice, but it had a weird taste that I wasn't taking a liking to.
milk tea.author: k h.
milk tea.review:
Four stars for price during happy hour tea time! The service was okay. The free tea wasn't terrible, but I only took two sips. I liked the milk tea, but the boba was a bit too firm for my liking. They put a good amount in the drink though. I loved the mango pudding, but I'm a sucker for mango pudding in general. Both items were $6 with tip so I would definitely go back. 

I don't know if they have free wifi because it wasn't posted anywhere and I felt awkward asking.

I also tried the milk tea pudding.  The presentation was nice, but it had a weird taste that I wasn't taking a liking to.  I'd rather stick to the mango pudding.  And I'm not usually a thai tea person, but they make a pretty good thai tea here.  Avoid the egg and tomato sandwich though; you could make one at home that tastes the same and is far cheaper.  I mean, only putting in two slices of tomato?  Psh.

excerpts: Milk Tea Pudding - I saw a delicious looking picture of this on yelp
so I already knew I was going to order this.
I love milk tea!
And I love pudding.
But I barely even liked this dish.
It was very bland, tasted like no flavor jello but with the slightest hint of tea.
milk tea.author: Julia T.
milk tea.review:
I love late night dining, especially if it's sweets! I had a huge craving for desserts last Saturday night and off we went to My Favorite Cafe! I thought this name was pretty conceited and I was ready to prove them wrong (or right). We walked in and it wasn't crowded, just two other groups of people. Immediately I noticed the awkward dim lighting and messy tables. I would think since it's not that crowded, they would try to clean up a bit. We sat down at the least dirtiest table since no one told us where to sit. A server girl came to wipe it down and got crumbs on me. =/ All I thought was, food better be good! 

Milk Tea Pudding - I saw a delicious looking picture of this on yelp so I already knew I was going to order this. I love milk tea! And I love pudding. But I barely even liked this dish. It was very bland, tasted like no flavor jello but with the slightest hint of tea. The condensed milk and chocolate shavings on top was a good effort but that ran out quick. 

Mixed Fruit with Tapicoa and Mango Juice - This was much better. The mango juice was very sugary but had a nice, thick mango puree consistency. Tapioca and fruit is usually a good combo. 

Onion Rings - This was run of the mill and was a small portion served on a tiny plate. I'd say maybe seven rings? They didn't even offer us ketchup. 

There are a lot of other places I want to try so I doubt I'll be back here again. I do recommend coming here or to any dessert cafes with a bigger group so you can try more things without looking like a total fatty.

excerpts: They also have milk tea pudding which sounded pretty good
but I needed something HOT.
milk tea.author: Tracy A.
milk tea.review:
I came in on a Tuesday night with a few friends around 10:30pm and the place was packed. I wanted to go to a new dessert place since we always go to Golden Island, Creations, or Kowloon Tong Dessert. 

Since it was a cold rainy night I wanted to get something hot. The menu was huge. They had cold dessert selections such as ice cream and the regular watermelon juice with sago and mixed fruits. Hot desserts such as hot red bean soup (which i got) and dun don. They also have specialty desserts such as mango with flat rice noodles which I thought was kind of weird. They also have milk tea pudding which sounded pretty good but I needed something HOT. Everything on the menu was mostly under $4-5. 

They also had cake choices and that night they had tiramisu and cheesecake. There was an atomic ice cream bowl or something and our guy friends HAD to order that for the girls. It came with a scoop of green tea ice cream, chocolate, strawberry, mango, and I think the last was vanilla. We totally couldn't finish that. It was TOO big and too much. Even the guys couldn't finish the rest. Everything was pretty okay. Nothing really to wow about but then again I'm not really a big fan of Asian desserts. Probably a good place to just sit and have dessert with a couple of friends. You know those kind of places where you can sit and have long conversations and catch up with one another. 

**Note: There's a sign near the register that says they charge 10 cents for a to-go box.**

excerpts: I got myself a hot milk tea and mixed fruit with mango pudding, since they didn't have coffee pudding.
Food came pretty quickly!
As did the food that my friends ordered.
Fries.
Egg Puffs.
Milk tea pudding.
Grass Jelly/Tapioca mixed fruit slush, thingy.
milk tea.author: Susan Y.
milk tea.review:
Came here on a Thursday night around 10:30p. Wasn't too packed. It was our 2nd choice since our first choice was full?!?! o__O" Anyway!
The server was really nice. :) Some of the stuff on the menu isn't there anymore.. So that knocked off a star. lol.
I got myself a hot milk tea and mixed fruit with mango pudding, since they didn't have coffee pudding. Food came pretty quickly! As did the food that my friends ordered. Fries. Egg Puffs. Milk tea pudding. Grass Jelly/Tapioca mixed fruit slush, thingy. Mango Ice Cream with Rainbox Jelly & Mixed Fruit... Not sure what the actual name of it was, but I'm sure it's easier to find. 
Everything was pretty awesome. And tasty. Decent prices. 
They also serve foods other than dessert, so it's pretty awesome. Gotta go back and try their other food!

excerpts: gotta try the nutella french toast... love the milk tea pudding... love the black sticky rice with coconut milk.. love the strawberry madness... love the oreo milkshake.. love the strawberry juice...
I like everything...
milk tea.author: s d.
milk tea.review:
I think I've tried everything on the menu... seriously they should give me a membership card....

No.44 (dry noodles with chicken wings, beef and soup) is my favorite.
gotta try the nutella french toast... love the milk tea pudding... love the black sticky rice with coconut milk.. love the strawberry madness... love the oreo milkshake.. love the strawberry juice... I like everything... it's definitely my favorite cafe.

the only thing I don't like... parking is a pain in da butt.

excerpts: I had some kind of rainbow milk tea with hundreds of little pearls of different colors and tastes.

The small size and texture made me feel like I was the egg and millions of sperms were trying to penetrate me to create the most beautiful baby that will be graced with my thick weave of dark curly hair.
milk tea.author: Jared S.
milk tea.review:
My Favorite Cafe will not be included in my series of reviews entitled "Places That Are Completely Empty on Friday Nights" because this place was jam packed around 9pm on Friday a few weeks ago. We were seeking some sweet goods after sushi and I remember hearing that this place was quite popular with the kids. Thinking it was similar to Quicklys where we could walk up to a counter and order our drink/snack, we were taken back when they kept asking us "how many?" implying that we needed to sit down. We checked out the menu and felt comfortable with the 200 choices so we took the only table left, in the back corner against the mirror. 

I was sick and couldn't try my friend's mango ice cream but it looked awesome. I had some kind of rainbow milk tea with hundreds of little pearls of different colors and tastes. The small size and texture made me feel like I was the egg and millions of sperms were trying to penetrate me to create the most beautiful baby that will be graced with my thick weave of dark curly hair. Although the thought of children was fun, feeling it going down my throat was not. 

The place takes cash only. If it was an awesome experience, I wouldn't have minded. But when it's only so-so, it pisses me off that they haven't joined the 21st century. I'm hypocritical and I don't care. 

I'd come back to try something else... perhaps during a less busy time. Until then, this is only My Favorite Cafe that's located between 22nd and 23rd Ave. Hopefully that title will expand to the Outer Richmond in the future.

excerpts: Nothing was mind blowing, but I did enjoy the milk tea and egg puff I had.
milk tea.author: Jeanne C.
milk tea.review:
I like this place because it is large and roomy, and there's games and a TV in the back if you so desire playing games and hanging out.

Nothing was mind blowing, but I did enjoy the milk tea and egg puff I had.

Next time I'm going to try the savory options and see how that goes.

It was soo hard for me to finish and i was really upset because this was the very first CAFE my boy friend took ME!! he also ordered a milk tea which it totally didnt even taste like milk tea, for one thing it jus tasted like raw tea and they put food coloring into the milk tea to look like milk tea i don't know..
    Well soo because i wasnt full at all, i thought maybe the deserts would taste better. My boyfriend ordered a sundae... that stuff was sooo sweet!!
  Maybe i just didn't pick the right food from this restaurant and there and hopefully next time if i DO come back to this place, i just hope it would be better. And really dont order the curry fish balls with rice noodles it is SOOOOO PLAIN!

excerpts: The milk tea pudding tastes kind of bitter and odd .
I also didn't like its texture ..
milk tea.author: Eileen L.
milk tea.review: Like I said in my review of 100% Healthy Dessert , since I've been working at a dessert place I've been paying more attention to desserts . I came here again twice a few weeks ago with my friend to try some new things . I got a pear juice which taste a little odd . I got the three colored peanut dumplings  which was WAY TOO SWEET . The B-kid Jellygrass was not sweet enough . The milk tea pudding tastes kind of bitter and odd . I also didn't like its texture .. it's mushy just like the mango pudding I ordered . The preserved pickle & sliced pork chow mein was WAY TOO SALTY . I decided to try the milk pudding because I've never had it before . It tasted very odd . Idk , maybe that's the way it's supposed to taste . The egg puffs were good though . Still like the ones at Eggette's more but the ones here are good too . This place has dropped two stars in my book . But since the owner or whoever was nice enough to read my review and tell me that he would improve things , I will give it an extra star . Also because I like the slogan for this place . Don't know what it is ? Next time you visit , read the back of the servers' shirts .

excerpts: my husband just ordered milk tea...took 45 minutes.
must have had to pluck the tea leaves, or something.
overall, my experience was less than stellar at this average dessert joint.
milk tea.author: Jenny Y.
milk tea.review: many time, there are rhymes and reasons to decisions.  i am not sure why this place has such high rankings.  perhaps, it all depends on the person working there, what time, etc.  well, i happened to go one afternoon with my husband and brother, and decided to order the milk custard with fresh fruits.  it took a good 15 minutes before the waitress came to take our order (please keep in mind that there was only one other table, and they already got their food).  when my order came, i took a bite of the cantaloupe, and literally almost hurled.  the fruit not only smelled soured, the fruits were bad.  what place of business that serves food, does not check for quality?  obviously...not my favorite cafe.  so, they switched it out, and this time, i just asked for no fruits.  the dessert was just "eh."  now get this...my husband just ordered milk tea...took 45 minutes.  must have had to pluck the tea leaves, or something.  overall, my experience was less than stellar at this average dessert joint.

excerpts: The coffee with tea was also pretty good and they put good condensed milk that was not too dense and not cold so that it did not cool down the drink.
coffee.author: T L.
coffee.review:
(See pics) Review #1204. OOO Em Gee! Best Chinese desserts I have had in San Francisco! Many had asked why I rated most similar places 3 stars. It's because I tried to compare them with those in Hong Kong.

The key of this place is not just the huge variety of desserts, but they are all prepared in scorching hot temperature. Yes, you heard me, that's the KEY for Asian food. And each one of them I tried was done extremely well.

Deep fried Chinese bun was very crispy outside and hot but not doughy inside.

Rice rolls was very soft and done just right with some firmness to it. Good they only put very little peanut sauce and separated it as a side in addition to the hot and Hoisin sauces. Very very delicious.

The steam milk custard with ginger was also steamed perfectly hot, burning tongue hot and it's so silky soft like egg white. It was also not too sweet.

The coffee with tea was also pretty good and they put good condensed milk that was not too dense and not cold so that it did not cool down the drink.

Thumbs up!

The setting is very very local and has a TV. They were playing whatever they felt like it, usually sports with friends hanging around it watching together.

excerpts: Best Hong Kong Style Coffee Tea & Milk Tea
coffee.author: Chad M.
coffee.review:
Best Hong Kong Style Coffee Tea & Milk Tea I've had in San Francisco so far...

We stopped by in the middle of the day to grab something to drink on our walk to Golden Gate Park.  The restaurant was empty when we popped in and owner made us some fresh hot drinks... They were great.

We didn't get any food but the menu definitely hooked us for a return visit.

excerpts: and my friend, more adventurous, tried the mixed fruit coffee pudding.
the milky liquid it was in tasted like water with a hint of coffee...aka bland.
The fruit was good tho.
coffee.author: Kat C.
coffee.review:
How are you NOT eating at Pho Garden right across the street?  I'll say as long as Pho Garden is nearby this cafe, it'll take alot of convincing to eat here instead BUT I'll come here for quick dessert!  I walked in thinking it was a quickie cafe where u order and leave...wasn't expecting the tables and couches near the front; nice and chill.  :)

Tried their green tea ice cream (I dont think you can go wrong...) and my friend, more adventurous, tried the mixed fruit coffee pudding.  Not a fan...

The pudding was flavorful but texture was kinda yucky...plus the milky liquid it was in tasted like water with a hint of coffee...aka bland.  The fruit was good tho.  The menu is definately out of the ordinary.  

The lady who helped us was friendly but kinda ditsy...or maybe it's cause she couldn't understand our requests.

the drinks are pretty watery and overly sweet after 3 times of visit.

good coffee pudding and steam eggs but very bad drinks.  the drinks are pretty watery and overly sweet after 3 times of visit.  It's a typical chinese dessert place where don't expect any good service but they open late so it's a good hangout spot late at night.  

I'll go back for the pudding but probably that's all.  Last time we also ordered steam rice noodles and waffle.  the waffle is nothing but the prepacked ones from grocery shop and filled with lots of cream and fruits.

excerpts: The only minor problem I had was that one time I ordered a cup of coffee with cream and sugar and the girl brought me whip cream.

Anyway, I still think this place is OK and will be returning.
coffee.author: Diane M.
coffee.review: I've been here about a half a dozen times and the food here is OK. I've only tried their desserts and have never had a meal here. You get the typical Chinese desserts that are served at other Chinese establishments. They are open late which is a plus and if you only go during the late evenings, parking isn't bad. It does get pretty loud sometimes. The only minor problem I had was that one time I ordered a cup of coffee with cream and sugar and the girl brought me whip cream. They didn't have any cream and it took a while for them to tell me or understand what I was asking for. From what I understand, they serve coffee differently. Anyway, I still think this place is OK and will be returning.

excerpts: My favorites are sago w/ coconut milk, waffle with fresh fruit and ice cream and the coffee tea.
coffee.author: Jennie N.
coffee.review: My Favorite Cafe is absloutely my favorite cafe for Chinese desserts. They have  a large selection of both savory and sweet foods. My favorites are sago w/ coconut milk, waffle with fresh fruit and ice cream and the coffee tea.

yay?

soda.author: Diana R.
soda.review:
I remember this place when it was an Asian bakery. And then chinese takeout. and then empty. And before that it was another bakery. Umm thats what happens when you live across the street.. This has been one of the longest opened spots in that physical location for a LONG time..  

I decided to play it safe and didn't get any fancy looking drink or dessert. I'm adventurous but not crazy and without my asian besties with me, I had no guidance. 

My strawberry milkshake came back a mango milkshake.. I wondered why it was orange... Oh well, I let it go and drank it, really good and cold but uhh super sugary and not strawberry..

My friend had a bowl of some snacky noodles covered in sesame seeds. Looked good, and tasted great! Til you get to the surprise flavoring at the end. Not quite sure how to put it but it's almost like when you have a diet soda and don't realize it til you have the chemical- like aftertaste. yay? umm nay. I liked the noodles til the last bite. Seeing as how nothing else is really open in the neighborhood anymore and we're both lazy and this place was literally 20 feet away from us both, it was a good late night choice. I'll go back if i have to, service was fine, lots of people and there was a sports recap going on but... we'll see.

excerpts:
It was just the right portion too.
- Creamed soda w/ milk:
My best ordered this and the girl didn't give her the milk portion of the drink.
I think she only heard cream soda and tuned out the rest because we were only charged for the cream soda.
soda.author: Serena F.
soda.review:
This place was dead when my bestie and I walked in at 11pm on a Wednesday night. We got to sit anywhere we wanted because there was no one to say anything if we sat in a table for 10. ;) Menus were placed on the table already and they were sticky. 

- Instant noodle w/ curry fish balls: I thought the only thing that was curry were the fish balls not the entire bowl of soup! This dish was far too spicy for me to stomach...and I couldn't eat it. The fish balls on the other hand was not spicy nor were they curried 
- Steamed egg custard with coconut milk: mMm...this was so good and warmed my tummy. It was just the right portion too.
- Creamed soda w/ milk: My best ordered this and the girl didn't give her the milk portion of the drink. I think she only heard cream soda and tuned out the rest because we were only charged for the cream soda.

Overall the food was not bad but you would think service would be better since we were the only ones in there...it wasn't. The girl was in her own little world. We had to holler in order to get her attention.

excerpts: I think she only heard cream soda and tuned out the rest because we were only charged for the cream soda.
cream soda.author: Serena F.
